description:
Woahhhh, mind blown! The cake lives up to the hype and is honestly so amazing. I called around 10am for them to reserve a whole toffee crunch cake for me since I know they sell out. I came around 1pm picked it up and was out in 5 minute.

The cake is sooo good. I thought the toffee would be harder but it was a nice soft crunch that added the sweetness to the sponge, whip cream cake. It wasn't overwhelmingly sweet either. It was about right. Every bite had me wanting to eat more!!! For $38 it's totally worth it. 

Unfortunately didn't get to take pics. Also, this place is inside the market, on the right side. It definitely is a mom and pop shop. Super adorable. Everybody come try it out!!! 

Tip: reserve, bring cash or money order. They do not accept card.
author: Sherluna V.

description:
Came here to get their popular coffee crunch cake. Got a whole cake for someone's birthday and make sure you call in advance. I called about 1.5 hours in advance and it was fine for me.

As someone that doesn't like coffee, I was surprised I still enjoyed the cake. The outside is where the coffee crunch is and it really does remind me of caramel. There's a great crunch with the soft inside. The coffee flavor is pretty subtle. I definitely like it more than just having a cream layer for cakes.

We had a party of 8 and only finished half the cake.
author: Victor D.

description:
Came early on a Saturday to try the famous slice. They also have chocolate and lemon crunch cakes, as well as roll cakes in [from what I saw] vanilla, mocha, strawberry, lemon (?).

Very reasonably priced at $9.50 for two slices. This cake really wins in contrast of textures -- there's a great crunch, cool creaminess, and softness of the cake. The cream isn't too sweet, and the coffee flavor of the cake is really nice.

This was probably in the top 3 of cake I've had, and the service is very friendly.
author: Dan Z.

description:
Located inside the Super Mira market, this place sells a couple items, in particular the coffee crunch cake that echos from my childhood. It's been awhile since I had a slice, and I was excited to have it...but it seemed slightly different than what I remembered. 

Although the flavor and crunch were the same, I was disappointed by the dryness of the cake. I remember it being soft and moist, not like this. The only thing I can think is that the slices are older and have been sitting there, but who knows, maybe a full custom cake will be different. But overall, this is something to try.
author: Spencer H.

description:
I finally got to try the much read about (and salivated about) coffee crunch cake from Yasukochi. I've been wanting to try this San Francisco legend for a few years now and didnt get a chance to until recently. I dont know what rock I was hiding under growing up in the city but I had never heard about coffee crunch cake when I was younger. 

Fast forward a decade or three and we are walking inside Super Mira Market to find the Sweet Stop counter (right side) and grab a slice of some cake greatness. The lady behind the counter was great. She was friendly and engaging. There were only a few slices left and 2 whole cakes so I just got one slice. There were a few people behind us in line and the slice was plenty big to be shared by 2 people so it was perfect. And I didnt wanna be greedy and get 2 slices knowing others behind may want to sample them as well. The nice lady offered us forks and it was perfect as we were taking it back to the hotel.

My first bite was a great one. It It had the coffee crunch bits, some cake, some frosting, some filling, some more cake... Delicious. The topping is quite sweet but the rest of the cake balances it out. The cake was moist and the frosting was tasty. It was a perfect slice of cake IMO. It's all about the coffee crunch topping of course. It was like a crunchy, deep caramel flavor of a topping. The sides of a whole cake are also covered in this crunchy goodness. It's unique and really something to behold. I cant imagine a whole cake... That is something that would make a party for sure. 

You gotta try it. One of the iconic desserts of San Francisco they said... I listened. 

Cash only.
author: Chuck D.

description:
Coffee Crunch Cake

I was looking for this shop for a short while after parking. It's located inside of the Super Mira Market. I always seem to skip reading the part about location when I'm reading reviews. 

The lady behind the bakery said her husbands been baking the same cake or 60 years. I LOVE IT. The toffee in the coffee crunch cake is SO delicious. The cake itself is light and fluffy. It's not overly sweet which is very surprising. 

They sell out of slices early in the day. We got here at noon and there were no slices left. We had to at least try the cake so we bought a whole one. They won't slice it for you but they will box it up with their baker twine. The market has a little sitting area but they also won't let you sit inside the market to eat the cake unless you bought hot foods from the kitchen in the back. 

We took the cake across the street, cut it with the twine provided, and dug in. Delicious.
author: Marlene T.

description: I would call ahead and reserve a slice or a whole cake, whatever is your fancy. But I've stopped by a few times, just when I'm in the area, hoping they have their famous coffee crunch cake but nope, all sold out. The one time I've gotten to try it, I just reserved one a couple days ahead of time. It's $4.75 for a slice. It's a decent size slice. I walked in and paid and they had it all nicely packaged for me and tied with a bow. It was easy peasy when you pre-order. Cake was delicious. Just a subtle taste of coffee. Outside is sticky and crunchy and yummy. Cake was moist and there was just the right amount of frosting. I could see getting a whole cake for someone's birthday so everyone can enjoy. It was really good. And they've been in business for 44 years this year. Hope they're around for 44 more.
author: Alison W.

description:
Ive been wanting to try this Coffee Crunch Cake but unfortunately I have no luck every time I go here... But teo days before my Bday I able to buy a whole   All I can say is the Hype is RealSo far the best cake I have tried in SF... The chiffon cake is very fluffy and everything on it compliments the entire experience of eating Coffee Crunch  
I definitely recommend this to anyone who visit Jspantown in SF. A hidden gem in SF JTown.
author: Mikoyan C.

description:
I finally, finally got the chance to shoot over here and try the famous coffee crunch cake. Google it for more info.

Frankly, I had low expectations b/c coffee is not my thing. I went the day previous and they had sold out of individual slices and I gave serious consideration to buying a whole pie for $38 but I resisted (just barely). 

I finally snagged one and initially I was thinking that I'd take a bite...or two...maybe three...ok ok...four and no more. Several seconds later my slice was GONE! 

Absolutely delicious and I think a must try if you are in the area and they haven't sold out. Friendly service as well. Top 5 bakery in SF based on their Delicious cake. 
When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake

6 Chili Pies Baking Co=Pies

8 Golden Gate Bakery=Egg tart
9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description:
I stopped by in the late morning, heading all warnings that they often run out of the coffee crunch cake slices.  On my visit, there was no need to worry as they still had a full tray.  When I arrived there were two people ahead of me, one of which was really indecisive, so that allowed me plenty of time to peruse the treats in the case.

Not all items were labeled so I asked the woman behind the counter to point out the items on display and I'm glad I asked as I had no idea what some items were.   I ended up ordering slices of the coffee crunch cake and the green tea cake roll.  

The cake and cream filing was really good but in all honesty the crunch part of the cake was too sweet for me.  A little went a long way for me.  It also tasted more like butterscotch than coffee to me but was fine nonetheless.  

The green tea cake roll had a hint of green tea flavor.  The cake was tender and moist and the cream filling was light and had a hint of sweetness.  I really enjoyed this cake and could easily return to try the other flavors.

As a native SFer, I cannot believe that this was my first time at Yasukochi's!  I have had the coffee crunch cake before but wasn't 100% sure it came from here.

The woman behind the counter was incredibly sweet and kind.  This shop and its owners could easily be in Hawaii as it has the same vibe of many stores I have patronized there.

Cash only.

I was able to find parking fairly easily on the street around the corner from the entrance to the store.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday at 3pm to get a slice of their famous Koffee Krunch cake and that was a mistake, they sold out of individual slices by 11am! There was 1 whole cake left and I contemplated for a few minutes if I should buy the whole thing and then I went for it. They are cash only but there is an ATM machine right outside of the market. 

The cake is a fluffy spongey coffee flavored cake with whipped cream frosting and covered in coffee flavored crunchy candy pieces. I love sugar so it tasted amazing to me but my husband said the candy pieces on the outside of the cake made it too sweet. 

Definitely worth a try if you are in Japantown!
author: Ang W.

description:
The coffee cake really is that good.  It's easy to miss this shop because it's just a little counter inside the Super Mira Market.  

The cakes look just like all those cream filled rolls at any Chinatown bakery.  But Yasukochi's coffee cake doesn't taste anything like those imposters.  

The cake was super tender and soft, not too sweet.  But the real star is the coffee crumble on top.  They have a mysterious sort of texture - not hard like toffee bits, but delicately crunchy in a light foamy kind of way.  Like if you freeze dried the top of a cappuccino.  When you bite into them along with the cream, it tastes heavenly.
author: Alex L.

description:
TIP: CASH and CHECK ONLY

I normally don't really care for coffee but I've heard so many good things about this cake so I wanted to give it a try. The first few times I came here they kept on running out of slices but today was a different story. I walked in a got a slice for $4.25.

The ladies handed me the slice in a bag. Leaving the store I wanted to eat the cake but I didn't know how. I wasn't given a fork or anything. I had to eat it like a child and use my hands. The candy on top of the cake was sticky so it got messy quick. My first bite, I was expecting a coffee flavor but nope. The candy on the outside was like a crunchy caramel and the cake portion tasted like a vanilla cake. It was pretty good but I wish my initial experience went smoother. I thought the cake tasted best after it's been chilled. After it got to room temperature I didn't care for it as much. 

Overall, it was a good piece of cake but I think it was overhyped for me. I'd rather have a burnt almond cake over this.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Wow this place is crowded. 

Cash only. There is an ATM machine in the front of the store but most of the time it is broken. 

Order ahead if you want a cake when you get there. They are ususlly sold out by 2-3 pm. They want it this way so there is no waste. The cakes don't last long. The crunchy disappears from moisture absorption. 

Crunchy/creamy/cool/sweet sensation all at once. Whip cream.

Light; not too sweet like a butter cream frosted cake. 

In the back of a supermarket. Seems like always a line. If you go late they sell out. Lemon crunch very good. Make sure to try this at least once in your life. Because of how fragile the crunch is and it doesn't store well no big company will make these. Too much work!!! Get them while they are still willing to do the work!!!
author: Doug C.

description:
What is all the fuss about??? 
Let me start by saying, we just had lunch at one of the japanese restaurant in japantown, so we were already full. 
We bought 2 slices of the coffee crunch, the old lady was cute and kind, while we were about to order, I said, "I want some coffee crunch before I die!" (Back story, a small sign inside says you should try the coffee crunch before you die....) 
She laughed and gave us our cake. 
Fast forward, went back to our car, we couldnt wait to eat it until we get home. You can smell the coffee and sweetness of the cake. We hogged those slices, it was gone in 60 seconds! 
Sorry folks no pictures, like what I said, gone in 60 seconds! 
Moist, crunchy, it was PERFECTION!!!
author: june A.

description:
I was looking for a cake for my sister's bday & since she wanted something different from the usual Paris & 85 cake, I searched & searched until I found Yasukochi's. I was actually looking for a japanese cheesecake but this popped up & it looks super amazingly delicious, we just had to try it. 

Called a day before to reserve a whole coffee crunch cake. Came by the next day & picked it up. Cash only so make sure to bring cash. It's inside a grocery store & when you enter, it's on your right side. 

Was instructed to refrigerate immediately but we're a long way from home so we just had to blast the ac since it was like 90 degrees that day. 

Anyway, onto the cake. First bite, I was like 'eh, it's okay' and then second bite, I was like 'mind blown'. I just couldn't stop eating. It was amazingly good. It was sweet but not too sweet. It was soft like heaven soft. It was just the perfect blend of flavors, bitter & sweet. Plus, unlike any other cake (like you know Paris & 85), 3 days after & this cake still tasted fresh. Like wow, I just can't wait till it's my b-day so I can eat this cake again.
author: Neko Panchi M.

description:
Ever since I moved back to the Bay Area all of my
Friends have been raving to me about Yasukochi's crunch cake. My only complain is they are closed Sunday & Monday and CASH ONLY ! Those days for me are typically my days to explore the city so it sadness me that they are closed lol . I came into the establishment today and was greeted by the most sweetest lady . She was so sweet and explained all her goodies so well to me . Today my heart was set on  the coffee crunch cake ! YUMMMMM ! The cake is so moist and that nice coffee and crunch texture !! Soooo good ! Can't wait to come back to try more ! I will be buying a whole cake for the holidays!!!
author: Monica M.

description:
A few years ago, we were planning on getting some lunch bentos at Super Mira Market and decided to check out Yasukochi's (inside the market) just to see if they might have the famed coffee crunch cake. It was already close to noon, and the lady told us they were sold out.

Since we don't live in the city, getting up there early morning on Saturday was not going to be very likely. I had quickly given up on trying to taste this cake, knowing that it was probably never going to happen.

Fast forward to a holiday party this weekend... one couple brought the coffee crunch cake to the party! :-O While other guests were still trying to figure out what it was, I recognized it immediately and pounced at this rare opportunity to taste the cake. Cutting myself a generous slice, I enjoyed this cake that I'm sure took the couple some effort to procure. The inside is like a chiffon cake, similar to the inside of an Asian roll cake. Each layer of cake is sandwiched between some whipped cream, but the highlight is the coffee crunch topping. It's kind of like crushed toffee in appearance, but melts in your mouth. The sweetness of the coffee crunch topping pairs perfectly with the actual cake.

I've also heard that the lemon crunch cake and the green tea roll are also fabulous. If you want a slice, it's hard to get without going to the bakery very early. However, if you want an entire cake, you can call ahead to order. I'd say just get the entire cake, even if you don't plan on bringing it to any parties. I hear it freezes beautifully. ;)
author: Alice T.

description: Hello! Can you say "please give me another?"  the toffee crunch cake was so good!  I only bought one piece... and continued with my tour around SF.  By the time I got around to going back to get another piece... gone.  Yup, you can imagine my dismay at not being able to have another slice of the moist yellow cake with lightly sweetened butter cream frosting covered by that light (not hard), crunchy ( like those Christmas mint things), delicious toffee.  Mmmm... drooling thinking about it.
author: Jimmy P.

description: I don't know what happened. I've been ordering cakes from here for over 20 years. This is my fave cake. I usually order the 9 inch round, but this time got the half sheet. The cake was like a hill. It had an incline. See pic. When we cut the cake, it disintegrated. See pic. It was an embarrassment. I blamed the Restaurant staff until I tried to cut it myself. It's as if the baker took all the crumbs from the other cakes and molded it into a sort of rectangular shape using whipped cream and then covered with the coffee crunch pieces. Very disappointed and very sad for my 50th Birthday. Is there a new baker?! Epic fail.
author: Carrie W.

description: Finally tried it.  Cake was on the dry side and the coffee crunch tasted burned.  Overall still a good cake with coffee.  Maybe the whole cakes are better than the individual slices.  I'll give it another try next week to rule out a bad baking day.
author: William C.

description:
A small corner area inside Super Mira market, Yasukochi's may be easily missed to an outsider's eye.

The main seller is the coffee crunch cake -- layers of moist spongey cake alternating with sweet cream and covered with sticky coffee-flavored bits. Overall the sponge cake is light and not too sweet, and the cream is airy and delicious. The coffee-flavored bits are crunchy, hard, and very sticky, and they will get stuck in your teeth. Annoyingly delicious as I'd call it. Cakes available as a whole or in slices (and with chocolate crunch flavor as another option!), Yasukochi's will surely fulfill your sweet tooth cravings.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Irony is when I lived in SF for around 30 yrs, I never knew about this place, only to hear raves and praises just a few years ago while living in LA. Besides, it's human nature to ignore what's close and crave what's far. 

On my recent trip to SF, I made a point to finally see what the fuss is. Found this little bakery tucked in one corner of a market in Japantown. Approaching, you'll see the sign above, then a glass display case with their whole cakes, slices and cookies. Not much else. But variety is not what brings we people here. It's the coffee crunch cake. Just scroll through the photos and you'll see a pattern.

Heeding warnings of it selling out, I called ahead to place an order, which is encouraged. Full name, phone digits and time of pick up are all they need. Do this! Don't just show up and expect to score.  

The 8" cake ($35.00 as of Apr.'17) might seem small, but it's stacked 4 layers high and covered with those sweet crunchy pieces that makes this cake different and delicious, and it's definitely substantial.  Is it the best cake I've ever had, as many have declared? Nope.  But it's good and worth a try if you haven't already. 

The sweet lady (owner?) was very pleasant. The service on the phone and in person were warm and comforting, an all that wraps Yasukochi's Sweet Stop up to be a great family owned bakery that makes one very tasty cake.

Good to know: 

* Located inside Super Mira Market, walk in and turn right. 
* They will also save sliced cakes too, just call. 
* Besides coffee crunch, there's lemon crunch and chocolate crunch.   Coffee is still the best seller.
* Cash or check only. No credit cards. 
* It's a bit sweeter than most other Japanese desserts. 
* Try to finish the cake within 2 days, before the crunchy pieces get soft and stick together like toffee bark. 
* It should be fridged a all times for freshness. Don't let it sit on the counter for even an hour.
author: James L.

description:
I have attempted to buy their slices of Coffee Crunch Cake at least like 3 times, but failed every single time because they ran out. FINALLY I was able to purchase the famous cake.

I went on a Tuesday early morning, made sure to call ahead to hold two slices of Coffee Crunch Cake as soon as they opened, and then voila! I got it! 

TIP: Just to be sure, call ahead and put your slices of coffee crunch cake or the full cake on hold, they will sell out FAST
*Also they only accept CASH or CHECKS

I was SO EXCITED when I got the cake and also I got a chocolate strawberry roll cake. Every time I went and attempted to buy the cakes, I never noticed they had rolls, but this time I did. I couldn't help but try one of them. 

Prices were reasonable and worth it. The roll cakes were $4.25 and same for a slice of Coffee Crunch Cake. Also a REMINDER, the slices of cakes are RECTANGULAR not like the slice out of a round cake!

Now for TASTE. It tasted better than I ever IMAGINED. I couldn't eat the cake until like over an hour later, but it still tasted OMG amazing. The outer layer of the cake still kept that delicious crunch. As for the cake itself, I liked how the cake and cream wasn't that sweet, because the crunchy part of the cake was pretty sweet. As for the Chocolate and Strawberry Roll, it tasted delightful! I've never had a more delicious roll cake before, the strawberry cream wasn't so sweet and it had the tartness of a strawberry. I could also feel strawberry seeds in the cream when eating the roll cake. 

Both cakes were so light and fluffy, I was the happiest when eating those cakes. Definitely DEFINITELY going back next time we are in SF!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Cash only, family owned, and so yummy!  I had to try their famous crunch cake when we were nearby in Japantown and I now understand why it's famous.

The little shop is inside of a market on the corner.  When you walk inside, just turn right and you can't miss it!  There was only one woman working when we went, and no line.  They didn't appear to have anything BUT the coffee crunch cake, but I know they have other types of cake available.

I had a single slice of cake just to taste it, and it was the perfect amount!  I would not have wanted any more.  The cake is super fluffy, while the whipped topping is light and not overly sweet.  There is some secret involved in making this cake, because I've never had one so perfectly moist and fluffy!  But of course, the coffee crunch topping is what sets it over the edge.  It's the perfect compliment to the soft, fluffy cake.

If you just get a slice, grab a bottle of water in the market too.  You'll need it!
author: Kenna H.

description: Sweet Shop makes the best Coffee Crunch Cake, in my opinion, since Blums. San Francisco is lucky to have a few bakeries making really good Coffee Crunch Cakes.
author: Stephen Y.

description: I absolutely love this family bakery, Why?  Because I luv the coffee crunch cake!!! Let me tell you how good it is.  Made of 4 layers of sponge and filled with freshly whipped cream between the layers and covered outside with sweet honeycomb.  Perfect sweetness when combined with the  fresh cream and sponge.  My boys live this cake too and every year we buy our Birthday cakes there.  The quality of this cake are consistent all the time.  The 8" cake cost $36 and it can easily serve 12 ppl when a quarter is sliced into 3 portions.  Trust me, this cake is heaven.  Best eaten fresh, as the honeycomb can melt.  Bare in mind this bakery is inside a supermarket on the corner.  So give it a try
author: Elaine Y.

description: Best coffee cake ever!!!! Coffee crunch is incredible. Addictive. Pro status bakery here. Had this at a birthday party and never looked back, we order this for every event possible.
author: Danny K.

description: Order one Chocolate Roll to go, hard to handle by hand. The cream inside is not creamy, a flavor of mixed water and sugar. The whole roll like just defrost from the refrigerator, watery. Disappointed
author: Mengrou L.

description:
4 out of 4 people agree, the coffee crunch cake is an amazing dessert. The crunchy topping looks like toffee but melts in your mouth like  meringue. The not too sweet cream filling nicely supports the fluffy, airlike  cake. The slice is just enough for one person to eat without feeling like a fattie.
The warning from the shopkeeper was on point: keep this thing cold. 1 hour out of the fridge and the cake started sweating. I got to the store on a workday around 12 and they were down to a few slices so plan accordingly.
author: Lams L.

description: My go-to place for birthday cakes! Everyone I've introduced this place to loves it! Probably the best cake ever. The coffee crunch cake isn't too sweet and has the most delicious honeycomb crunch later. Even if you aren't a cake/sweets person, this cake is sure to change your mind. They sell slices daily, but they go quick so go early! Otherwise special order it. It's a bit pricey but sooooooooo worth it.
author: Rachelle T.

description: Love their crunch cake (coffee/chocolate/lemon favors). I pre order a day before. Cake is very fresh, soft, creamy, crunchy. Need to keep it in the freezer, if you. Are not eating it the same day, otherwise the crunchy candy on the outside may malt.
author: X G.

description:
This week over ONE THOUSAND 
 people wrote on the "SF Remembered" site on Facebook commenting on the now long gone Blum's Coffee Crunch Cake; and the best place to find it again with the most authentic recipe, is Yasukochi's Sweet Stop.
Just want to let the bakery know to be aware the increase in orders may soon be amazing! 
Nice people, good family, wonderful bakery. 
Everything's delicious here.
author: Lynne H.

description: Talk about a hole in the wall! This place is a hidden gem. The coffee cake really is as good as people say.
author: Roland M.

description:
This hidden gem is located in SF's Japantown within a little grocery store. It's one of those hole in the wall bakery/restaurant and it is now my favorite place. 

I came to see what all the hype was about and I got the coffee cake. Extremely high in demand and I see why. This cake is so moist, fluffy, and flavorful in every bite. My SO was a little upset with me making him drive into the city for this $30 cake. But if I could snap a picture of his place when he first took a bite it would be priceless. He immediately took by his regret and admits that he would drive back for the cake - that's how good it is. 

Note that to get your hands on this cake you have to order it in advance and the homie only accepts cash so be prepared!
author: Laura L.

description:
On the phone with some guy who sounded incredibly disinterested.. 
I called for a pickup since I wasn't aware the day before you have to call in or pickup before 11am/12pm

The convo went something like this
Me: hi I was wondering if you guys had any crunch cakes left ?
Him: hold on
Him: how many did you want?
Me: umm can I get two slices of coffee crunch
Him: time of pickup?
Me: what's your latest we can pickup?
Him: 430
Me: oh, do you guys have any other slices? (cuz I remembered they have other crunch cakes available)
Him: (in a condescending tone) you said you wanted two slices
Him: last name?
Me: *spelled it out* b as in boy, u as in unicorn... 
Him: *With frustration in his voice* last name?
Me: *proceeds to spell it again*
Him: *with more frustration in voice* I said your first name, not last
Me: Angela .. A as in Apple, n as in Nancy...
Him: first name????
Me: it's Angela, a as in Apple ... Blahblah

Because of his tone of voice and just his total refusal of my question, honestly this is the worst customer service I've ever received for a Togo order. This was an incredible departure from the lady that I was serviced by yesterday, she was genuinely nice and just radiating with sweetness. I'm well aware that I could be picky, but I only asked a question - he didn't need to be a douche about it. I just wanted to know what my options were. Ugh such a sour taste in my mouth this morning..

Cake is so light and tasty though. You can eat a whole slice and you don't feel terrible. $4~
author: Angela B.

description:
COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE

I have the biggest sweet tooth so I'm super happy when I discover new dessert places. Sweet stop is located in Super Mira Market on Buchanan. 
I reserved 3 slices over the phone in the morning and got my goodies by the afternoon! They wrap the slices in parchment paper so it does not get messed up on the way home. 

The cake is super light and airy. TIP! It is best when chilled. The crunch is so sweet and crunchy. Me and my boyfriend fight for the biggest crunch pieces ;).PRO TIP: CALL AHEAD! They run out quick. They're also closed SUN-MON so come during the week :)
author: Arielle R.

description: The BEST pastries in the City, namely the Danishes and the Almond Ring! But the Crunch Cakes are the pièce de résistance!
author: Scott H.

description:
I've been going to this place for years! It is a classic SF cake place. They are famous for their COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE. There are 4 layers of cake with frosting in between each layer, covered in this coffee crunch topping. It's hard to describe, but has the crunch of a cracker jack, with a coffee flavored coating. IT'S AMAZING. 

It's great for special occasions, including birthdays! My family always goes nuts whenever someone brings it for a celebration. This past weekend when I went, for an 8" coffee crunch cake with a birthday message, it came out to $38. 

FYI you can order the cakes ahead of time. I went on a Saturday morning, and they were out. Apparently they don't have the cakes ready until 1pm. BUT that being said, GO EARLY otherwise they'll sell out! Or, just give yourself peace of mind and order a day early. 

Service is SUPER sweet - the little lady in the back is too adorable. Also the man ringing me up was super friendly too. The location is a little odd, with its own bakery section of a Japanese grocery store, but hey it works!

This is definitely a special cake that everyone must try once in their lifetime!!!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: This is the only place with the coffee crunch cake! It is amazing and has a nice light flavor! It's best to go early to avoid them selling out. It's located inside the cute. Little Super Mira market in Japantown and it's easy to find once you know it's not it's own store. You can get a whole cake or by the slice. They also have pastries, danishes and cookies for sale as well. They also have a really good guava cake but I'll stick to getting the coffee crunch cake. It doesn't taste like coffee, since it has a very light flavor and it's not too sweet. The soft cake with the crunch on the outside taste amazing together. I have to stop here every time in I'm the area because you can't get cake like this anywhere else! It's a must try!
author: Candi L.

description: My husband and I got married at San Francisco City Hall and had a strawberry cream cake from Yasukochi's as our wedding cake. We thought we would have some leftover, but everyone ate every last bite because it was so delicious. I couldn't have been happier with our choice. Yasukochi's will always have a place in my heart.
author: Brittany L.

description: The best cake ever!!! I grew up eating the famous coffee crunch cake, and now my family enjoys it just the same! I love how the cake is so moist and fluffy with fresh crunchy bites of honeycomb. It never disappoints... hands down the best cake ever!
author: Erin M.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to call in 2 hours beforehand to order the coffee crunch cake for his mom's birthday. Luckily, they had it available, considering it was on a Saturday afternoon. The sweet lady that picked up asked for my name and phone number, then told me the price and that it is cash only. 

We arrived at about 3:30PM and the sweet woman asked for my name and phone number, then pulled out our cake from the freezer and gave us specific instructions on how to consume the cake and also, where to put it if we don't finish it. She also asked us if we wanted writing, and that there will be an additional $2 charge. 

When we got home to cut the cake, it was very hard and sticky. As we took our first bite, we all agreed that the top toffee/coffee crunch was way too sweet and had a burnt aftertaste. The cake itself was hard and frozen-like, whereas the cream was flavorless and also hard. It tasted a bit better when we took a fork full of cake with a bit of toffee/coffee crunch top, instead of consuming each separately. I was only able to finish half of my slice of cake and ended up giving the other half to my boyfriend, then I went ahead to chug water due to the sweetness of the cake. All in all, we didn't think it was that enjoyable like other Yelpers have claimed, but it was passable, though we wouldn't go out our way to buy it again.
author: Vicky L.

description:
10/19/16
Lives up to what I read about their coffee crunch cake! DELICIOUS! 
I've been wanting to their cake for the longest time, but they are always sold out on the weekend and I'm never in the area on a weekday until a couple days ago.

This bakery is located inside a mini grocery market a block down from the Japantown tower plaza across from a hotel.  

I came in around 10am which is when they open on weekdays, and I already saw someone leave the store with a whole cake. Wow. Walked in and the bakery is nestled on the right hand side of the entrance. They had a good amount of single slices left. And I bough 2 for $7.90. It is CASH OR CHECK ONLY. 
The cake is deliciously moist, soft, sweet and crunchy. Taste like light vanilla pound cake with white cream in between covered in marshmallow fluff and coffee crunchy pieces on the outside. 

They also have other flavor cakes - lemon and chocolate and sponge roll cakes too!
author: Samantha F.

description: The Sweet Stop's coffee crunch cake is the best dessert ever! The cake is light and not too sweet and the crunch is *so* light, airy, crunchy, and delicious! You *have* to stop by and at least get a slice, if not the whole cake!
author: Annie W.

description: One of the most authentic Japanese desserts I have ever had in SF. We got there on a Saturday morning, were lucky enough to get the last piece of the famous coffee crunch cake. The cake is not too sweet, crunchy, fresh and delicious. Just make sure you come early, the crunch cake has limited amount everyday.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Amazing cake! I got the coffee crunch cake and the strawberry puff pastry cake and split half with the bf.  Both these cakes were so perfectly made.  The strawberry light and crispy, and the coffee cake spongy with cream and the crunch topping. 

Definitely worth a trip over to grab a couple slices. 

Great with a cup of tea!
author: Kate G.

description:
It's 11 :47 AM, My buddy and I are 3rd and 4th in line with 8 slices of Koffee krunch left behind the display counter. I patiently wait then anxiety builds up. Oh sweet Lord, please please please do not let the 1st person in line get greedy and buy out all the slices. She buys 3 slices and purchases other items- leaving 3 people with 5 slices - that's a good ratio (my anxiety and heart beats slow to a rhythmic tempo)  and so I begin to think - what If #2 buys all of the slices- my heart begins to beat a little faster now and my eyes darts between the cakes and the chatty ladies - she then proceeds to talk talk talk- my anxiety is back- c'mon lady move with it! #1 finally leaves...
Drumroll #2- small talk about this and that- then....she pre-orders a cake but doesn't buy anything else! Jack pot!!! We are good we are all good! Co- worker buys 1 slice and I buy all 4 slices for now and later! 
I turned around and just knew...I offered a sincere apology to #5 - I just had to buy it all - I'm so sorry. Guy #5 hangs his head low and walks out the store. Maybe next time #5. Maybe next time. 
These cakes are worth the anxiety induced lines- it is. Get here before 10- just don't buy them out and leave some for the late birds.  Do As I say not what I do.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Japanese family owned bakery shop located inside Super Mira Market.

It's a counter to the right as you walk in. Ring the bell for service. Very nice old lady will come out from the back.

If you want to buy the legendary coffee crunch cake by the slice, come early.

Is the cake good? Yeah, it's real good on a monumental scale. The crunchy bits in opposition to the light cake make for a memorable combination.

Green tea and strawberry roll are good as well.

These kinds of authentic Japanese-owned businesses are becoming rarer in Japantown.
I doubt their kids are going to take over the business so enjoy this place while you can.


Cash is king.
author: Jaqen H.

description:
This review is for Yasukochi's coffee crunch cake only.  I've had it a couple times before, and even though cake is not my favorite(I prefer pie), I could probably eat the entire cake it's so good!  I wish I lived closer to SF just so I could buy this treat occasionally.  It is so light and fluffy on the inside but sweet and crunchy on the outside from the coffee crunch layer.  And did I mention that I love coffee and drink it daily?  
You must call and pre-order the cake in advance.  Don't worry about the grouchy man who takes your order, just be warned. And don't be one of those people that gives a one star review just because they are so damn sensitive. Just get your coffee crunch cake and eat it too. Highly recommended for any occasion.
author: Dean S.

description:
I'm not a dessert kinda girl, but I do KNOW where to go for the best cake!

And Yasukochi is one of the best bakeries in SF for cakes.

This humble bakery occupies not even a quarter of the space of Mira supermarket, but what they can do with that small set-up, they do really well. It's just a counter with a few cakes, pastries and cookies on display. I can't imagine how they haven't expanded given their popularity!

The Coffee Crunch cake is a hit at ANY party.I always end up buying the cake for our potlucks at work because my co workers say, "you yelp a lot, you know where to go!" ;-)

The only thing is ... the super traditional older Japanese gentleman does not smile. Do not expect him to bow down to you no matter how much you're paying for his baked goods. I flashed him my biggest smile and complimented how the Coffee Crunch cake is like no other cake in the city. I got a 9 inch round cake for $45. Generous chunks of chopped toffee, light as air cream and layers of soft white cake make for a wonderful treat. A very SWEET wonderful treat. But do I at least get a smile?

He does not smile back. 

WTH!

I almost left in a huff, but I remembered that I needed to order another cake for a friend's birthday the same week. A simple but pretty 8 inch Strawberry Cake. OMG, did I really just spend $82 worth of CA$H on two cakes in one week?

"See, I give you more business by getting another cake this week. That's good, huh?"

His eyes turned up, his mouth opened a bit and I saw pearly whites.

That's a smile, folks. That's a smile.
author: Janice C.

description: This cake is iconic San Francisco and my family had been buying it from the Sweet Shop since I can remember. My grandmother used to guy this cake from Blum's downtown decades ago!  Still fabulous and still a treat for any occasion.
author: Ken G.

description:
My favorite place for my childhood favorite coffee crunch cake. It has the right amount of sweetness and thin layers of cream in the center (unlike the other SF location). 

Place your order at least a day in advance. Sometimes they'll accomidate same day...good luck.

Location: inside a super market to the right 

Price: $35 for the smallest circle cake (8 or 9 inches, I forgot) - CASH ONLY

Parking - lets test your luck
author: Jess W.

description: The coffee crunch cake certainly lives up to the hype. The cake rolls are amazing as well. I love how perfect they have the sweetness. The coffee crunch has slight bitterness which goes great with the icing. The cake is so moist and airy. It is an incredible flavor. So well done. The lady who runs the store is so sweet too!
author: Jessica H.

description: I was looking for a special birthday cake and with all of the ratings and raving comments about this bakery I couldn't go anywhere else. I was running late and even saying that it was okay, they were adamant that they waited for me and that I received my cake. For how established they are, how amazing of a product they produce, they still are incredibly sweet and kind. Not something you see everyday in this industry and it was the best birthday cake I've ever given someone else. Will definitely be making this my go-to cake spot for special events.
author: Bryan H.

description:
You know a cake is good when a group of 7 people are able to nearly devour it after an entire Christmas feast. I think I can safely say I "won" at bringing dessert to the future-in-laws! I'm still patting myself on the back for thinking to place a pre-order ~2 weeks before Christmas, figuring the rush would be intense.

THE OVERVIEW.
+ Located inside Super Mira Market (walk in and make an immediate right, you can't miss it)
+ $35 for a 9" coffee crunch cake (serves 8-10, easily)
+ Opens at 10 am on weekends
+ Place a pre-order for your cake via phone if you have an event coming up
+ Cash or check only
+ Street parking can be a pain, but life is pain - anyone that tells you otherwise is selling something!

The cake is absolutely delicious, light and airy with a good, well, coffee crunch to it. I'm already planning the next family outing I can bring this bad boy to...
author: Claire S.

description:
BEST COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE EVER. EVER. I hope the baker lives forever and ever. I need this cake for the rest of my life! 

It's cash only. No problem. Just don't ever close. Or retire. Or go to heaven.
author: J.J. P.

description:
I ordered the famous coffee cake with CHOCOLATE CAKE.  My sister's fav is chocolate, so it was disappointing to cut into the cake and see layers of vanilla cake.   "Chocolate cake " was mentioned  twice on my end to the man who took my order and he repeated "chocolate cake" twice.  The cake was ok, but when you want a chocolate cake, and you get vanilla, after driving an hour and a half and you pay &
$68,  well, that snafu just takes the cake. hrrmph.
author: Chris O.

description:
I had their Coffee Crunch Cake for two birthdays and one holiday during the Cherry Blossom Festival. One of the best cakes in the Bay Area! Super sticky, crunchy coffee brittle/crumble on the outside of the cake + between layers, super soft cream filling, and a softer fluffier sponge cake (like) making it 4 layers inside a $30s cake. 
$2 extra for a happy birthday message is a lot in my opinion but the cake is totally worth the traffic to SF. I called in my order (and reservations are very necessary according to past reviews) and they're always very nice and quick. (I did it right before class ) I want to try that Choco Crunch Cake someday though..
author: Anisa F.

description: After eating a pretty heavy breakfast at Sweet Maple, my GF wanted some dessert and she found this place via Yelp. We had such a hard time finding this place and that is because the bakery is located inside Super Mira Market. The owners behind the counter are super nice and sweet. My GF couldn't decide what to get so she got the Coffee Crunch, Strawberry, Lemon and Mango. I only got to try the Coffee Crunch and Strawberry and they were both amazing. They are really moist and fluffy and have the perfect touch of sweetness. The crunch on the coffee gives it a much needed texture. Definitely a hidden gem. It was like $4-$5 per slice so its a bit pricey but its so darn good!
author: Juan F.

description:
This is one of the most stellar desserts I've ever had and it's less than $4! It's essentially a cold sponge cake layered with cream and coated with a coffee toffee-like crunch. It's simply magical.

Really light, not super sweet. Also it's won a lot of awards... For good reason. It's tucked inside a convenience Mart on the right hand side. Fast service!
author: Cindy W.

description: Holy cow I was not disappointed at all with their coffee crunch cake! Highly recommend. Brought me and my family back to our childhood memories of eating this cake. A family member has this recipe but it doesn't compare to this bakery's coffee crunch cake. The toppings are nice flavored rich coffee, crunchy but dissolvable in your mouth. Inside filling and cake nicely evens out the flavor of the coffee. Will definitely buy again when in Japantown!
author: Malia L.

description:
I love this place!!!
the cake is soft, moist, and not too sweet!
Can't get any better than that! they have the BEST strawberry roll cakes!
author: Candice L.

description: Absolutely nice owners that will take the time to reserve a  cake for you and have it ready as promised at the pick up time.  Can't go wrong with the famous cofffee crunch cake and just about anything else they have to offer.
author: Shelton F.

description: This little gem makes delicious coffee crunch cake!  I moved to LA 6 years ago and whenever I'm visiting, I make sure that I stop by to get my fix of this cake. Coffee crunch cake is very popular and they sell out, thus I suggest calling in advance to reserve your slice.
author: Maggie U.

description:
This store was hidden so well. It's inside a small Japanese grocery market called Super Mira (with black umbrella and pink font). Once you go in just turn to your right and you'll see the store right there. CASH ONLY. There's an ATM machine right outside but the transaction fee of $3.25 pierced my heart. 

I got the coffee crunch cake - 8" which was 32 dollars.

I don't think I really need to say much about the deliciousness of the cake.
author: Mandy C.

description:
I love the coffee crunch cake! Hands down - the best I've tasted. It's perfectly sweetened and moist. If you're going to visit, don't be confused about where the location is. It's in the store so walk in and make a right. Their counter is tucked away in the corner.
FYI: Come by early. They usually run out of their single sliced coffee crunch cake! Oh and they have a lemon crunch cake! Will update this review after the consumption of this lemon crunch cake.
Ok, tried the lemon crunch cake and it was deliciously refreshing. It's sweet so if you like lemon cakes on the sweet side, this is the one for you! The crunch has the lemony flavor as well which gave this cake a good mixed of textures. Definitely a must try!
author: Martine D.

description:
I called to order the coffee crunch cake. The guy who picked up was extremely rude and sounded annoyed from the beginning. I had some simple questions like which sizes were available for the coffee cake -- but he kept interrupting me asking "when do you need it?" I told him Friday or Saturday and he repeated himself, adding the word "exactly?" 

"Sure then, Saturday," I told him. Again he repeated himself. 

"Ok, Saturday afternoon," I said. Responding rudely with "EXACTLY sir". 

"Fine 3pm, I don't really care!" I said in frustration. He proceeds with, "now what do you want?"...

First, listen to people if they have questions. 
And second, treat people with respect.
author: Young Y.

description:
Bless my gf, Jenny W's sweet soul. I was introduced to Yasukochi's coffee crunch cake last week. Little did I know what a big deal this cake was when I was asked to pick up the order.  She said it's the BEST. She's totally, completely, 100% right. I live in Sacramento and have made it a mission to have another taste of this slice of heaven. Determined. The incredibly fluffy, yet moist cake topped with a light, just enough sweetness topping complimented the coffee crunch oh so well. My slice was gone before I even realized it. 

It's a small bakery in a small mom and pop market that's been around before years and, hopefully, foreverrrrrrrrrrrr.  I would like to purchase this cake for my grandbabies' babies!
author: Yvonne N.

description: One of our patients brought a lemon coffee crunch cake into our hospital unit as a thank you. Let me thank YOU, dear patient, for introducing me to this delicious cake --one of the best flavors I've tried in a looong time. Spongey cake, subtle lemon flavor, wrapped in a crunchy and chewy coating of melt in your mouth sweetness. After my first couple of bites, I jotted down the name of the bakery that I found on the box's sticker and saved it. My next cake will hopefully be from here...and based on the reviews, the coffee crunch cake is all the rage at the bakery. Try it and attempt to just have one bite.
author: Vanessa G.

description: I ordered the coffee crunch cake for my husband's birthday. They were very accommodating, punctual with the order, and it was amazing. Everyone loved it as it was non too sweet, not overloaded with cream, etc. However, I would have loved it even more had I not found a long black hair half way through the cake. Ugh.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: My favorite cake in the world. Wish I had this cake for my wedding so everyone could know such cake exists. Everything about this cake is delicious and you need to try it, end of story.
author: Ming N.

description:
I put together a list of dessert places I wanted to try and the Coffee Crunch Cake was on it. At first blush it didn't seem like much. The woman behind the counter brought out this parchment wrapped, pre-cut, refrigerated slice. Cold cake doesn't normally do it for me. There's something the feels not fresh about it. Not the case with this.

I love that the cake and whip cream was not too sweet because the coffee crunch exterior made up for it. I loved the textures of soft cake with the slightly stiff cream filling, and the crunch and then chewiness of the coffee crunch. I didn't plan to finish it because I had other places I wanted to also try but I demolished this small slice. So very good and definitely lives up to the hype.

I should point out I don't like my desserts overly sweet, like cupcakes from places like Sprinkles. But this walked a nice balance between cake that wasn't overly sweet and the sugary topping. I was able to parse out the amount of topping I wanted per bite of cake.

It's so good, thinking about it makes me wish I was in SF.
author: Peg L.

description:
COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE. We went with the recommendation of the mama-san lady helping us, as she proudly proclaimed the coffee crunch to be their most popular item. Sure enough, a few weeks later I noticed Yasukochi's famous coffee crunch cake featured on a 50 things in SF to eat before you die list (or something along that buzz/thrill).

The bakery consists of a modest facade of a plain-looking refrigerated display case in a Nijiya-esque supermarket in the outskirts of Japantown. We stumbled across it while wandering in the area because Mr. Holmes had sold out as expected, but Yasukochi was a worthwhile consolation prize with the added bonus of no wait time.

The coffee crunch cake conjures thoughts of a secret family recipe perfected over generations. I had the hardest time deciding whether to eat the cake vertically or horizontally: layers of pillow-soft vanilla cake, layers of cream so fresh it tasted like ice cream, a bold coffee custard layer, and a guilt-tripping coating of crumbly toffee and bits. Overall mildly sweet, strong coffee aroma, and a delicate interplay of textures... heaven for any coffee addicts with a sweet tooth i.e. more people than not.

Will be back to try the other epiklicious-looking roll cakes P:
author: Edna C.

description: The coffee crunch cake lives up to the hype. One of the most delicious cakes I've ever eaten. I haven't tried anything else, but that cake alone is easily worth 5 stars.
author: Wynn C.

description:
Their coffee crunch cake is one of my favorite sugar fix. The generous porous toffee crunch that melts in your mouth can be challenging if you don't have the adequate sweet tooth (share it with a friend!) .The light cream and fluffy sponge cakes complement the crunch very well, or maybe it's the other way around, I'm too busy eating to care.
$7.90 for 2 slices of coffee crunch cake. Cash and checks only.
author: Jenny T.

description:
My sister called to reserve a coffee crunch cake for my birthday, and omg I'm so glad I got randomly introduced to this deliciousness!  

This cake has 4 layers of cake!  Each layer is connected with fluffy cold cream infused with toffee crunchy and chewy yummy candy!  The cake is such a great combo of crunchy and fluffy, never had a cake like it before!  To describe the candy portion, it's kinda like a caramel toffee flavor that has a 1:1 ratio of chewy and crunchy...aka YUM.  

The cake itself isn't the prettiest ever, but it's still pretty cute.
author: Nina W.

description:
Thank goodness this bakery is located inside Super Mira market which is located in Japantown's San Francisco. I can kick myself for not purchasing more than one slice of the coffee crunch cake. OMG it is TDF!!!  It is total heaven and super sweet explosion in my mouth.  I think I have tried it in the past many many moons ago when I was much younger visiting my brother and his family when he was married to his first wife. Wow that's long ago as they were divorced back in the 70's plus my brother has passed on ten years ago.

You can be darn sure I will be back!  Remember they aren't open on Sundays which is a bummer!
Also remember those desserts sell out fast so it's a must to get there when they first open up or else you are out of luck.  I better stop telling everyone my secrets! LOL.
author: Karen K.

description:
Alright, after 2 attempts, I finally got my hands on the famous coffee crunch cake and I could see what all the fuss is about. The cake has three layers of super light sponge cake. Between the layers, there's just a bit of cream and, in guessing, a smear of some sort of coffee/caramel sauce. The crunch part is what makes the cake special. I think the crunch is a more porous toffee, very crunchy and nice burnt sugar flavor. 

What a great treat. The grandma like figure behind the counter is so sweet. Hope to get a whole cake one of these days and share the love.
author: Alice W.

description: As someone who usually scrapes thick frostings off cakes or cupcakes - these airy and fluffy cakes from Yasukochi's are everything. Very familiar texture amongst many asian cakes. The cake is spongey and what stands out is the light whipped cream fillings nail each flavor.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Date:  4/18/2015   Time: 12:55 PM   68° Sunny

Thanks to several of my fellow yelpers (Albertino M., Ed U., Janet T., Cherylynn N. and Rita Y.) for their high marks of Yasukochi's Sweet Stop. Yasukochi's been around for 41 years and I didn't know they existed until I read Janet T.'s review last year. Props and shout outs to y'all for talking about the delicious, heavenly coffee crunch cake.

Today is my younger sister's triple 20 day aka the big 6-0. Now all my five siblings and I are in our 60's...yea!!! For this occasion, I felt a coffee crunch cake would be appropriate and I wanted to surprise her and my mom (even though she's diabetic). 

Before leaving on this venture to Yasukochi's, fellow yelper, Albertino M., left me a tip - parking will be problematic or difficult in the area since the Cherry Blossom Festival is going on at the same time. It took my husband and me almost two hours to reach our destination. 

Drive and park the car at the Alameda Ferry Terminal about 11:10 AM, then hop on ferry boat to SF Ferry Terminal. Walk to Mission Street to see if I can find the #38 Muni bus for Geary Blvd...no problemo. Husband asked me where do we disembark from the bus. It was no worry as I knew where I was going even though I never caught the #38. I told him we just follow the nice Japanese women passengers and get off at Geary & Laguna. Walk up two blocks to Sutter and then down Sutter to Buchanan...voila. 

My hubby and I walked in to the market, and we totally missed the bakery section until I asked a female customer. She was nice enough to tell me where and I thanked her. Thank you, Janet T., for mentioning in your review to order the cake from them the day before. The employee had my cake ready, packed it in a pink box and I thought hubby and I would be on our way back across the bay...not. We browsed around briefly and darn I did not see the Hello Kitty Truck. 

Cost of a 9" coffee crunch cake: $43.00...yum, yum. It was absolutely delicious that I had three slices. OMG, I was such a greedy gut to eat that many pieces. Do I feel like a babuy!?! Maybe I have become a fei gee for being such a glutton over the coffee crunch cake. LOL.

I had coffee crunch cake before from Eastern Bakery in San Francisco Chinatown several times at my job. It was okay, but the texture of Eastern's cake was coarse and dry - cornmeal cake. So move over, Eastern Bakery, and let me enjoy Yasukochi's coffee crunch cake with a cup of hot green tea.

Finally, reliable reviews by my fellow yelpers did not lead me down the wrong path. I was definitely on that happy trail from the SF Ferry Terminal to Yasukochi's. Yes, I shall return for their delectable cake and other goodies.
author: Carol C.

description: The coffee cake is out of this world!    I LOVE the coffee crunches and the cream is light and not too sweet.  I was so happy when the owner told me she has a few pieces left so my husband and I get to try this delicious treat on our last day at SF!  The lady is so nice. She even gave me a little calendar and a pen as a souvenir!
author: YL S.

description: Fluffy cake topped with coffee flavored honeycomb candy. HONEYCOMB CANDY. Not enough places sell honeycomb candy. This is a great find. $4.25 for a generous slice.
author: Jennifer L.

description: In showing up to Yasukochi's at 11AM on a Friday, I was saddened that I had missed out on snagging a slice of their well-known coffee crunch cake.  That being said, there were a few slices of the lemon crunch cake left, so I went with that.  The cream in the cake was certainly my favorite part, the crunch part was perhaps my least favorite since it sort of sticks to your teeth.  The lemon was light and refreshing, and if I had the option of only lemon again, I'd probably go with it. The bakery itself reminds me of my childhood and growing up around the Japanese community in LA so it certainly has that home comfort vibe.  I'm that much more committed to coming back here and getting that coffee crunch cake slice!
author: Lisa I.

description:
One word: AMAZING!!! I was deeply impressed the first time I came here. I really wanted the coffee crunch cake slice since it is apparently the must have dessert to get here but they ran out. The lady there is so sweet and she said it usually gets sold out by 11:30am. The only ones left are the whole cakes which I can't finish. 

I opted for the green tea roll cakes and my god it was delicious. The bread was so moist that it just melts in my mouth. Their cream filling was amazing too. It wasn't the average cream though. It was kind of icy like shaved snow and it was amazing. I am definitely down to try their other flavors and I will one day get their coffee crunch cake.

The place is hidden and there is no signs of it on the street. The place is located inside the Japanese super market on the right side when you walk in.
author: Peter N.

description: Worst customer service ever! They are terrible at communicating with their clients, they hang up on you and or disrespectful in every way possible. Embarrassing how you are paying your own money to get disrespected by a business that does not appreciate customers.
author: Jake M.

description:
Three words: coffee crunch cake. 

Every time we get this for someone's birthday, it's a bit! Sure, it doesn't look fancy BUT it tastes so good! It's definitely a sweet cake that sticks to your teeth a little, but it's worth it.
author: Connie Y.

description:
My office wanted to celebrate a co-worker birthday and since we knew she loved nothing but coffee, we wanted to get her the famous coffee crunch cake. 

When I place the order, the man on the phone could barely understand what I was trying to say. I felt so bad raising my voice at him, but he could not hear a word I said. When he finally "understood" what I was saying, we hung up.

We had a little trouble when we picked up the cake. Since the man on the phone had a hard time hearing, the number and the name on the cake was wrong! When the woman on the phone found our cake, she apologized and told us that the man was losing his hearing.

The bakery was inside an Asian supermarket so you would probably have a hard time finding it.

When we arrived at our office, everyone was "Oooohing" and "Aaahhing"!! This cake was gorgeous! I have seen nothing like this! It was most and delicious too! They have 3 different kinds that look like the coffee crunch cake.. The have a chocolate and lemon version as well!! 

Man that was delicious! The birthday girl LOVED it too!
author: Darlene M.

description: My Dad's cousin/ Yasukochi's makes the Best Coffee Crunch Cake! My Mom bought it every Birthday for me since I was little. It is things dreams are made of!
author: Patricia H.

description:
This place definitely lives up to the hype! I reserved four slices of coffee crunch cake over the phone. The lady who took my order was the nicest, sweetest, and most friendly sounding person I have ever dealt with. It made my experience so positive given that I've read opposing reviews from other people.

The coffee crunch cake was super moist and fluffy. The filling and the cake wasn't sweet, which balanced the really sweet coffee crunch pieces. I thought the crunchy pieces were going to be similar to a hard rock candy, but it was actually soft. Think of a meringue that melts in your mouth.

I didn't want to order a huge cake in case my family didn't like it. Our first time trying their coffee crunch cake was great and everyone loved it. Next time we're back in SF we will reserve a whole cake!
author: JD W.

description: How can anyone not give this place 5 stars.   The lady behind the counter is so sweet and nice.   What I normally do here is to pay for my order and come back and pick it up before 4 pm.  I've had the coffee crunch and i thought it was a little too sweet.  What I ended up falling in love with was the guava cake and the chocolate crunch cake.   The guava cake was very fragrant and it wasn't too sweet and it was still very soft.   The chocolate crunch cake was not too sweet as well.  I was surprised i like this cake because i normally don't even like chocolates.       The cake taste like a black forest cake but with the crunch.  Chocolate lovers will love this cake!  I need to try the Mango cake the next time i am here.  I will warn you.  They open at 10 am on weekends but by 10:40 slices of cakes start to sell out.  Get here early!!
author: Belinda C.

description:
Do yourself a favor... Get their coffee crunch cake and you'll thank me. Really.

I don't mind driving all the way up to Japantown just for this. And I would even buy the entire cake just for myself on no special occasion at all. Yes, it's that good!
author: Milz T.

description:
This bakery just blew my mind. I'm probably the only person who was living under a rock and didn't notice this hidden gem inside Super Miro Market. For those who haven't made it here it's on right as you enter the store with only a simple bakery sign you can see upon entering. 

This location had ton of tasty cakes on display and my favorite, the chocolate cream roll. This roll was out of this world. The roll itself was made out of a moist chocolate cake that I would assume only an expert baker can create in such large quantities  to fill a bakery shelf. It had a light and airy feel when eaten and had the same consistency throughout. The cream was perfect textured with a light fully feel when consumed and a mild sweet flavor which was so refreshing. This really made it stand out from other Bay Area bakeries that either have a good cake texture or cream filling, but not both. In addition to the flavor that made my Saturday, they also have green tea with cream, chocolate with strawberry, and other yummy fillings and treats for purchase. Also, if you look at the left wall of their you'll notice that they've been honored by some of the former Hawaiian congressional representatives something that's really neat to a history buff like me.
author: Dawn B.

description: The best out of the best!  I am glad my friend introduced this place to me!  Man, you gotta try the chocolate flavor with strawberry cream!!
author: Clement H.

description: Imagine my surprise when I came home from school and arrived to a pink bakery box on the dinner table with a shiny sticker on top. I cautioned myself that maybe it'd be another generic Chinese fruit cake or pastries inside. The coffee crunch cake inside is indescribable-tasty, crunchy, and delicious. I love how the cake is covered with coffee crunches and the inside isn't suffocated with cream. I would definitely come here again, but to try their chocolate crunch cake. I've never been a fan of coffee because I always thought the flavor came off too strong. This cake totally changed my perspective of coffee!
author: Erica K.

description: There are 2 bakeries in SF that is famous for the coffee crunch cake. I suggest you come here for the real deal. It's a bit more expensive but you yet what you pay for. I picked the cake up yesterday for my son's birthday today (they're closed on Sunday) and was instructed to put it in the freezer when I got home and take it out 4 hours before serving. It was perfect, the coffee crunch was fresh and crunchy unlike the "other place".
author: May G.

description:
My friend has been wanting to try this coffee crunch cake for some time now. Luckily, my friends hosted a sous vide dinner party, and it was the perfect excuse for her to bring some dessert over.

She called to reserve an 8" cake and when she got there (it's in the corner of a Japanese market), it was already boxed up and ready for pick up. Thumbs up for the efficiency but sad she didn't get to see how the cake looked like before it got packed up.

As she unboxed it at dinner, we were all surprised at how big this cake really is! It's a few inches high and completely covered in coffee crunch. There were only 8 of us, and she struggled to figure out how big the slices should be for everyone haha.

When we finally started eating it, everyone enjoyed it. My friend personally thinks the coffee crunch was a bit sweeter than she'd like. I think the coffee crunch only being concentrated on the top was the main issue. It'd be better if the coffee crunch was spread evenly on top and in between the sheet layers of cake for a more uniform texture. The cake is quite good though.

Cash only!
author: Nei N.

description: The Koffee Crunch Cake lives up to the hype. I've tried three times to get a slice of this amazing cake because they always sell out, and I guess third time's the charm. The different textures pair up really well, the top is caramely and crunchy (it kinda reminds me of a peanut butter brittle without the peanuts) and the cake is extremely soft and fluffy. I'm usually not a sweets person (the cake was a bit too sweet for my taste) but the cake was so good that I couldn't stop eating it. I just kept drinking milk, so I could eat more hahaha.  The cake really is to die for, so go pick up a slice now. Tip: you should probably call the shop to see if they have slices left because they sell out fast!
author: Vivian T.

description: Coffee crunch cake was hands down the best cake I've ever had! A trip to San Francisco isn't complete without it - I'll definitely be back the next time I'm there. At $4.50, it's pretty reasonably priced. The slices are generous and can easily be shared between two people.
author: Hannah J.

description: Crunch cake has a nice texture and decent taste. I don't see myself going out of my way to get their cake, however. I need to try their other goods before I could give a solid review.
author: Elvine V.

description:
Coffee crunch cake. I ordered one a few days ahead of time to make sure I would get one for M's bday dinner. I was a little worried about getting a cake I had never had before. Luckily, he really enjoyed it. 

Is anyone else confused by the name of the cake? I feel like it should be called toffee crunch cake instead because I don't get a lot of coffee flavor. Anyway, it was still good. The filling is so airy and light, and the cake is nice and soft. The cake itself is not too sweet but the topping is, so eating it together with each bite is best. 

Next year, I'll try the chocolate crunch cake :)
author: Lena H.

description: Arrived Saturday around 12 noon (only 2 other people in line) and I was able to pick up a coffee crunch cake (they said there were only 2 more cakes remaining). I was going to serve it with lunch the following day so I was told to freeze it overnight and defrost in the refrigerator for about 5-6 hours before serving time. From the other reviews , I expected a really light and not too sweet cake. But while the cake was light, the sweetness from the crunch added up quickly after only a few bites. Still very much enjoyed it and will definitely get it again!
author: Katy C.

description: The coffee cake is just as wonderful as all the reviews say.  The reviews also say to get there early or the cake could be gone.  I decided to avoid that problem by ordering a cake ahead of time.  I ordered it for pickup when the store opens at 10:00am and got a Zipcar to make the trip.  It wasn't until a few minutes after 10:00 that they told me cakes aren't available until 11:00.  I got another Zipcar to go back later in the afternoon.  I just wish I had been told about the time factor in advance.
author: Douglas A.

description:
MUST CALL BEFORE YOU COME IF YOU WANT COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE! To see if they have it and to put aside a slice or two! 

Anyway, wishful thinking of me to believe that a slice of coffee crunch cake would be waiting for me at the store at 1 pm on a Saturday afternoon. I was totally devastated to find out that it is sold out. I definitely learned my lesson! And I need to listen to the sweet lady at the shop, she told me to call first and ask about the coffee crunch cake!  

I couldn't go home empty handed, so I settled for a guava cake and green tea cake. I love how both of the cakes were soft and wasn't too sweet. I would still choose the coffee crunch cake over the other 2.
author: Kathleen U.

description:
OMG THAT MOUTH WATERING COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE!

It's soooooooo good, I'm totally ordering one for my birthday this year. The cake is soft, moist, and fluffy with a good coffee flavor. While the whip cream isn't too sweet and airy. The toffee bits on top add just the perfect crunch, texture, and sweetness to the cake. Every bite was just a piece of heaven.

Price: one slice was $5, worth every cent.
They're cash only or check.

It took me a few tries to finally get a slice of the coffee crunch cake.

Tips: closed on Mondays, you can call and have a slice reserved for you, go early if you don't have any reserved cause they sell quick!

Next to try: their guava cake.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Yasukochi's coffee crunch cake is in my top 3 dessert experiences, ever.  It's light (in texture), heavy on flavor, and not too sweet, with a really perfect ratio of soft sponge : creamy frosting : crunchy coffee candy pieces.

For those of you complaining that Mr. Yasukochi is mean on the phone: please consider the fact that he's has been sent to two internment camps by the US government, for no reason other than being of Japanese descent.  Look inside yourself and ask whether you might also be "grouchy" on the other side of that experience.
author: Nicole L.

description: If you haven't tried any of their crunch cakes you are missing out. My favorite is the lemon crunch. Coffee crunch is yummy too. I crave this place every now and then but live so far away. Call ahead (24hrs) if you are headed out there and want some. If you don't, there won't be any for you to buy. Absolutely the best cake!!
author: Viclaire S.

description:
I want to thank Yasukochi's sweet shop for bringing back memories. Yep memories of days gone by in San Francisco. When things were less hectic, it was cool to be blue collar, tech was going out to playland at the beach or playing the games at the mechanical museum.

It gets harder and harder to find those things that make San Francisco unique; those iconic establishments that were found only here.  

There used to be a restaurant in Union Square called Blums. Blums was a cool coffee shop that served really good food: But what they were really known for was their coffee crunch cake. As a little boy I loved that cake. It was the leverage my parents would use to make me eat my meal.

I thought the Coffee Crunch Cake was dead......until one of my family members (they actually listened to my musings of this legendary dessert)  found Yasukochi's on yelp. 

Low and behold for my birthday I was surprised by this wonderful cake. It brought  back so many memories....and dam that cake was really good: light cake, light frosting, and lovely coffee crunch bits ( not stale, not hard, but nice and light).


Thank you Yasukochi's sweet shop for stealing back some of San Francisco's lost history
author: David G.

description:
Located in the Super Mira Market, on Sutter St., in Japantown, San Francisco, YASUKOCHI'S SWEET SHOP.

I needed to order a birthday cake for one of my gf's. We were planning to eat out to celebrate, then end up at my house for dessert & coffee.

Does anyone out there remember Blum's when they were located right next door to Macy's in Union Square?  This was many years ago (obviously). My first job right out of high school was at that specific Macy's Payroll Dept (I was attending college classes at night) in 19- -. Now you didn't really think I'd fess up to that, did you? I remember they had this deliriously delicious Coffee Crunch Cake at Blums. I use to purchase it every now and then, for a special family ocassion.  Then time past, everyone got new jobs, Blums closed, no more Coffee Crunch Cake.  Until a few years back....my Gf read an article in the SF Examiner that they were running a story of a Bakery in Japantown, YASUKOCHI'S  was making a cake replicating this Coffee Crunch Cake at Blums. So I couldn't believe this, called this establishment and on a Saturday morning in September, 2014 I went to this said YASUKOCHI'S Sweet Shop the very next day and spoke to this very kind, soft spoken lady. She had a variety of pastries but my order was waiting there for me to pick up....10 inch cake of Coffee Crunch Cake.  It looked lovely, just as it had, several years prior. $31.That brought back a ton of memories!  Parking was a little challenging but if you want something bad enough, you'll make it work.  Long story short....after celebrating the birthday dinner, everyone came to my house for dessert and boy!  Did we enjoy the cake!!  To Die For!!!  The birthday girl was really surprised & overwhelmed. I gave her the remainder of the cake to take home (after, I, of course served myself another slice)

You MUST try the Coffee Crunch Cake.   It's still FABULOUS.....

FAST FORWARD 3 YEARS LATER.....

Time to order another cake. Next week is my brother-in-/law's birthday. My sis said he always loved that Coffee Crunch Cake. So she is picking the cake up prior to our dinner reservations.  Yum, Yum....can't wait!

A couple of Pro Tips. ..

Always order 48 hours ahead of time
Call 415-931-8165
Closed Sunday & Monday
CASH or checks only
Does not accept credit cards
author: Janet T.

description:
The coffee crunch cake did live up to the high rating expectations. It's just simply heavenly delicious!

-Located inside the Super Mira grocery store.
-Tastier than the ones you can buy in Chinatown.
-$35 for a full round cake
-Come before noon to buy a slice, else be ready to buy an entire cake.
-Just as delicious for several days after, but be sure to saran wrap it.

Minus 1 for it being on the pricey side, over 50% more expensive than the ones in Chinatown. Selection was non-existent by 12:30PM. Their 5 star rating is not for the bakery, but for their signature cake.
author: Jen Z.

description:
Coffee crunch cake. Need I say more?! If you come here, you HAVE to get the coffee crunch cake. For father's day, the roommate was in charge of bringing the cake, so he decided on the infamous coffee crunch cake. You can call in and reserve a whole cake so make sure to do that if you're going to get a whole cake. (We got the 8" which was just enough for about 8-10 people to have a decent sized slice. The cake is 4 layers tall, so you don't need to serve super thick slices.) The cake is super moist, soft and not too sweet. I can't stand cakes that are overly sweet so this was perfect for me! And the whipped cream and crunchy toffee bits added just the right amount of creaminess and crunch! Yum! The roommate's mom and brother loved the cake much, they asked us to bring another one the next time we visit!

This visit, I also got the Strawberry & Lemon roll. The strawberry had bits of fresh strawberry along with a light fruity strawberry cream. Sooo good! The lemon roll had a nice tartness which I loved. I hate it when lemon cakes are just sweet without the tartness of the lemon to balance it out. This had just the right amount of sweet and tart! Unfortunately they were out of the green tea roll which I really wanted to try. Next time!

We got the strawberry and cream sandwich since the roommate knows I LOVE strawberries and whipped cream. But the strawberry came with a fruit gel which I didn't love. Plus the pastry made it kind of hard to cut up and eat.
