Regardless of the strawberry and cream sandwich, this place deserves 5 stars for the coffee crunch cake and cake rolls! Can't wait to finally try the green tea roll!
author: Elena N.

description:
Yesterday was my mom's birthday so I called in around 12 noon to order the ever so popular coffee crunch cake, hoping it wasn't sold out. (Call in one day in advance) Luckily, the man over the phone said there was one more, so he took my name and number, to save it for me. I picked it up around 2pm and paid a little more than $30. (Cash only)

My friend told me about this place, and about the cake. He swears it is the only cake he will eat for his birthday, so I was really excited to try this. When it came time to eat, my mom loved it, I loved it, and even my dad who isn't a big dessert fan came for seconds. Overall, soo delicious, and the couple who sold me the cake was so nice and sweet. I need this cake for my birthday!
author: Corinna T.

description: I keep telling myself to leave a secret stash of cash in my car for emergencies...yasukochi cake emergencies. They take cash or check only. I usually get the coffee crunch and mocha roll by the slice for $3.95 each. Came in before noon today and waddled away with two slices of each.
author: Herissa C.

description:
When your roommate is your best friend, and your best friend has a birthday, and that birthday is today, and that day needs a cake, and that cake needs to be the best damn cake ever... you come to Yasukochi's Sweet Stop.

It just so happened to be two blocks from where I live, but I would have driven across town to get some the GIANT coffee crunch cake.

It is huge, caramel/coffee crusted on the outside and sweet soft vanilla cake on the inside. You can tell they did not cut corners with this cake.

Come here for urgent best-friend birthday cakes. And other stuff too.

---

Distinguishing factor: Fantastic cake shop and bakery, tucked in a grocery shop in Japan town. It cannot get more hole in the wall than this.
author: Nick A.

description:
I almost don't want to write this review to add to the 5-star ratings so that all the tourists will find it and then there will be a long line out the door...but their coffee crunch cake is just too good!  The coffee crunch bits on top give it such a buttery kick to the subtle sweetness of the cake.  I'm not a dessert person but I crave this cake!  That says a lot.  Love it!  

My friend and I stopped by one early afternoon just to see if they had any slices left to sell.  We got all nervous because there was one slice left and there were a couple people in line in front of us.  Bite nails, pace a little.  The two people were buying whole cakes of a different kind (I bet any dessert or cookie they make is yummy - they've just got that touch!) for a social gathering.  Ok ok good good, can I buy that one slice of cake now, please (we were planning to split it)?  And just as we were inching forward, the man in the back brought out a full tray of coffee crunch cake.  We whooped and hollered with glee!! - I think they get a kick out of the joy we feel about their cakes!  They also sell the coffee crunch bits separately in a bag - to add to your own cakes?  Or eat it straight out of the bag?  I'm not sure - either way, it's going to be good but not as good as the combination of their cake and the coffee crunch bits on top.

Seriously though, it is some really good stuff!  We had lunch, did some shopping and took the bus home.  As soon as I got home, I served it up (a slice for each of us, thank you!) for my bf and I and oh wow, total silence as we ate so happily.  Arigato, Yasukochi's!  Love you!
author: Maile N.

description:
Cake is amazing but sometimes the staff's phone manner really tests my patience. 

"What do you want" is not a proper way to answer a call and "call earlier next time" shouldn't be the last thing a customer hears before you hangup!
author: Jennie O.

description:
For the pass 20+ years my family would always purchase a cake from Sweet Stop.  We do not live in San Francisco so we had to make a special trip to the city to pick up the cake.  The cakes were always worth the trip because they were always great cakes.  It was my husband's birthday today, so I ordered his favorite cake, Coffee Crunch from Sweet Stop and drove to SF to pick it.
I was so disappointed when I tasted the cake.  It was not fresh.  It tasted like it sat in the refrigerator for days.  I was so sad and disappointed. Won't be making this trip any more.
author: Nancy C.

description:
A secret sweet haven hidden in a japan town market. 

Seriously, some of the best coffee crunch cake I've had; rich in flavor, a variety of textures between the top layer of "crunch" to the sweet and fluffy middle. Their lemon chiffon is like biting into a delectable lemon cloud; light, tasteful, and excellent with coffee. Give Yasukochi's Sweet Shop a visit, it's hard to find unless you've heard through the grapevine, but it's well worth it.

Bottom line: Must try the coffee crunch cake and the lemon chiffon.
author: Jaime W.

description:
The coffee crunch is the best thing ever!!! The layers are soft and the crunch is just so good! I tried the lemon crunch, but I didn't think it was as good because I am not a big fan of lemon (only got it because it was the last slice available at noon).

Definitely call in the morning (any time as the nice lady at the counter told me) to reserve a slice. By noon, they have a few pastries left but no cake slices!!
author: Karina N.

description:
Like previous reviews have stated, Come early!!! Well that's only if you want slices of coffee crunch cake. I came another time at 130ish and they were sold out! Came today at around 1030 and they still had plenty of slices! 

Guava cake: 4/5: extremely moist yellow cake with layers of fluffy guava whipped cream and topped with guava jelly. Loved the cake, but I wish that it had more guava flavor. 

Coffee crunch cake: 5/5: had the same moist yellow cake and plenty of whipped cream in between. Loved the candy topping it was absolutely delicious. This kind if taste like eastern bakeries coffee crunch cake but there are slight differences such as the cake. I'm coming back for more in the future 

Lemon crunch cake: 4/5: I love lemon most of the time and this was pretty good. The cake texture is so moist. I really like the lemon candy on top but it got to be too much half way through.  I would get this again and share!!! 

I'm looking forward to coming back in the future for more cakes! These are so good! 

Total for 3 cakes: $12
author: Stella J.

description: Absolutely try the coffee crunch cake. It is my favorite coffee cake ever! It's no wonder this particular cake is sold out by 12pm.
author: Jeff B.

description:
This little gem is hidden away inside a mini market!! They only accept cash, so remember that and you won't regret it!!

I got the last two slices of their famous coffee toffee cake and it was AHHHHHMAZING. (Go before 11am so you can grab by the slice cake instead of having to buy the whole cake!) 

The cake is so light/moist/fluffy and the "frosting" isn't overly sweet, which I prefer. And the toffee gives it a nice texture without getting stuck to your teeth!! Really, a perfect slice of cake.

I would DEFINITELY recommend!
author: June S.

description:
Being the dessert-obsessed nerd that I am, I did copious amounts of delicious research prior to visiting SF. I stumbled upon Yasukochi's Sweet Stop, and I knew I had to try the coffee crunch cake no matter what. Plus, the CCC comes with a cool backstory and is distinctively San Franciscan. Perfect!

My proxy reserved three slices for the two of us two days in advance. Despite having his first name's spelling mangled and phone number with random digits, the slices were still set aside for us, whew. Thank you, really nice lady.

The coffee crunch cake is so delightful. Tender layers of chiffon (I think?) sandwiched between cream, with caffeinated crispy crumbles on the outside will make your tastebuds stand up and belt out a showstopper.

The cake keeps well too. Crunchies soften some, but keep your precious pastries in an airtight container. CCC was fine three days later in the fridge.

Take away messages: Cash only, closed Sundays and Mondays. Reserve your CCC slices or whole cake ahead of time. Definitely order extra slices because you will want more. Trust me.
author: Lisa H.

description:
My first time attempting to order this infamous caramel crunchy cake. I called to hopefully reserve one before I drive from Daly City...WOW that was the worst customer service! The guy who could've been the owner or someone there who sounded a lot older, he was one, very impatient and kept asking me what do I want... hence I had no idea there was chocolate, lemon and caramel flavor. 2nd I had to give them more notice... Well, That's why I was calling to make sure I can walk in to buy a cake! 
So as delicious as it could be... He definitely left a very bitter taste in my mouth. Thanks for the awesome customer service!
author: angela l.

description:
I've recently found my old account for Yelp and I'm in the midst of transferring over my reviews. The rating and the review are exactly the same so their overall review didn't change as I've deleted my reviews from my old account and it's not inactive. Reposting the old reviews with my previous ratings was the only way I can transfer these over unfortunately.

Review date: 10/8/2014 
I know, I know another review about the coffee crunch cake but no I'm not doing my review on that (as amazing as it is) because there are 100s of reviews on it and it gets repetitive.  I'm here to write about their guava cake! It is so delicious and the taste,  I can't even describe it! I have a major sweet tooth but usually won't drive 20 minutes for it and try looking for parking to satisfy my cravings. however, I found myself calling in today to reserve a slice of that yummy goodness (best way is to call and reserve a slice and pick it up whenever) and whoa and behold they didn't have any today... my heart sunk and I never felt so low. I asked for a slice of coffee crunch and they happened to have lemon crunch too so I got a piece of that as well. Let me tell you, I have high standards for my lemon desserts since it's my favorite flavor of cake and I like it super moist and most places make it too dry or too tart. I can honestly say that I fell in love with this super moist lemony (not too tangy and tart) cake. I could however do without the crunch because it gets stuck in my teeth. I may just possibly order me a lemon birthday cake (ive been looking for a good one for 2 years) here but sans crunch.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
I ordered a whole cake. The look was very homey and homemade - wish it was a little more elegant looking... 

Taste wise the coffee toffee crunch is just mmmmm good- the cake itself is extremely light and whip cream is light and tastes good 

Only issue is that the coffee toffee crunch is yummy by itself as the sponge cake and whip cream stand alone
author: Ruby P.

description:
Well known for it's coffee crunch cake and it does not disappoint.
The location is in a japanese market so it is a hole in the wall but worth hunting down.
Buy by-the-slice or order a whole cake but beware they can sell out early.
I noticed guava cake as an option as well as a mocha coffee crunch and other flavors and sweet bakery goods, so there are choices to savor.
If you want something different and tasty, get a crunch.
author: David H.

description:
Minus one star for lack of organization, but I must admit that their coffee crunch cake is amazing! 

After reading about this popular cake, I called to order one for my mom's birthday on Tuesday morning to be picked up on Sat, 3/21, but the cake was disappointingly not ready for me when I came by. After "looking" for 10 minutes, they realized that someone had written "Fri, 3/21" instead of "Sat, 3/21" ... At least they got the date right so they knew that they were at fault. In the end, they somehow produced a cake for me to purchase so I was grateful for that, but I'm still wondering whose coffee crunch cake they gave me since they were already sold out for the day...

Anyway, fast forward to eating it. The fluffy cake in between layers of light frosting mixed in with Violet Crumble-like candy was hands down one of the best cakes I've ever had although it didn't have as much "coffee" flavor as I expected. It was still so delicious though and I love how it wasn't too sweet. It was hard to resist another slice! I think it's worth the $33 and definitely would recommend it, but I also recommend double checking all the details of your order!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
The Green Tea Roll, a creamy, rich cake that melted in my mouth, absolutely blew my mind. I definitely want to try the Strawberry Roll now. 

I had a bite of the Coffee Crunch and Lemon Crunch. I'm not a huge fan of either flavors, but it might be an understatement to call them crunchy as those chunks are rock solid!
author: Mark C.

description: LOVE their signature coffee crunch cake. so good, that we had it as our wedding cake. and boy did our guests rave about it.
author: mark s.

description:
Cutest family owned bakery!

- The bakery is located inside Super Mira Market. As soon as you walk into the supermarket, turn to your right and you should see it. 
- My friends and I were really excited to try the ICONIC coffee crunch cake!!! I heard amazing things about this cake so I had to make my way to Japantown to try it. Once we got there, my friends and I got overly ambitious and decided to order not only the coffee crunch cake, but also a slice of the lemon crunch, and a slice of the vanilla/strawberry roll! 
- Turns out that the cake lives up to the hype! All the cakes were moist and fluffy but what really gave it the 5 stars was the "crunch" topping!! I don't know what it's made out of but it's so unique and tasty!! I've never had anything like it before! (I was going to take a picture but I got too excited and finished more than half the cake by the time I remembered... aha oops )  
- The coffee crunch and the lemon crunch are tied in tastiness in my opinion :) Just go for whatever you're craving, lemon or coffee. 

** I really love small family owned businesses and I'm a huge supporter of it. The shelf located behind the counter displays a cluster of family portraits and pictures of the grandkids. It's a nice homey change in pace.**

The crunch cake is awesome and the workers are kind and friendly. :) Join me in supporting our local family owned businesses!!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Coffee crunch cake here is hella good. All the reviews are right. The cake is light and the cream is tasty. Make sure if you want one you call ahead and order if you know you are heading to the area. 8" cake is $30 and I just tried the chocolate crunch cake and it is just as good as well. 

I you want a tasty cake for a special occasion this is a good spot to go.
author: Vincent W.

description:
Even if you don't like coffee, you have to try this cake!! 

For the record, I don't taste coffee anywhere in this cake unless it is a *very* small part of the crunchy topping. I think it is a little sweet to eat on its own, but it pairs very well with a cup of black coffee, which is my bet for why it is called "coffee" crunch cake. 

So many things in this world do not live up to their hype, but this cake is definitely not one of them. 

If you are in the neighborhood, you must try this cake. I don't know if they sell slices, but you can order a whole cake as long as you call the day before. Plan ahead. Do whatever it takes. I am not really a "cake person," and I didn't know what to expect. I mean, you see all of the pictures online here and wonder what the heck is that cake made of?!?  

If you are familiar with seafoam candy (or the "Violet Crunch" candy bar), that's pretty much what the coating of this cake is made of. On its own, it is very sweet, but also has the bitterness of dark caramel. This is complemented by the creamy frosting that holds it in place on the outside of the cake and also separates 4 layers of the lightest white sponge-type cake that I've ever had. The slight bitterness of the crunchy coating is a perfect counterpoint to the sweetness of the frosting and the lightness of the cake itself. You get sweet and bitter (not in a bad way), creamy and crunchy, all wrapped together with a very light and tasty cake. 

A friend picked this up for me in San Francisco and I carried it on the plane back to Phoenix where we had it for dessert, then I ate it for breakfast (2x) and a snack a couple of days later. For the best experience, I recommend eating it on the day that you get it, but even after 5 days in the refrigerator, this cake was still very tasty and the topping retained a lot of its crunch.

I don't know what other goodies they sell at this place, but I am going to find out on my next trip! There is a reason they have been around for 41+ years. No lie, it might be just because of this cake, but I am hopeful that there is even more.
author: Doug B.

description:
Home made Coffee crunch cake is so delish. It is so light and fluffy on the inside but sweet and crunchy on the outside from the coffee crunch layer.

I love that you can order a sheet for a large party too.
author: Arlene R.

description:
Great coffee crunch cake! 
Like everyone has mentioned this store is shared and tucked in the inside corner if a supermarket. 

Coffee crunch by the slice $3.84
If your going to buy more than 2 slices midas well get the whole shebang $29.50!

Worth the trip to J town ;) try it at least once.
author: Liz N.

description:
Inside the Super Mitra supermarket in the corner. You need to get here before 11 am to get a slice of the famous coffee crunch cake ($3.95 per slice). I wasn't so lucky. They did say I can order ahead and they'd hold a slice for me to pick up.

PS I know this isn't a real review, just wanted to share some tips I got. Will re-review after I get to try the cake.

PPS So as to not mess up the overall star rating with my non-review I gave it the same as the average.
author: Jean K.

description:
I think this cake is the best cake you can get in San Francisco. 

I am a lover of cakes and this cake has so much to love - light, moist texture; a delicious whipped cream frosting and filling; the unique and delightfully crunchy coffee flavored toffee topping that has ever party guest asking "Where did you get this???" and "Can I have a second slice???"

I daresay it is one of the only cakes I feel doesn't need ice cream to make it better!

Definitely order it ahead and confirm the shop is operational when you need your cake. Also know that if you extra, the leftovers taste great 1-3 days later. 

If you haven't tried it yet do yourself a favor and order a cake, occasion or not. I'm sure you'll be able to find friends to help eat it. If you can't, sign me up for a slice or four. Or just hoard the whole thing for yourself.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
That coffee crunch cake! Wow!! That crunchy toffee outside, with the perfectly moist cake on the inside = probably one of the best cakes I've had.

There are very few JA-owned businesses in Japantown these days. Glad to see them still going strong!
author: Kazu O.

description:
I've loved everything I've ever tried here! The guava cake, lemon cake, coffee crunch cake, chocolate cake roll... My grandma is really picky about desserts, but the coffee crunch is her absolute favorite so we get her birthday cake here, as well as for other family members' birthdays, from this bakery. And may I say, as basic as a chocolate cake roll sounds (the one with the swirled filling), it is one of my favorite desserts of all time. It is heaven! Even as leftovers! 

Large cakes, or customized orders - call at least a few days before for their convenience!
author: Stacey L.

description:
I've been wanting to try this coffee crunch cake for some time now. Luckily, my friends hosted a sous vide dinner party and it was the perfect excuse to bring some dessert over.

I called to reserve an 8" cake and when I got there (it's in the corner of a Japanese market), it was already boxed up and ready for pick up. Thumbs up for the efficiency but sad I didn't get to see how the cake looked like before it got packed up.

As I unbox it at dinner, we were all surprised at how big this cake really is! It's a few inches high and completely covered in coffee crunch. There was only 8 of us and I struggled to figure out how big the slices should be for everyone haha

When we finally started eating it, everyone enjoyed it. I personally think the coffee crunch was a bit sweeter than I'd like. The cake is quite good though.

Cash only!
author: Sandy T.

description:
The coffee crunch cake is the best! If you've ever had the caramel cake from Sun flower bakery from herecules, it's on the same level but this cake has toffee all over the cake. The cake was soft and moist and it wasn't too sweet. However, the toffee could be really sweet. 

I picked up the cake on Thursday and ask the sweet elder lady that we weren't going to eat it until Sunday. She advised to place in the freezer until the morning of. 

I would give this place 5 stars but when I called in to reserve a cake that man who took my order was very rude! He scolded me for calling too late, since I picked up same day. I called at 10 and picked up the cake at 130 pm. He  hung up the phone before I could even ask any other questions.

Other than that sad customer service this place is wonderful.  The sweet elder lady made everything better.
author: Jan C.

description:
After reading previous posts, we got to the shop early in the morning just after they opened.  The coffee crunch is every bit as good as I imagined.  It was pure joy to eat it.  The lady at the bake shop is very nice.  I wish I live in SF and can get the coffee crunch cake all the time.  The combination of the moist cake, the cold cream and the crunch for texture is just perfect.  
I feel it is best to eat the cake as soon as you get it.  This way every element of the cake is at its prim condition to be consumed.  The bake shop do not sell coffee.  The lady at the bake shop suggested that we go across the street to the corner coffee shop.  We went in and asked the lady if we can eat the cake with her coffee and she said yes.  The cream in the middle of the cake was cold.  The coffee crunch is a light crunch, doesn't stick to your teeth.  This cake with hot coffee is a perfect combination.  We thanked her lady at the coffee shop and left a nice tip.  Everything felt brighter and happier.
author: Elim M.

description:
Love their cake rolls! 

The sweet shop is located inside this cute Japanese market on the corner in Japantown. When you walk into the market, you'll see the counter for the shop on the right.

I have only tried their cake rolls and I must say, it was delicious! They are not super sweet but very flavorful. 

I will definitely recommend!
author: Arda S.

description:
I've only had their Coffee Crunch Cake and I can't imagine ever coming here without leaving with one. 

I was first introduced to this delicious cake a few years ago, and ever since then, this is my favorite cake to bring to all occasions. Call me a boring, but it never fails to impress.

I hear that they have a lemon crunch and a chocolate crunch cake as well, so I may give it a try one day. 

If you haven't tried the infamous coffee crunch cake from Yasukochi's Sweet Stop, I think it's time for you to pay them a visit!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
crap.  i really wanted to enjoy their famous coffee cake.  but that topping just ruined it.  
had the BD drive 2.5 hours to japan town to buy their cake because i was so curious about it and the last time i went there at 5pm like a chump, they were sold out.  they get three stars because it's light, fluffy, and not excessively sweet.  the cream is yum.  but the crunchy topping, while the texture is great, just RUINS it.  it lends a burnt and bitter taste to the cake that i could SMELL before i even opened the box.  ack!  bummer!
author: Walerz B.

description:
For years I never knew what this little pastry shop was called. My dad used to take me here as a kid and we'd walk out with a big pink box that I'd lovingly guard in my lap on the ride home. Inside this magical pink box? Their heavenly coffee crunch cake. 

You're probably wondering what could possibly make this cake so appealing. It's just cake after all. But it's four layers of soft white sponge cake and fluffy whipped cream topped with the most tantalizing coffee crunch topping. The crunch has the consistency of toffee-like meringue that starts off light and crisp, but develops into a slightly chewy consistency that just barely sticks to your teeth. The flavors of each component work together beautifully and come together to make one awesome cake! 

The only downside to this cake is the fact that it's delicate and not too sweet or heavy, which literally makes you want to devour the entire thing. I am no savage though! I only have seconds. 

This mom 'n pop sweet shop makes all their cakes and pastries with love and expertise, which really produces some quality goods. Their coffee crunch cake is only about $30, which is a steal in my opinion! It's a staple birthday cake in my family and we always call ahead just to make sure it's ready for us because they're often sold out by the afternoon. Do give them a try if you haven't already! They're easy to pass up if you're walking by....but maybe that's a good thing. More coffee crunch cake for me!
author: Deanna Y.

description: You come here to get the coffee crunch cake. Your taste buds will be so happy. I recommend serving the cake with warm coffee. This cake is perfect for potluck sand birthday parties. Buy a whole cake for those nights when you have guests over, and they will never forget the best dessert they had at your place.
author: Joanne K.

description:
This little sweet shop is tucked away inside small Japanese grocery store. I've been meaning to try this place for so long but every time I stop by it's closed. I wanted to try the coffee crunch cake and bring something for my mom to try.

WHAT I ORDERED:
Coffee crunch cake (4.5 Stars) 
This was so delicious. I love the unique crunchy texture of the coffee brittle combined with the soft moist sponge cake. The coffee flavor was strong and paired well with the fresh cream and cake. I would definitely come back again to order this.

Giant Almond danish (3 Stars) 
This was pretty good and very sweet but not over the top sweet. I didn't think this was any different from other danishes I've tried.

TIPS:
1. Try the coffee crunch cake
2. Check for store hours before going
author: Jennie C.

description:
Hosting a party called for me to find a good dessert to appease a large crowd of drunk people. What better opportunity would there be for me to give a chance to the coffee crunch cake that I've heard so much about?

It seems this cake is so popular that you have to order it more than a day in advance just to ensure you get one. 

It lived up to the hype. The coffee crunch coating was wonderfully rich and tasty. It would be too rich to eat by itself, but paired with the soft and creamy cake underneath it all comes together to be one of the best cakes I have had. 

Definitely give this cake a shot if you get the chance, and don't let the fact that the storefront is nestled in the back corner of a small grocery mart turn you away.
author: Mark O.

description:
This cake is so delicious! It was worth the walk from the hotel to pick some up. Yes, I walked here from Union Square for the sake of cake from Japantown.

This place is inside the Japanese market and it's a very modest setup. They have other sweets, but I had my eye on the prize - Coffee Crunch Cake. It was soft sponge cake, with a light cream filling, and the delicious, crunchy, yummy, mmmm mmmm good coffee crunch on the outside. Those pieces of crunchy toffee are the best... seriously! This was so damn good and I want some more!

I ended up buying a couple of slices for our stay in San Francisco and had it as a snack. I also gave some to some friends as a thank you for taking us around. 

The lady helping us was nice and friendly especially considering they just opened and it was pretty early in the morning. She put both my orders in two separate boxes and wrapped it with a nice ribbon.

This place is definitely wroth the stop! Just as a side note, your cake should be refrigerated or kept in a very cool place to ensure it stays yummy!
author: Hugh H.

description: My go to coffee cake, the nicest people on earth.  Hi Mo Hi Hatsy, love you.  Everyone had a piece for Thanksgiving dessert.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Yasukochi's coffee crunch cake is sooooo moist and delicious !  We have been going here close to 40 years....They even did my wedding cake in 1975.  Can you believe that !!!
We come all the way from Pacifica to get our cakes and when we visit friends in Roseville, Sacramento, Salinas, and even Los Angeles....the coffee crunch cake is the requested dessert !!!
author: Chris M.

description: The most WONDERFUL Dutch Crunch cake.  Worth every penny.
author: Linda L.

description:
I've had their lemon crunch cake a few time before and it is to die for! Hands down my most favorite cake!
It is very moist, soft, and flavorful. I love the candy crunch on the outside. It is crunchy but not too crunchy where it'd break your teeth
Worth every dollar for the full cake. 
Can never go wrong with this place!
author: Julie K.

description:
I had no idea this place was here and I'm happy it introduced me to Super Mira Market!

As previous Yelpers have stated, Yasukochi's is located in the corner of Super Mira Market. I arrived early to snag a piece of coffee crunch cake and was very excited to try it out. One piece was $4. My first bite of the cake was really delicious: sweet cream layered between pieces of cake with a sugary, crunchy, coffee flavored topping. But as I continued eating I was less impressed. The crunchy topping was a bit too sweet and the cake wasn't as moist as I would have liked. 

In the end I kind of wish I had ordered something else; the roll cakes looked so yummy and the cake with the strawberry topping was super enticing. Maybe I'll try another piece sometime, maybe not... we'll see.
author: Sam F.

description: One of our family's remaining traditions is coffee crunch cake. So many celebrations associated with one of these sheet cakes. I remember my grandpa had a notable birthday and we ordered a gigantic double sheet that fed us all. And we had frozen CC cake leftover at home for a few months. That was heaven on earth as a teenager. Thanks for the memories!
author: Ron W.

description:
CAKE SO PHUCKIN' GOOD, IT WILL MAKE YOU...

Ok, let me preface by saying that I'm not much of a sweet tooth. I won't go out of my way for desserts but if it's there I'll eat it. The coffee crunch cake from Yasukochi's Sweet Shop is an EXCEPTION. I would literally knock a b*tch out for it. Ok, no I wouldn't (I can't even hurt a fly) but I think you get my drift. IT'S THAT GOOD.

Four heavenly layers of soft sponge cake with a gentle smearing of whip cream between each layer that's covered with crunchy coffee flavored toffee bits. It's a melding of textures and flavors what will send you to dessert ecstasy. The combo of fluffy cake, rich yet light whip cream and buttery crunchy coffee toffee is SUBLIME. A perfect balance of sweet and subtle richness (not heavy) what will deliciously satisfy your sweet tooth.

Pair the coffee crunch cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream to take it to WHOLE OTHER LEVEL. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EfkCyCaKoUFVdkRoi2prMw?select=eAMIuaz96rgCVxivtpXcjw What level you may ask? 

CREAM IN YOUR PANTIES...

JIZZ IN YOUR BOXERS...

L
E
V
E
L

Yeup, it's that ORGASMIC!

OTHER NOTES:
*Cake Menu: Chocolate Crunch Cake, Guava Cake, Strawberry Roll, Green Tea Roll, etc. 
*Cake Sizes: 8", 9", and 10" round, a roll, or sheet cake
*Call ahead to reserve cake slices and whole cakes
*Cash or Check only
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Yeah, OK, that coffee crunch cake was awesome and worth the drive from the East Bay to this joint.  It's soft, moist and not coyingly sweet.  They have 3 varieities: vanilla, chocolate and lemon. An 8" cake will run you about $31 and yes you might get a cheaper knock off at Red Ribbon or other Asian bakeries.  But Yasukochi's is the real deal.  When you ask for it sliced, they will charge you an extra $2 and they slice the thing down the middle and put it in two separate boxes.  That's a little shady though because sliced to me means portioned slices not 2 big pieces of cake.  But Debbie behind the counter had mad customer service skills and after all she was doling out some really good cake which for all I care they could have served in a shoe worn by a homeless guy, it was that good.

Parking is a bit of a hassle, thought not too bad during the earlier part of the day.  We found a choice spot right around the corner.
author: Joc V.

description:
I have been going here for years now, and I feel a little sad that I didn't go there sooner.  My best friend and I have an ongoing argument because she knew about it years,no decades, before me and didn't think it important to tell me about a baker who bakes heaven by the slice every day! I am talking about the crunch cake. All flavors are delicious...there is coffee, lemon and chocolate. 

Whatever you are doing....STOP!!! Go get a piece of crunch cake. You have not lived if you have never tried it.
author: Edi M.

description:
Coffee crunch cake... still to DIE for.  Hell, I'd probably kill for it.  I wanted a slice... but they run out by 12, and I was there at 1.  Oops.  (But she said I can call and ask to have some set aside, for future reference, woooohoooo!!  I ended up buying the whole coffee crunch cake, and luckily I had people over for dinner, to help eat 1/2 of it.  That left the other 1/2 for the two of us...which was polished off last night!  (Purchased only Saturday...lol)  

I tried a slice of their lemon cake...ZOMG.  YAY!! Lots of lemon and super moist.  

I missed this place so much.  I keep forgetting that they have banker's hours, and they're not open on Sundays!  

Service = still super friendly Japanese lady!
author: Fannie S.

description:
Finally got to try this place after a few attempts.  Either they were closed or ran out of the coffee crunch cake I came hunting for.  
so.....i called ahead to reserve a WHOLE cake! 

called around 9:30am and got my cake by 2pm.  it was heavy and dense...4 layers of cake plus frosting and crunchy crunches.  cake was moist and fluffy.  it was not too sweet but with the crunchy nougat, it can get overwhelming.
nice smoky coffee flavor throughout.

good cake, but nothing spectacular.  they have other rolls, cookies, and pastries too.  they charge about $29 for the whole cake plus extra $3 to write "happy birthday."  $3 for writing it a lot, especially since it was a simple frosting scribble and not anything extraordinary.

I like this one old japanese lady there.  she was very nice and soft spoken.  she gave me their card to call so she can save me a slice a cake.  other people there are a bit rude and do not seem to understand my english.
author: Linda T.

description: Super overrated. While we didn't get there early enough to catch the famous coffee crunch cake, we did try a few other pastries. The strawberry spongecake was really good but it tasted so fake at the same time. The chocolate pastry was pretty bad. The chocolate portion tasted like sour black bean paste. The bear claw was almost unedible. Besides the super fake flavor, it was soft. Nothing like the crispy and chewy bear claws I've had at other bakeries. And on top of it this place is cash only and has zero ambiance. I guess this review is super biased because I didn't get what the place is known for, but all the other good bakeries I've been too don't survive off one good item and cruise by with sub-sub-sub par other items. A good bakeries has to have a good selection of all pastries and sweets. This place apparently has only 1 out of 50.
author: Lucy C.

description: It's fantastic and super yummy. Everything there is great and tasty。 granny and grandpa use traditional way to make cakes, drag you to old time old days when you were young. It's the flavor you can't forget, no one can copy and everyone loves.
author: Olivia J.

description:
LOVE this place. I called two days prior and an elderly lady picked up and took my order. She was kind and polite and asked how many people will be eating the cake and determined that I needed the 9inch cake. We went to pick up the amazing cake two days later. I forgot that it was cash only, BUT there's an ATM right outside the store. My friend who isn't a fan of cake LOVED it as well. Definitely getting more cakes from here in the near future. 

P.S. to the reviewer  below Young Y. - you sound like butthole.
author: Kimber N.

description: The coffee crunch cake is truly amazing and delicious. The sponge cake itself is so airy and fluffy, it's amazing. Topped with the crunchy coffee pieces. Mmmm. I loved it because it wasn't too sweet, and the texture was so good. I finished three pieces and still wanted more. :)
author: Sarah T.

description:
Had to post the link to an SF Chronicle article featuring this adorable place:

http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=%2Fc%2Fa%2F2011%2F11%2F04%2FCMBL1LBCN7.DTL

The best, and I do mean the BEST, crunch cakes you and your senses will ever experience. A San Francisco original that I can never get enough of.
author: Colleen M.

description: Coffee crunch cake...imagine eating a fluffy cloud.  Individual pieces sell out quick, so call in a day before to reserve a piece.  I ended up buying a whole cake cause I was already there and it was my wife's birthday request.  It was so good, we had no problem finishing it a few days after.  Cash only.
author: Leland H.

description: This was the second time we ordered a cake for a function and both times was a breeze. Friendly service and a delicious cake. So many people were asking us where the cake was from. Light, airy and crunchy! Yum!
author: Liza D.

description:
When I lived nearby, I would pop in this little shop whenever the mood struck (weekly, at least).  And everything people have said about the coffee crunch cake is true.  It's perfection.    The other cakes I tried over the years have all been delicious, and if the coffee crunch cake was sold out, as it often was, I was never too disappointed to have to choose something else.

I called today to order a cake for Thanksgiving, and contrary to what others have said, the woman that answered was very pleasant and professional.  I can't say enough good things about this place.

BRING CASH or checks, because they don't take credit/debit cards!
author: Nehwrenda N.

description:
Mmm. mmm. wow.

Had to try the infamous coffee cake and so glad I did. Please believe the hype, its true. Trust. Toffee crunch, light, vanilla cake filling all found in one slice. Yum.

If you don't believe me, try to get a slice of the coffee cake after 12pm... (consider yourself lucky if you do :0) )
author: C M.

description:
The coffee crunch cake (aka crack cake) did not disappoint!! If you haven't tried it yet, drop what you're doing and go get a slice. You're sure to become a coffee crunch believer!

I took everyone's suggestions here to ensure my visit was a successful one:
1. make sure they are open by calling ahead
2. go early (got there before 10am)
3. bring ca$h (or check)
4. it's inside Super Mira Supermarket at the corner of Sutter and Buchanan 

The sweet lady was extremely nice. I ended up grabbing 1 slice each of coffee crunch cake, guava cake and green tea cake. Each have their distinct flavor, fantastic cakes!!
author: Jing D.

description: I'm in heaven with these yummy treats. My tummy will be very happy. The treats sell out fast. Make sure to go early or call in to save a cake or a slice of cake. My favorites are coffee crunch cake, lemon crunch cake, and strawberry Napoleon.
author: con c.

description:
I love when people SPIT in my food! Alright, I don't. But IF they did that here, then I probably wouldn't mind; unicorns are giving birth inside this bakery.

101:
- the crunch cake, which they're popular for, really does sell out by noon.
- cash only.
- they're located inside a small market.
- non-crunch cake items have yet to disappoint!  I had a strawberry & phyllo pastry- they used fresh, whole strawberries!
- service is adequate; don't let anyone's attitude kill your sugar high.
author: Diane N.

description:
This is definitely one of those hidden, hole-in-a-wall type of spots that you wouldn't really know about the hype unless a) you heard it through word of mouth, b) you shop at the little market it's inside of and saw the lines, c) you read/stumbled upon in on Yelp. Also, if you didn't know where it is, it'd be impossible to find as you go up and down Sutter Street looking for their storefront. It is inside Super Mira. You're welcome.

Now, I've been a fan of baked goods ever since my mother made me cookies when I was an only child (have a younger sister). I wouldn't say I'm an official baked-goods-connoisseur, but I consider myself close enough that you'd take my word when I tell you this place makes a bomb ass coffee crunch cake.

I just had a birthday and my sister (mentioned above) surprised me with this heavenly cake. I had inquired a couple of months before about pre-ordering the coffee crunch cake for my birthday but totally slipped my mind when the time came around so she knew which cake I specifically wanted. Sneaky, but I'm thankful she remembered. What can I say? It lived up to the hype. It was better than what I expected. First bite and I was sold. This will forever be my most favoritest cake ever! It is moist and light and fluffy. The coffee crunch itself, though, is a little too sweet and overpowers the actual cake. But take off a little of the crunchies and have just a teensy bit with the cake it's a party in your mouth. Absolutely scrumptious. Delectable. This goes for their rolls and other pieces of goods too. Moist, light, fluffy. But as I said, I'd always go back for the coffee crunch cake. Don't say you haven't been warned: they run out fast of the cake slices! Get there early if you want some of that piece of heaven! Good luck! :)
author: Michelle B.

description: The cake... Is worth it. Just go in - @$3.95 a slice - it is a steal! Love the grocery part too
author: Minnie S.

description:
I had my first slice of Coffee Crunch cake at a friend's bridal shower, and decided I wanted to have it for my birthday.  
The cake is light, the outside layer of caramel crunch is chewy and yummy.  Can be a bit overly sweet so it helps prevent me from getting another slice.
This place is inside a market, so I've actually gone by so many times without noticing them.
author: Karen L.

description:
I've seen this cake around and wanted to see if it lived up to the hype. It did, kinda. I think  there's a lot of hype. It IS really good. It IS light and airy. The coffee crunch topping IS freaking delicious. But I guess I didn't think it was AS amazing and life changing as everyone else says. (For reference, I find Zanze's cheesecake AMAZING...) I'd definitely eat it again though. It's a little sweet at times, but sometimes it's perfect. It's still VERY GOOD cake, on par with my favorite strawberry shortcake from Schuberts (but better). 

I called the day before and reserved some slices ($3.95 each), since other yelpers recommended doing so. I went in around 10:30am, there was one cake (for an 8 inch, it's $33) in the display, and a good 6-8 slices left. Not too bad. 

The lady was super sweet and nice. The little shop is located inside the grocery corner store. Go immediately to your right when you walk in and it's right there.
author: Jeannie L.

description: I've been here about a dozen times. Nobody makes better coffee crunch cake than this place! I buy coffee crunch cakes for all special occasions and everybody wants to know where it's from. Their chocolate Swiss rolls are a must as well. This place is amazing.
author: Hoang T.

description: Love their coffee crunch cake.  It's a must order.  Everyone I order this for a party it's a HUGE hit!  Just remember that they only take cash or check and too order in advance.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Purchase #1:
Coffee crunch cake is great and the lady was very helpful. I bought the cake in store and she was very attentive and efficient at the same time.

Purchase #2:
I had called to order the coffee crunch cake in advance. Man, the guy helping out was VERY rude. I started the call by saying I would like to place an order for a coffee crunch cake, and he asked me what flavor I wanted. Eh? So, I said (again) coffee crunch. He started raising his voice and said: "YES, BUT WHAT FLAVOR?"

HUH?!?!

"The original flavor" I said, confused. 
"IT'S COFFEE, RIGHT? COFFEE CRUNCH?" He yelled.

YES, JERK! That's what I said 30 seconds ago. Maybe instead of yelling at your customers, try listening to them instead. And then he said his hearing is not good. Yeah, no sh*t, but his yelling is apparently very good. JERK!
author: Ariana C.

description: Coffee crunch cake for my birthday!!! It was soooo good. The cake became the center of attention and totally stole my thunder but it was definitely worth it.
author: Bhavya K.

description: So every time I am in the general vicinity of Japantown I end up coming here to see if they have a slice of their coffee crunch cake. Now I know they run out but when they have it I buy it so quickly. There coffee crunch cake is delicious and this is coming from someone who doesn't even like the taste of coffee because this is much closer to toffee and the cream within the layers of the cake is great. If you are planning to get a whole cake though, make sure you order in advance because they don't always have the cake you want. This place is also cash only so make sure you aren't bringing your card to swipe.
author: Angela S.

description: Love their coffee crunch cake. But their customer service was so unpleasant on the phone. The guy who picked up the phone was so grouchy. Grouchy enough for me to write a Yelp review about it.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I got two cakes for my birthday today. One is the signature coffee crunch cake, the other one is the strawberry custard cake. Both were great! 
I like the strawberry one better, it's fresh strawberry with less sweet jelly, inside the cake, the custard works great to match up with the soft sponge layers, love it! 
Coffee crunch is a bit sweeter, but the layers are also good with cream and soft sponge inside. Thanks for the two lovely cakes. I will visit again for the roll cake next time.
author: Chung H.

description:
5 stars for the coffee crunch cake!!!! Just try it....haha I came in the early morning, so the cream tasted almost like ice cream! And the sweetness is just perfect!  There wasn't that much coffee taste, so it was kind of like eating sweet ice cream in cake form :D

I also tried the strawberry roll, green tea roll, and guava cake.  These were pretty good, but the coffee crunch cake was definitely the best!

More pics here!  http://foodishfetish.blogspot.com/2011/12/yasukochis-sweet-stop.html
author: Cathy T.

description: I used to get my Coffee Crunch Cake from Eastern Bakery in Chinatown.  But that was before I found out about Yasukochi's.  The difference in quality is night and day.  Yasukochi's Coffee and Chocolate Crunch cakes are divine, and not to be passed up on.  I had nothing but high praises from our friends who had a chance to try a piece of the Chocolate Crunch cake at a recent birthday party.  Not cheap, but so worth it.
author: JeFF T.

description: Best freaking Coffee Crunch Cake! Always got it for Birthdays and it never fails to satisfy!
author: Spooky B.

description: Based on earlier reviews, I ordered two 8'' cakes for pick-up last Friday.  One Coffee Crunch cake and one Lemon Crunch cake for my wife's birthday.  According to my wife, the Coffee Crunch is the exact recipe of the cake served by Blum's years ago.  Both cakes were sooo good!!  You won't go wrong with either cake.  When you enter Super Mira Market, make a hard right and head for Yasukochi's Sweet Stop.  One thing they told me was to store the cake(s) in the freezer overnight if you're not going to eat right away.  When you're ready to serve, defrost the cake in the fridge for 4-6 hours before slicing. Each cake was $35.  A little pricey, but definitely worth it.
author: CS S.

description:
We got the coffee crunch cake for a birthday party. It was recommended as the top cakes, so it was worth the risk. And then when I took my first bite. OMG. Best cake that I had!!

Coffee Crunch ~ I'll be back ~~
author: Irene S.

description:
This is just wrong.  The crunch cakes are too good...last supper good.  Everyone goes nuts about the coffee cake....but the others are equally delicious.  Also, the roll cakes are best I've had since my last trip to Hong Kong.  Which means I buy 3 or 4 slices of something whenever I visit.

Yasukochi's deserves all praise they get.  Best cakes I've had in a LONG time.  Will certainly go out of my way to pick up ANYTHING from here again.

Be warned...CASH ONLY.
author: Zoran L.

description:
I reserved 2 birthday cakes for my husband's surprise party a several days ago. The lady took my order was very kind and I was happy about getting cakes from the store. 

But on the pick up day there was an old guy in the store, first of all his attitude was very unfriendly. 

It took time for him to get my cakes because they were not prepared and organized well. Plus one of cake boxes was not completed closed. It was 3inches open and we can see the cake inside very easily and also wasn't taken care of well so it's very difficult to carry it to home. I can tell they never thought that I, the customer had to carry 2 big birthday cakes by myself.

I asked him to cover the cake at least and then my husband won't be able to see inside but I was very shocked about his attitude and the way he looked at me. He obviously got pissed off about what I asked him to do. 

Their very very rude and unfriendly manner made me deeply sad and give them 1 star.
author: Toshimi B.

description:
It's a bakery within a Japanese market. I was looking all over for it and the signage outside is not that big, so really pay attention to the address. The little Japanese lady inside was very sweet. Their coffee crunch cake is the best! No, literally it's their best selling cake and it's recommended to place an order first. 

I walked in on a Friday afternoon to get a slice of cake, but of course they were sold out. Not a problem, I bought the whole cake instead and my family devoured it. By family I meant 4 people. It's a huge cake. They only take cash but if you forget, they have a atm machine right outside the market. Refrigerate when you're not eating it. I saved a slice and it lasted over 4 days without any taste and texture difference. It's light and tasty, not too sweet. 

My dad is in love and kept asking to make a trip out there to get more. He's not much of a cake person either. They also sell a few other types of cakes, like chocolate and fruit, pastries, etc. Try it out!
author: Julie V.

description: coffee crunch cake = one of the top cakes of all time!  a perfect balance of light angel cake base with an addicting light coffee crunch on top, which is not too hard, not too sugary, just right. (esp. if you like the lighter asian cakes).  pretty much sells out in the morning (the slices), so call ahead if possible or just give in and buy a whole one.  the chocolate one is similar with another crunchy top, but the coffee one has the best flavor profile.
author: Rob C.

description:
Finding this stop was little confusing... I've been in the grocery store before but had completely overlooked the bakery on the far right corner!

My boyfriend and I came in here initially to try their coffee toffee cake.. at around 2:30 on a Friday they were completely sold out of all the coffee toffee slices so we were a little heart broken.

There's no seating inside the grocery store nor did they provide us with any forks or napkins so we could indulge right away... BUT there's benches right across the street with a nice view of japantown and they kind of wrap each slice is wax paper so we just picked it up and stuffed our faces that way =p

Onto the cakes!

We got a slice of each of the guava cake, green tea & strawberry rolls... HOLY MOLY they were good! Still totally worth the trip! The cakes are soft and airy with perfectly whipped frosting to match!

The green tea had a nice strong flavor, while the guava was more subtle with the flavor still being present. I liked that their strawberry wasn't too sweet and tasted all natural! I think my favorite cake was the guava while my boyfriend's was the strawberry. The green tea was wonderful too and would highly recommend it to any green tea lovers! We will definitely be back for that coffee toffee cake though!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Call me crazy, but for several years now, I call Yasukochi's ahead of time & ask them to reserve some slices of Coffee Crunch Cake. I go pick it up before they close, keep it in a cooler in the car, and kill time in Japantown until our dinner reservation. 
I retrieve the cake from the car & bring it to the restaurant asking them to serve it for dessert. Some places charge a small fee for "dessert corkage", some don't. It doesn't matter. This cake is worth it. 
I only buy slices depending on the # of people attending our dinner because a whole cake serves 8-10 people & I don't want to bring leftovers home. Portion control and all that. This way I can have my cake but still be mindful of when & how often I can indulge. 
Yasukochi rocks!
P. S.
Tried the lemon roll & chocolate mocha roll. Wowzer! Also very good! The ratio of filling and cake is perfect. Next on my list is the guava cake.
author: Angelita R.

description: For those of us who grew up on Blum's Coffee and Lemon Crunch cakes, THEY ARE STILL AVAILABLE.... As scrumptious and delicious as ever..  Just the best damn cakes EVER!!
author: Thomas B L.

description:
Ordered a 9-inch round Coffee Crunch cake for my bf and it costed about 40 bucks.  I told the lady I would need it for about 12 people and she suggested the 9-inch sized cake, but I think the 9-inch is better for about 15 people.  I called in a couple days ahead to put in the order as I read from previous reviews that you have to do that otherwise they sell out.  I also ordered an extra slice of cake for a friend ($3.95).

I loved the sponge cake, soft and light and the cream wasn't very heavy.  The coffee toffee crunch portion was VERY sweet and I usually love sweet stuff and it was sweet for me.  Nonetheless, I would still eat it.

Note, cash or check only.  This place is also located within a grocery store.
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
Obviously, I had to try the coffee crunch cake. The sign in front of the bakery section of the grocery store advertised that this cake was named "Top 7 cakes in San Francisco". But be warned - this cake is for serious sweet tooths only! I'm a dessert lover, but even I had to grab a cup of coffee to pair with this cake. 

The top is a generous layer of coffee crunch candy - this is where 80% of the sweetness comes from. The cake base is airy and not too sweet, which helps counter the topping. Definitely hits the spot if you're in the mood for something sweet. 

Can't wait to try their other cakes!
author: I-Rong L.

description:
The green tea cake and the strawberry cream and chocolate cake was DELICIOUS ($3 each).

The strawberry cream had small pieces of strawberry scattered in it and it wasn't too sweet.  The cream was light but I think I could do with less of it.  The cake was moist and fluffy.

I appreciate that the Japanese wrap everything up so nicely, but I was planning on scarfing it down right when I got outside :)

Come early - the cakes were already selling out by 3pm.  The cute Japanese lady behind the counter refused to take my bf's tip - little does he know that people don't tip in Japan!  But it's so hard not to tip when service is excellent and the server is so sweet.

I'm definitely coming here for the guava cake the next time I have to get a birthday cake.
author: Vivian H.

description: The green tea roll was much better than I had expected, and I expected excellence. First off, it's not overly sweet; I don't like cakes that are way too sweet that you feel like you're going to go into a diabetic shock. The hint of green tea is very refreshing. The cake itself is very light and fluffly, and I was particularly impressed by how light the cream was. This is the perfect dessert after a long day.
author: Marbles L.

description: Love their coffee crunch cake. Each time we get their cakes for a celebration, everyone is asking about it and saying how good it is. You need to get this cake in your life.
author: stacy k.

description:
I have yet to try their infamous coffee crunch cake.  I came at 2pm on a weekday (like a dummy even after having read the reviews) expecting coffee crunch cake slices, but they were all sold out and only the whole cakes were available which I probably should have bought since I don't live around there and rarely go to that area :-(

I do NOT think their location is actually part of japantown, just a small grocery/convenience store on sutter st. across the street from the japantown area - which is why I had a bit of a hard  time looking for it until I remembered it was INSIDE a grocery store.

the lady selling the cake was very nice and courteous.  They only accept cash and check and they have a sign on their counter to that effect (I was lucky I actually had cash on me, forgetting that also after having read the reviews).

I've baked desserts at home most of my life so I get a kick out of visiting various bakeries to compare their items and quality.  I was able to try their strawberry in phyllo and except for being a bit more baked (as seen by how brown the phyllo were), the strawberry in phyllo tasted light with fresh strawberries as everyone said and while they don't have a vast selection such as Schubert's, I would LOVE to have a bakery like theirs in my neighborhood.  I will definitely get here earlier next time for those coffee crunch cake slices.
author: Frugal C.

description: Love the coffee crunch cake here!  Sometimes I buy myself an extra slice just for fun!  But you gotta make sure you go early cause the individual slices usually sell out by 11-12.
author: Tina L.

description: I have been wanting to try the baked goods here and each time they run out. What really did put me off this time was when I called to reserve a slice, the guy was very rude. I get that it was the Ramen Street Festival and it must have been a trying day of too many people and craziness, but be nice about answering your phone. Will I ever come back? Maybe...but right now I don't want to give them any of my business.
author: Carolen M.

description: their bakery is really good, esp. the matcha roll and crunchy rice coffee cake. however, its a cash only place.
author: Shuting Z.

description:
I am hooked 
*:.｡. o()o .｡.:*
Tried three varieties of cake , was so Yum! Fresh!  Customer service awesome! Picking up ordered cake tommorow. Btw, they have 3 sizes of cake you can order not just one.
author: Lost B.

description:
I got the esteemed Coffee Crunch cake. It was unlike any other cake I've eaten before and very good! But I don't think my body can handle more than one slice per...month.

I've tried few other pastries such as the Strawberries & Cream and they were all very good too.

Yasukochi's is located inside Super Mira to your right after you enter.
author: Clare Y.

description: You have to call ahead in to order to reserve a cake since they run out, specially on weekends..  The gentleman who took the order over the phone was very curt and impatient.  The lady manning the counter was friendly and sweet.  Had high expectations for the coffee crunch cake because of all the hype.  Sadly, in my opinion, did not live up to the hype. Love the coffee crunch but unfortunately, the cake was not light enough.  It was  pretty dense if you ask me.  Nothing really special about this cake to warrant the high ratings.  It's not heavenly. Not good.  I've had better.  I would recommend trying a slice if it's something you'll like. It was alright.
author: Cj P.

description: Their coffee crunch cake is the best! Usually bring an 8" (serves 8-10 people) to family gatherings, and they love it!
author: Raniel C.

description: Funky location! In Japan Town in a little mall across from the Peace plaza. Worth the hunt. The "Blum's" Coffee Crunch Cake. Dreamy. 'Nuff said. Just like the original. Oh, and the folks who work there? Nice as can be.
author: Nini M.

description: Yasukochi's Sweet Shop is located inside of Super Mira market on the corner of Sutter and Buchanan and right across from Hotel Tomo, where the b/f and I spent the weekend.  Yelping bakeries in the immediate area, Yasukochi's came up as the place for coffee crunch cake--score!  I happen to love coffee cake and then you add crunch?  I am there!  We made the short walk from our hotel room to the market when they opened at 9:30am on a Saturday morning and found the bakery's counter in the corner.  There are several different newspaper and magazine articles on the wall, all praising their special coffee crunch cake.  Unbeknownst to us, there is also a chocolate version, so we left with a slice of the regular crunch and one of the chocolate.  We split each slice and I have to say that I liked the chocolate crunch more than the regular.  It reminded me of a Ding Dong with layers with the crunchy topping giving the cake an extra special kick.  Have yours with coffee the way the name says and you're in for a real treat!
author: Terri C.

description: Gonna leave my previous 5 star review as it is because it was specifically for the cake. This review is for the service I love the coffee crunch cake nbut I find the service a little rude and obnoxious a couple times of asked for extra slice of cake to be put in the box the man was annoyed cause he had to reopen the box. Lol really??? I'm paying for it what more do you want? Another time I asked the lady to put the cake slices in a box so they don't get squashed and ruined when I get home my gosh she looked so mad! I just don't understand it. I hate when people are ungrateful and rude! Second of all they only take cash no card and they have a shady looking atm outside that I would never use. This place would be so much better if the service was a little more friendly.
author: Rita A.

description:
This place has produced some of the most quality cakes I have ever tasted. 

Ever since I was young, my family and I would order cakes from here for special occasions. Every time I go back it triggers good memories and I'm filled with that child-like excitement. I can safely say that I love Sweet Stop like a fat kid loves cake, because I am the fat kid and Sweet Stop has the cake. 

Their best cakes are their coffee crunch and dream cake. I recommend that you call them and put in an order and pick it up the next day or later in the week. Definitely one of the coolest shops around Japantown.
author: Stephen D.

description:
ORDER IN ADVANCE!! 

They sell out QUICK!!! 

My least favorite was the guava one. But everything else is delicious!!
author: Vee 2.

description:
Awesome cakes, pastries, and desserts! 

This secret little bakery is actually located within the Japanese corner store market on Laguna/Sutter and they will be closed on Tuesdays. But if your ever in the area, step right in and indulge in some of the best little cakes imaginable. They're light, fluffy, and won't give you that guilty -- "I just ate 700 calories just now!" feeling. 

Fresh whip, real fruit, friendly service -- that's what you'd expect. Just keep in mind that they sell out FAST so get em while their hot (or cold).
author: Albert L.

description:
This is definitely a little sweet stop! Came here on an impromptu visit to Japantown.

The ladies that I encountered were very nice and helpful. I called in for an 8" coffee crunch cake (OMG TDF) an hour before we were scheduled to get there and lucked out that they had a few more. You definitely should reserve or order a cake beforehand. When we got there, this one lady bought the last one in the case and it was not even 2 pm!

The cake got rave reviews from my Mom, my Aunt & my sister. Comments about the cake were: right amount of sweetness,  light, ranks up there with 2 other cakes that the family loves!

Next on the list to try: the chocolate crunch and hubby wants the lemon one.

They take cash only.
author: Ali A.

description:
Could it be? Mr. Yasukochi (just made that name up for him) picked up today and was actually able to help me??? He wasn't exactly bending over backwards for me or nothin- but he answered my questions, minus the rudeness and no hang ups! 

Full sheet - $197.00 
Half sheet - $100.00 

No deposit or prepayment needed. You can pay at the time of pickup! (I will call to confirm tho) Can't wait for that full sheet of Coffee Crunch Cake! Yuuuuum!
author: S Y.

description:
Yes to the Coffee Crunch cake!  I don't know why I haven't been here sooner.  I'm not going to bother to tell you how great the cake was but warn you that if there's more than one person waiting in line, you'll probably be there for a while.  We made the mistake of not telling them we wanted writing on our cake and was surprised there was an additional charge.  It's not huge, only about $1.50-$2; I don't remember.  But, it took them a good 10 minutes to do it.  I felt bad for the 3-4 people waiting after us.  We were probably in there for almost 20 minutes for a preordered cake.

This bakery is in a corner market and make a right when you first walk in.  Prices are a little steep but totally worth it for a small mom and pop bakery.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
*Have cash in hand. Walk to the Super Mira Market on Buchanan and Sutter. Enter the store and walk to your right passed the cash registers. Before you will be a counter with cakes, pastries and cookies behind a display case. Order at will. 

After following these directions and reaching the counter, I looked at all of the goodies and felt just a bit out of sorts. With no labels, I wasn't sure what was what but a lady appeared and kindly clarified what was what. Although she was nice, I think this Q&A could have been more efficient with labels. Also, on a small note, the lady was unhelpful when I ask for her suggestions on what to try. While I appreciate Yelpers' tips, I wanted to hear her opinion but oh well. I went for the: 

- Coffee crunch cake: Coffee crunchies atop layers of moist cake and cream.

- Napoleon with strawberry and whipped cream: flaky pastry, hunks of fresh strawberries (could be cut up a bit smaller) and yummy whipped cream. 

Both cakes hit the spot. If you're having a sweet tooth, follow the directions * above, and like myself, you will be making future stops at this sweet stop.
author: Maya S.

description:
What is the hype?? We made a special trip here to enjoy the delectable creations that everyone raves about. Don't do it! 

The coffee crunch cake is supposed to be divine...when you can get it. We certainly were not able to :( If it is such a hot commodity it confuses me why they don't make more. We "settled" for a bear claw and apple danish that were simple "ok". It tasted something similar to a Safeway bakery donut. Nothing special at all. Neither was the service. The notoriously "grumpy old man" had the day off when we were there. There was a woman and young man assisting us and neither were over the top friendly. I asked a couple of times which items were which and the woman had to come around to the front of the case to tell me what things were. This makes me think that she doesn't usually work here but I really didn't care to ask.

Bottom line...food was ok. Prices were on the high side. We had to search and search for parking. I wish we had just stopped at Safeway in the Castro and called it a day.
author: Tracie F.

description:
Five star for the toffee cake. Strawberry and green tea roll were delicious as well. The strawberry roll didn't look all that great to me when I purchased it (pink filling), but for some reason when u eat it...you'll want more. Strawberry flavor is delicious and chunks of strawberry. Green tea roll is also good. It's light and not too sweet. 

I love that their desserts are not too sweet. Will be coming back.
author: Logan N.

description:
Man, can you say POPULAR.

It still amazes me that to even reserve a few slices of crunch cake you better make sure to call a day before or when they open!! If you don't you'll be plum out of luck. So glad I was able to reserve a few slices for my mom's bday the day of!
author: Kristen C.

description:
Hot Damn! The Chocolate Crunch Cake is a Winner.   I ate it for breakfast and it was just the most satisfying meal to have!  Chocolate crunch on top.  Layers of chocolate cake and whipped cream in the middle. It's just too much.  Now, I must try the other flavors to see if they are just as good.  

Diet, forgive me!
author: Marck N.

description: I first heard about this place from my coworkers reminiscing about a cake they used to get for an office celebration, and all they could remember and describe was the sweet crunchy topping. That basically makes the Coffee Crunch Cake, although the cake base itself was a really amazing combination of dense and airy. The cream is also not sickeningly saccharine sweet. I got it for my dad's birthday, and he said, "THIS is a cake, not like those others that are just cream." You just gotta try it.
author: Christine P.

description: Love their coffee crunch cake!! I've also tried their lemon and chocolate crunch cake. Of the 3 flavors, I LOVE the coffee crunch. The lemon is nice if your looking for something refreshing but I'd still recommend the coffee - you will not be disappointed.
author: Kristina S.

description:
Love love !!! Coffee crunch. 
I don't think there is any more to say. 
So far, favorite place to order birthday cakes. 
Just the right crunch, moisture, I think its definitely worth a try. Words can't explain how I feel. 
Just give it a try, take a bite! Heck buy a slice if you don't believe me (that is if they have any left, so go early if you wanna buy by slice)

Must order 2 days ahead for the cake ( if I remember correctly)
author: Sophie C.

description:
I've been stalking this place for a couple of years now, waiting for the perfect opportunity to purchase the infamous coffee crunch cake. Each time I've visited the small bakery within a Japanese market, I've been greeted by a sweet lady who I can only assume is the owner. She kindly explained that they usually sell out of the crunch cake and it's best to order in advance. Being an avid baker, I usually make my own desserts for gatherings and special occasions, making the wait for the crunch cake two years in the making. 

A friend of mine recently graduated from dental school and after receiving an invitation to her graduation BBQ potluck, I immediately thought bringing a sugary treat to a newly graduated dentist's celebration was not only ironically appropriate, but also the perfect reason to finally try that coffee crunch cake. 

I had high expectations and the party goers were equally intrigued after I talked it up. The cake was good, but the coffee crunch pieces were overly sweet. Would I buy it again? Probably not, but at least now I know what the hype is all about. 

Cash only!
author: Lee H.

description:
Thanks to Yelp I discovered Sweet Shop's roll cake last year.  Before that, I never wanted to try the Sweet Stop even though I always shopped at Super Mina.  (I am sorry but...) because of the way their display case looked.  The way their cakes look remind me of early Showa era Japan.  They are not refined looking.  I could also tell they use food coloring which I am against.  

After reading many good reviews on Yelp, I had to give them a try, and I really liked their cakes.  Even though everyone's favorite is their Crunch cake, I like their roll cakes the best.  I think they use the same delicious light and fluffy sponge cake recipe but  the crunch part was way too sweet for me.  I don't like "American Style" sweets... 

Today I also tried their Apple Pie.  It was interesting that they put whipped cream in between but it was rustic not too sweet and yummy. 
I
author: Chie J.

description:
Best thing: coffee crunch cake!!! 
My cousin introduced me to this 2 years ago. Whenever I am in town, I always have to stop by and grab a piece of coffee crunch cake and a few bags of the coffee crunch to bring home with me! So yummy!
author: Melody Y.

description:
Congratulate me. I'm planning to ask the elderly woman behind the counter to marry me. And yes, you're invited to the wedding - it will be a simple yet tasteful affair at which my wife-to-be will cater it with all her baked goodies. Then I plan to dump her. Yep, leave her flat before the wedding night. Gee, would I have to return the gifts? I'm registered at Gump's and Crate and Barrel.

Yes, I would stoop to such immoral activities to have my fill of the tasty pastries concocted here. It's like the anti-Andersen Bakery. Sure, their stuff is sweet but never overly rich as to induce a sugar coma. There's a lightness to the frosting that I'm sure is quite deceptive, and the cake is very airy but flavorful. At $2.95 per slice, the Strawberry Chocolate Cake Roll is pretty amazing, but it's the Lemon Napoleon that really transcends most human senses. The whipped cream is perfectly aerated, and I think the topping is made up of ground lemon drops.

Yasukochi's makes cookies and cakes like a first-class Tokyo Ginza bakeshop. In fact, if you watch a vintage Yasujiro Ozu film like "Early Summer", one of the characters always buys a strawberry shortcake with whipped cream frosting at which point the other character gazes at it with quiet envy. And remember they are a most lactose intolerant people. I think they would have been thrilled by Yasukochi's.

For those who don't know already, the shop is hidden away in the Super Mira Market. But don't go there before I do because I deserve first dibs. After all, you'll be speaking with my intended. Here, let me show you the engagement ring. I got it at Costco along with a barrel of Red Vines and a 24-pack of Progresso Italian Wedding Soup. I think she'll say yes, don't you?
author: Ed U.

description:
I read their reviews before I came in and made my order via the phone like everyone said to. I called right at 930 (when they opened) and they only had an 8in coffee crunch cake left. That was exactly what I needed yay!

The guy working in the front was grumpy, but the lady was so sweet. She wasnt helping me but as she walked by, she made eye contact with me and gave me the sweetest, most sincere smile and said thank you :) aweee ...

Looking at the cake, I was worried that it wouldn't taste good. It doesn't look like your traditional cake with all the coffee crunches around it. Everyone ended up LOVING it. Two days later today, I got an email from my uncle asking for the name of the place again. The cake inside was soft and moist and it had the best coffee taste - it just encompasses the entire cake. The coffee crunches around it also adds a nice touch to it. Not too sweet, just the way I like it. The only thing I'd have to say was that it was hard to get a good slice since the cake wasn't very hard, but it didnt matter since it was all going into your mouth anyway. 

I will be back and this time, the cake will be all for me! (not an entire cake of course, just a slice ... or two :))

8inch cake was $31. Trust me, it's worth it!
author: Rosie W.

description: For my birthday my bf bought a whole coffee crumble cake and it was everything a cake should be - moist, frosting wasn't too sweet and the coffee crumble had enough crunch but didn't break a molar when you bit into it. It was more than enough to feed 6 people, so we had lots leftover. The "shop" is located within another Japanese grocery store and is run by a couple that apparently still handwrites all of their orders. Will definitely be back to support this local mom and pop shop
author: Queena T.

description: Really rude, surly employees. Grumpy old man when I went to get a few cake slices and (probably same) grumpy old man when I called to place an order. You're serving cake slices, not enemas for chrissakes. Coffee crunch cake is good and all, but not worth the attitude.
author: Christine Y.

description:
Don't be driving on Sutter Street looking for this place because you will never find it.  At the northeast corner of Sutter Street & Buchanan Street there is a Japanese grocery store called Super Mira.  Sweet Stop is INSIDE the grocery store.  As you walk into the store, turn right and you will find a counter with a Japanese man (sometimes wearing white under shirt).  Although I always knew that there was a bakery inside Mira, until I read Mia S.'s review, I never thought about buying anything there.  Let's be honest, it doesn't look appealing.  

On the counter, he displays a cut out copy of Patricia Unterman's San Francisco Food Lover's Guide review which hails Blum's Coffee Crunch Cake.  Cake is really big, and he didn't have any slices for sale, so I bought his chocolate roll and strawberry roll.  Both were really good where the cream is sweet, but not too sweet.  Sponge is fluffy and just right.  None of their cakes look fancy - just tastes good.
author: トモ T.

description:
BEST CAKES EVER!!!

I used to work in Japan-town.  Residents in my facility love to order the coffee crunch cake for birthday celebrations.  The cream is the lightness, fluffiest cream I've ever tasted.  It melts in your mouth, and it's not overly sweet.  If you crave for a well made piece of cake, this is the place to get them.  The bakery is off in the corner of a Japanese Supermarket, truly a hidden GEM! I've had the coffee crunch cake, mocha roll cake, and the chocolate crunch cake.  They are all excellent!!! The thing I love about cakes from here is that they are always full of flavor, has the best combination of texture, and they don't give you a food coma even after eating a huge box of sushi.  

Listen to this, they get sold out quick so if you want a piece of the coffee crunch, chocolate crunch, and other population sliced cakes get there before noon if not earlier.  

One time I got there and saw 2pc of coffee crunch cake sitting in the glass shelf, but the owner said they were reserved.  Therefore, I am guessing that she may take reservations for frequent shoppers (???). 

An 8" Coffee Crunch Cake is $29.50, per piece of any cake if $3.85 as of early March/2013.   

Cash only!
author: Louis T.

description:
This is one of the best bakeries I've ever been to in SF. I'm not too familiar with Japanese bakeries but I will keep coming back. The office had a birthday and we wanted to try something new for our coworkers birthday cake. I did a quick search on yelp and saw this as one of the highest reviewed place.
