The shop was in some random Japanese market. We had no idea but I remember the picture that was posted up and decided to walk in to see. (Thanks to whomever posted that, it was a real help!). We saw the guava cake and the coffee crunch cake and the size of the coffee crunch was the deciding factor. It was GINORMOUS. 4 freaking layers of orgasms- one right after the other. I couldn't take it when I tried it. I had to get 3 more slices! 

The lady at the shop was so friendly and so cute. $26 for the 8in round. If you want Happy Birthday lettering it is an additional $1.50.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I needed to order a birthday cake for one of my girlfriends. We were eating dinner out to celebrate then ending up at my house for dessert and coffee.

Does anyone out there remember Blums when they were located next to Macy's in Union Square? This was many years ago. My first job right out of high school (I was attending college at the same time) was working at Macys in 19--. Lol..You actually didn't think I would fess that up did you?? I remember they had this delicious Coffee Crunch Cake.   My girlfriend (the birthday girl) showed me an article that was in the newspaper awhile back indicating this Bakery in SF replicates this Coffee Crunch Cake.
So....on Friday I phoned them and ordered I believe a 10 inch cake ($31 I think) that I picked up Saturday noon. It looked lovely! The lady in the bakery was very nice. Parking was challenging but expected as its in Japantown.
Long story short....after dinner everyone came over and we all really enjoyed the cake.  The birthday girl was really suprised. I gave her the remainder of the cake to take home (of course after I saved myself another slice).

You MUST try this Coffee Crunch Cake,  it is F A B U L O U S.
author: Janet T.

description:
The coffee crunch cake is insanely delicious. It is unlike any cake you've experienced.
When I first saw it, I thought okay another layer cake. Then I tried and was blown away. It's not overly sweet like American cakes it's absolute perfection. I prefer it extra cold so the layers of cream stay cold with each bite.
author: Hiep N.

description: Shortly after my first visit buying the haupia cake, I tried a slice of the coffee crunch cake which was as delicious as I imagined. We shared an 8" cake for Thanksgiving among 10 of us and we thought for sure there would be leftovers but everyone wanted seconds. The 8" is up to $40 now.
author: Mimi L.

description:
This place has my favorite crunch cake in the world!!! And it's just right down the street from me. Any time I have a craving or I'm seeing a friend who loves it, I call in to put a piece aside. The woman working there is the sweetest person - I just love her. 

I've tried a few other things (cookies and a lemon roll cake) which were also great. But as long as they have the crunch cake, that's my go-to!

*This bakery is very hidden in a Japanese supermarket.
author: Jen N.

description:
This little secret spot is a favorite of mine. My friends ask me where I get the coffee crunch cake from and I never tell them. It's mine, ALL MINE!!  Oh sweet sugary goodness.. 

By the time i'm off from school,work, or have any free time on the weekends, they're always sold out of their best pastries or they are closed. They close early, I believe at around 4 or 5 PM. 

TIP: call ahead and reserve yourself a slice..or 5. or 10. or an entire cake.

EDIT: I just called today to reserve a coffee crunch cake for a party on saturday. The little old Japanese lady is soooo sweet. She called me Susy-chan. Ahhhh so adorable!
author: Susy C.

description: The coffee crunch cake is thee best here!! It's so soft inside, not too sweet and the coffee crunch on the outside has that awesome flavor... Sticks to your teeth then melts in your mouth!!! Can't wait to try the chocolate crunch cake on my next visit. Plus, the lady behind the counter is soooo nice!!! Very friendly!!! Great place...
author: Dave F.

description: The shop is inside of a Japanese grocery store in the intersection of Buchanan and Sutter. We arrived in a late afternoon and all the coffee crunch cake were gone. We got a strawberry cream jelly roll and an apple turnover. Both were very yummy. I like the fact that it's not very sweet or heavy but still sweet and buttery enough to be counted as desserts. Will come back again for the famous cake!
author: Ran T.

description:
Wow, Yasukochi's, you have done it again!

I've been a fan of their coffee crunch cake and fresh strawberry shortcake since I was a kid.  After a long day of physical therapy today, I was determined to treat myself to something good and thought of this place as my cousin was driving by.  Unfortunately, they were all sold out of the coffee crunch by the slice (go figures...you def. have to come early in the morning for those babies!) since we came too late in the afternoon.  :(  Instead, we opted to try some of their other cakes, got ourselves a slice of the guava cake, a piece of the chocolate strawberry roll, and a slice of the fairly new chocolate crunch.  Oh man, the chocolate crunch was delicious, I might like it even more than the coffee crunch since it gives off a rich chocolate flavor and still have the crunchy goodness sprinkled on top.  If anything, maybe a little bit more of the chocolate crunch toppings to make the cake even better!  :)

At $3 a piece, I love how they offer their cakes by the slice, definitely helps satisfy a craving without having to wait for a birthday or a special occasion to purchase a whole cake.  Service is always great here, the petite lady behind the counter reminds me of my own grandma, always smiling.  :)

Cash or check only, plus they are closed on Sundays and Mondays.
author: Janetto L.

description:
Twice that I've called in and been able to order their coffee crunch cake the day of!

How awesome is that??

So friendly and nice over the phone when placing the order too!

Then I take it to Schubert's and have them decorate the top for me to add some chocolate flowers and a chocolate 'happy birthday' plaque to make it extra special.
author: Sue Y.

description: I tried this for the first time a couple of years ago and it is delicious!  I could eat all the icing and candy first if I had to, and then the cake.  I can't wait to have it again!
author: Caroleann B.

description: "so delicious...addictive...crack cake" - yup, these words and more have all been said by friends this past Thanksgiving in praise of the coffee crunch cake! Best $30 dessert in recent memory, and saved me time from baking things from scratch. I think a slice at the store went for ~$4. But this cake is sweet; a little goes a long way. One of the workers recommended I freeze it overnight and put it in the fridge the next morning for serving at dinner, to keep the crunch from melting. Worked perfectly, and tasted like it was never frozen! Actually, I think it tastes great out of the freezer as well - the cake is still soft and moist, just denser, and the crunch part doesn't seem to get harder.
author: Linus W.

description: Call ahead, I came at 2pm on a Saturday and they were sold out of all slices of their coffee crunch cake! I would definitely return, these ladies are so nice. 3 stars for now until I get a chance to update this review.
author: Jess C.

description:
Omg so glad we decided to yelp what else is good in Japan town today. What a gem!

I don't have a sweet tooth but boy i fell in love with their cake at first bite! The cake is moist, the cream is airy, it's just a little sweet to keep wanting just one more bite! Which is UNLIKE most other desert thats OD'ed with sugar or butter that makes you feel like you need to hit the gym after.

I tried their chocolate mocha creme roll cake and also the lemon one. 

Now I can understand why the dude in front of me bought a whole cake 'seemingly' for all himself o.0

Really want to try their famous koffee krunch :)
author: Cheung L.

description:
Try their guava cake and crunch cake. 

It was sweet to my liking and this bakery is tucked inside Super Mira Grocery Store located in the corner of Buchanan and Post Street. This shop is located next to Hotel Moto and Cafe Shunsu, and across old shops in Japantown.

I was surprised they carry organic products, and have a mini restaurant, deli, sushi and butcher in a grocery store.  This may be a convenience store because it carried alot of items. Very small and quaint grocery store in Japantown.

I bought Green matcha kitkat and the dark chocolate kitkat. These kitkats are hard to find.
author: Jade M.

description: They didn't have any coffee crunch cakes at 3pm so I settled for the last strawberry cream roll.
author: Evan W.

description:
This place is a gem!!
My friend took me here last weekend and bought me a slice of their coffee crunch cake that she was raving about and oh. my. good Lord in heaven. It was amazing! It's such a simple cake but it is so good. I almost wished that my friend hadn't told me about this shop because it's like... WHY WOULD YOU SHARE THIS WITH ANYONE!!! And I almost don't want to write a review haha but it's too late. 

The sponge cake is soft and fluffy unlike other sponge cakes, and the filling is this thick and fluffy cold whipped cream. It's not sweet at all except for the coffee crunch toffee topping so you can pretty much adjust the sweetness level by picking off some of the toffee lol. It's a good kind of cake that satisfies your sweet tooth but doesn't make you feel bad afterwards. 

This stuff is some serious crack cake though. After I finished that cake, I kept craving it and forgetting I had already eaten it!! So finally to satisfy my craving, I decided to come back and get a few slices to share with my family. Unfortunately they were out of slices. They didn't even have the chocolate cake I saw in the case last time. Soooo... I just bought a whole one. Hahaha! Excellent cake. 

*Cash Only! There's an ATM out front though.
author: Mila B.

description:
The cakes are delicious here! 
I tried the guava and the coffee crunch cakes based on other yelp reviews - and I will have to go with the guava because the coffee was a) too sweet b) had a strange after-taste (the crumbs) 
I must go back and try other options! I only wish they had seating (they're located in a grocery store) and that the cakes didn't sell out :) So be sure to a) check the hours b) call in before-hand if you're planning on getting a specific type of cake/pastry.
author: Victoria K.

description:
The Coffee Crunch Cake lives up to the hype!  I found it to be a bit sweet but since it was sooo good, I couldn't help but devour it.

Great Tip:  If you would like a slice... the pastry chef only makes a limited amount a day and they tend to sell out all the time.  Luckily, if you call ahead, they will be set aside some for you!
author: Miss Bonnie B.

description:
Coffee crunch cake. Those are three little sweet words that go so well together. I never had anything like it. It was like light crunchy candy on a soft fluffy cake. It's a cake that is just right for any occasion since it's not over-powering. The cute little bachan's are ready to help you pick out any number of their cakes from their showcase.

Located in one of the local markets in San Francisco Japantown, this is a must try confection.
author: Brian A.

description: Decided to grab a birthday cake here after hearing about the delicious cakes, so I had to try it out for myself. I went super early one morning on a Friday. Japan town is usually pretty quiet around the morning, but I still parked in the lot a street down... to only find that there was a perfect 30 minute metered parking right on the corner of the market where Sweet Shop is located... GRR! So prior to heading to the shop, I called in to reserve a cake because I heard they sell out quick.. well that was unnecessary but it's better to be safe than sorry. The owner (lady) was very nice and friendly and put a chocolate crunch cake to the side for me to pick up. Sure enough, no one was there and all the cakes and pastries for the day looked untouched. Along with the cake, I decided on two slices of coffee crunch cake for me and my parents to try out and a slice of chocolate crunch for my friend. Everything went smoothly and I went back home and put everything in the fridge because there is a lot of cream in the cakes.. didn't want it to spoil or anything! I couldn't resist any longer and took a bite of the coffee crunch cake and it was really good.. you definitely have to have some crunch with every bite of cake or it's kind of boring.. but yes it is really yummy. The chocolate crunch one was okay to me.. it was good but I definitely prefer the coffee one. Everything came out to $40, so it wasn't bad at all.
author: Tiff C.

description: Some of the best cakes in the Bay Area.  Their coffee crunch cake is all its hyped up to be, but there other cakes are also really good.  Their chantilly is one of my favorites...not too sweet and the chocolate cake is nice and soft.  Had a slice of their green tea roll cake today and was the best green tea roll cake I've ever had.
author: Ray C.

description:
I'd never been to Mira Market before, but it looks like a nice little Japanese grocery with cool snacks, Japanese noodles, etc that can be hard to find in a regular grocery--definitely want to check out the rest of the grocery someday.

But this review is about Sweet Stop, the little bakery inside. I read all the reviews about the coffee crunch cake and decided I needed to try it. Lucky for me, today is my boyfriend's birthday, so I ordered him one in advance for the celebration! Super easy to order--called on a Tuesday (the lady on the phone was so sweet and nice) for pick up Thursday. Walked in today to pick it up, everything looks good, paid with a check. Easy peasy.

I haven't actually eaten the cake yet, but I picked off some of the crunches because I couldn't resist.. and they are really good! I also got a chocolate strawberry roll while I was there and it's delicious. The strawberry cream is fresh and light with real strawberries in it. It's not overly sweet, and neither is the chocolate sponge cake. I'm definitely returning not only to get some Japanese groceries, but to try more of their cakes!
author: Rhea K.

description:
Coffee Crunch Cake is toooooo sweet !! Especially the brown chip on the top !

Anyway it's okay. but not as good as I expected.
author: Jerry K.

description:
First time ever I reserved a cake slice. 

Cakes and rolls have plenty of airy whipped cream. The light variation that Asian bakers have mastered beautifully. Although it doesn't weigh down your appetite I felt like I was eating endless puffs of clouds. The cake itself is simple flat sheets layered with chosen filling. Not too sweet. Leaves the sweet tooth satisfied. 

Coffee crunch is a unique twist in Asian cake world. Nice texture. Always love supporting family run shops. The husband and wife super friendly. He loves sharing his life story. His grandson is taking an interest in culinary arts too! A testament to hard work.

If I'm in the area I definitely drop by even if for a hello!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
My brother and I saw the cake on a Japanese blog, so we decided to hunt for the real thing :]

Two things about this place:
1. This bakery is located inside a small Japanese grocery store. We went right past it, but fortunately a sweet old Japanese lady showed us the way. 
2. They run out of their Coffee Crunch cake slices fast, so they recommend that you come early if you want a slice.

Unfortunately we came 30 minutes before the bakery closed, so their were only whole Coffee Crunch cakes rather than slices, but because I didn't want to waste my parking finding efforts we buckled down and bought a whole cake!

The cake itself is really sweet! It really woke me up with all the sugar and cream! The crunch pieces have just the right amount of crunch without sticking to your teeth and feeling like a hard coffee candy. The Crunch is buttery and delicious, it melts in your mouth well.The sponge itself was moist, it wasn't too sweet, which was good because it balanced out the Crunch and the frosting well. It really is a delicious, well balanced cake! The textures and flavors are amazing, but 2 slices are well-enough for me :] But the cake is definitely worth the trip and the parking! Be sure to but some tea or black coffee to wash down the cake, because you'll really need it afterwards :]
author: Jade C.

description: So happy when I got here early enough to get a slice of their famous coffee crunch cake. I ran gleefully to my car in success. The cake is good. But a little sweet. And the crunch is more a chew. I favored the guava cake more. I'd go back for that. And to try their chocolate crunch cake. Ok salmon sashimi and macroni.
author: Glessie C.

description: My friend shared their coffee crunch cake with me and I must admit...it was pretty good. The cake was light and had just the right amount of coffee flavor. However, I found the "crunch" part of the cake to be too sweet for my teeth.
author: Eileen L.

description: Three words: COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE!!! You can't beat it...it's become the cake I request every year for my birthday, and I daydream about it for months afterward. The crunchy toffee pieces + whipped cream + fluffy cake are an out-of-this-world trinity. If you're in Japantown, there's no question you have to visit Yasukochi's.
author: Caralisa L.

description: Coffee Crunch Cake! You are a little piece of heaven that I've been missing out on! First bite of this sucker and you are hooked! The top chewy, caramelized coffee/toffee layer was DIVINE! This bakery is a definite thumbs up! Can't wait to come back for more!!
author: Amiee H.

description: What can I say???  I almost finished the whole coffee crunch cake my kids got for my birthday!!!  Soooo good, but I had to stop myself!
author: Jay C.

description:
It was my second time to come here.  Unfortunately they sold out all the crunch cakes that time :-(...I just got the strawberry and coffee rolls.  Seriously, I don't think that was so special because I can easily to find this type of cake at any Asian bakeries.  

But after I tried the crunch cake there, I know why this place has such high reviews on this cake.  The cake itself was soft and not sweet.  The outside crunchy bits were delicious and buttery.  It was definitely a perfect combination.  

One slice costs $3.50.  Kinda pricey but worth it.  

The service was very good too.  The lady behind the counter was so sweet and friendly.  

Remember to come early because the crunch cake sold out fast!
author: Liza T.

description: Coffee crunch cake is so good!  We have been wanting to try this cake for a long while and glad we finally had a taste.  Delicious!  Worth the drive to Japantown.
author: Edith R.

description:
This is the first time I've given anything 5 stars on yelp but I really felt compelled to raise my previous rating. 

I bought some sponge cake rolls and a coffee crunch slice for a birthday present - plus an extra roll and coffee crunch for myself. 

I dug into the coffee crunch right away once I left the store and oh... my... gawd! It was seriously the best thing I had eaten the whole day. The crunch part of the cake looks a lot like toffee, but it's not nearly as hard or sweet yet it packs a noticeable coffee flavor. The rich combination of coffee crunch with the soft cake and fluffy cream was a winner for me.

When we got to opening up the other slices for the birthday I got to sample some of the sponge cake flavors that I had never tried. The strawberry filling is wonderful! It's this awful pink color that looks like it might be made from food coloring, but it's so fluffy and it has bits of fresh strawberry in it. I'm not sure how they do it, but that cream has some real strawberry flavor to it. 

Everything was so delicious, it felt like all the cakes just melted in my mouth. The texture and the amount of sweetness mixed with the subtle, yet marked flavor of the different cream fillings was perfect for my palate. It just made me feel happy and good inside (especially after having gotten a bit lost trying to ride the bus here).

The only quibble I had was that the cake on the green tea roll didn't seem as moist as the others for some reason, but it was still delicious. I'm going to make it a point to stop by here every time I come to Japan Town.
author: Monica W.

description: I'm here with family to visit family friends and we went here for lunch. To find out that this is the family friend's relative's shop in a Japanese market. it's right across from the Japanese little shopping center which is really nice. I had the strawberry creme pastry and boy was it good. The pastry is nice and flaky, everything is light and the strawberry adds just enough sweetness and tartness. Its topped with powdered sugar and slivered almonds. However, they are known for their crunch coffee cake. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to try it because it sells out early in the morning or it is pre-ordered. I will definitely be back here early for the cake. Its a must if you ever find yourself in Japantown !
author: Kristine Y.

description:
My friend told me about the coffee crunch cake here so I had to try it. Don't expect anything fancy or hi-tech here. And if you plan on ordering a half sheet cake or larger, make sure to call at least 3 days in advance to give them enough time to make the cake. They only take cash, close super early at like 5:30pm, parking sucks, and they are located on the right side inside a supermarket. The crunch cake can't really be decorated cause it's not a smooth surface.

Now, about the cake. It's multiple layers of cake goodness with all this crunch stuff on top and on the sides. The crunch reminded me of the Australian candy Violet Crumble. It was pretty good but the process was kind of a pain so if I'm in the area, I might stop by but I wouldn't go up specifically for the cake.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Finally tried the coffee crunch cake. I bought the last one at 1pm on a Saturday.

Very unique cake, but on the sweet side with all that toffee. My friends and I all enjoyed it but could only have a small slice before it started hurting our teeth.
author: Jen K.

description:
Brother's bday and he's super indecisive so I had to pick everything for him including his cake. Said he wanted coffee. Alright. Let's get this oh so popular coffee crunch cake. 

I called in to see if they had it....the man was so rude!!! Don't pick up the phone if you're going to act like I bothered you!

my sister went to pick it up, pricey cake 20+. so I know i sawww pictures of the cakes online but never thought it'd be like a huge cake with toffee bits all around it.

the cake was definitely soft and spongey and the coffee cream in between the layers were yummy. The toffee was just a TAD bit tooo sweet for our liking. but it was good, since I actually finished my slice and when i say finished, I mean ate the cream too, cuz usually i scoop off the cream.

glad i got this for my brother and not my bf's mom. cuz i dont think she'd like the toffee part of it.

yummy but i don't think i'd get a whole cake of it again, but would love to try other ones! Cash only boohoo
author: Christine M.

description:
I've been coming to the Sweet Shop for over 30 years for either a whole birthday cake or for the cake cream rolls.

Everyone raves about the coffee crunch cake; however, the strawberry cream rolls are an excellent substitute.   The strawberry cream is rolled either in yellow cake or chocolate cake.  Both are delicious.

The Sweet Shop is a complete bakery offering cakes, pies, and cookies too.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Love the toffee crunch cake.  We always get several slices, head over to Kabuki Theater and enjoy the filmed plays. 

Today was The Last of the Hausmans, last time The Curious Incident of the Dog

We also love the  grocery store and they have nice organic produce
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Coffee crunch is so DELICIOUS!.
The cake is not too sweet and the frosting is not too heavy.
Outside crunchy bits make this cake have just the right amount of texture (:
author: Adorable T.

description:
I remember Yasukochi's Sweet Stop from when I was a little girl.  My old church would buy fruit tarts from here and serve them with coffee after service.  Sometimes we would also stop here after church and get a dozen cookies to bring home and savor until the next Sunday when we would be in Japantown.  

Coming back here and introducing my boyfriend to my home town, I made it a point to stop by here and grab a sampling of cookies for him to try.  I ordered 2 sprinkle, 2 thumbprint, and 2 date bars so he could try some of each.  I bit into the thumbprint 
(my personal favorite) and it was exactly the same as I remember...buttery, soft, crumbly, and fruity.  YUM!  Boyfriend was impressed but he didn't think they were as good as I thought they were.  Nostalgia probably has something to do with it.  He did favor the date bars though. 

All in all this is what I expect from cookies when I want something sweet to eat.  I wish I could come here more often or that they would ship the cookies to Seattle.
author: Shari d.

description:
Been going there since I was a kid and can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet!

3 words: COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE.

Seriously, everyone sometime in their lifetime should be so lucky as to be able to have a taste of this cake. (It tastes even better the next day once the coffee crunch bits have absorbed some liquid--- it's more like a toffee)

If you can get there early enough in the day, they sell the cake BY THE SLICE. No joke! Well worth the money spent.

However, if you do get there a bit late but still have a craving for something sweet, almost anything else they have is amazing. Personally I like the roll cakes-- the Vanilla Cake w/ Strawberry filling is my fav. It's got REAL strawberries mixed in with the creme...

The Strawberry Pastry is also quite yummy-- strawberries sandwiched between flaky pastry and whipped cream. 

My little sister swears by the Bear Claw and Mini Almond Ring Pastry. 

As a kid I loved the Jam cookies and the Sugar Cookie Ring with mini ball sprinkles--- glad to see that they still have those around!
author: Jessica Q.

description:
Okay little update note: 
Service - The lady is lot more friendlier and accommodating than the guy. 
Cakes - The chocolate crunch isn't as good as the coffee crunch cake. Also, according to the guy, you cannot order a whole chocolate strawberry roll... I'll have to call back another day and speak with the lady. Pity, since I want to buy a cake for my brother today...
author: Shirlene K.

description: never have had a cake like coffee crunch cake def one of my fav have had this throughout my childhood and definitely feels like home =) if you visit SF u really need to try but always call the day prior they only reserve cake slices u never have any luck when you just stop in chances are due to high demand that you will not get a piece
author: Justynne B.

description:
What does 38 year business mean? Does it mean 100% quality cake and excellent customer service? I was calling in the morning to order the Chocolate Crunch Cake pick up at the same day for my friend's birthday. The gentlemen took the order and started giving me a bad sigh because I wanted to pick the same day. He heard me saying Coffee Crunch Cake, and then I confirmed with him Chocolate. He was even rude because it will take him long time to make a chocolate cake than coffee cake. 

Ended up the cake was not taste as FRESH one where I had ordered before.

I think after this order I will "boycott" for a while. I want a good quality cake and also great service at the same time.
author: Karen L.

description:
Nom NOM and NOM. 

sweet, what do you expect, it's a cake shop... but NOM! 

This place was discovered a bit too late in my life, but maybe for the better because lawdy I would be hauled around in a truck from eating too many of these little pieces! Thank goodness they sell individual pieces though, or else I would have to order a whole cake every few months... this is a great marketing strategy on the owners end. 

Anyways, the cake is just perfect. The thing I like most about the cake itself is that it's not too sweet. So even if the coffee crunch is a bit "sweet" to some people, the cake balances out the taste so it works out. The cake here is always fresh because come 5pm every day they're opened, I'm sometimes rejected from the store with no more cake to purchase. Not only that but the coffee crunch cake slices are a HIT, if you don't call in to ask them to put it aside before 12:00 pm everyday, don't expect to walk in at 2:00pm finding any slices left. Not only is the coffee crunch cake a hit, but definitely give the strawberry chocolate cake a try, it'll almost NEVER disappoint. I actually think the Strawberry Chocolate roll is more of a go to for me than the coffee crunch. It's just the right amount of sweet and they use actual strawberry pieces in their cream which is DELICIOUS. The cream is homemade by the amazing baker, and it's not too heavy or anything. Just thinking about it as I write this is making me crave more! 
The very sweet couple that owns the places has been there for years, and they make a heck of a team! If not both, one of them can bake nothing but delightful treats while the other has beautiful penmanship which is perfect for any celebration cakes! They are super pretty precise with what you order and is almost always willing to correct their mistakes if they ever make any. 100% customer satisfaction guaranteed ;) 
And to top it ALL off.... They're a family of basketball and they have their mark in Asian American basketball leagues!
author: Johanna T.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE their Coffee Crunch Cake! 

I've had their cakes a few times before but today was the first time I actually went to the bakery. They're actually in the back of a small market store!

I just happened to be having lunch in Japantown with my bosses and one of them mentioned wanting desserts. I suggested this place and they got excited right away! We didn't call in to order in advance or anything but luckily, they still had cakes to sell. My boss wanted to buy 2 cakes back for the rest of the office and I decided to try a slice of the guava cake and a chocolate roll. So YUM!

These cakes are definitely a special occasion type of treat. :)
author: Jean T.

description:
I normally love this place. My family has been coming here for 30 years, usually getting the coffee crunch or dream cake, and sometimes the strawberry shortcake. For my dad's birthday, he wanted a strawberry shortcake with chocolate cake instead of white. We called in the order and were told it would be $1 extra to customize it to chocolate, which was fine and we did.

We picked up the cake ($31) and took it home. Once we cut it open, we found basically one sheet of cake that had been cut in half, and about 2 inches of whipped cream inside. He had cut strawberries in halves instead of slices, and filled up the middle of the cake with just these halves of strawberries and a ton of whipped cream. There was more whipped cream than cake.

It was the most disappointing birthday cake ever. My dad was understandably very unhappy as we could have just gone to Schubert's, paid less, and gotten a better cake.

Typically Sweet Stop's strawberry shortcakes have multiple layers of cake, thinly sliced strawberries in layers with whipped cream much like their coffee crunch cake. This time, the guy was just being lazy and made a really crappy cake.
author: Tiff L.

description:
Coffee Crunch Cake is to die for here!

Have you ever bought a whole cake just for yourself? Well if you haven't this is the cake to do it with.  Absolutely sinful.  Worry that it'll dry out before you can finish, well no worries here, I refrigerated this cake for several days and it was still moist as ever.  Another thing great about this cake is that it's about a mile high so you don't even need that thick of slice.  If you're having one of those days where you gonna waste your diet on one thing, let it be the coffee crunch cake! Get there early though, slices run out quick, or what the heck get a whole cake =P
author: Mimi P.

description:
As soon as you step into Super Mira, the smell of intense sweetness hits you.  I hadn't noticed that scent before, because I think I only came in the afternoons.  I've come here many times when the bakery looked closed.  Yelp didn't have the hours.  They open at 9:30 AM, M-Saturday.  They close at 5:30 PM on M-F and 5 PM on Saturday.  They have their numerous magazine and newspaper mentions on display as well as the People Love Us on Yelp sticker.  For those of you who are not familiar with Yasukochi's - yes, it's Japanese and it's inside a Japanese market.

This time I arrived right after they opened.  I've never seen the bakery case look so full before.  The selection is wider than I realized.  Besides cakes, they have cookies, danishes (family size & individual size), croissants, and bread (sold by the loaf).  I kept reading about the coffee crunch cake and I saw that they had a lemon crunch flavor too.  As for the cake roll slices, there are about 6 varieties including lemon w/ vanilla cake, mocha, chocolate with whipped cream, etc.  They also had a wide variety of chiffon cakes (family size only).  And they had the famous guava cake.  Nothing is labeled and prices are not displayed.

I decided to go with the chocolate cake roll slice with strawberry cream ($2.95).  It's a substantial slice - larger and heavier than the cake roll slices I'm used to - a sign of quality.  The slice is dusted with ample amounts of powdered sugar.  The slice is a good 1 inch thick with more cream than usual.  The cake is moist, not too sweet and with a light chocolate flavor.  The slightly sweetened pink whipped cream is chilled and the strawberry pieces were frozen (there weren't too many of them).  It would much taste better with fresh strawberries.  This place isn't delicate like Satura but it's more homey and mom & pop.  Watch out, serious sugar overload ahead.
author: Lolia S.

description:
To be honest, this place doesn't have the biggest selection, but that's the reason why everything they have there is a specialty. 

I just wanted a single slice of the infamous Coffee Crunch Cake the other day but they were all out, so we bought the whole cake! Yummm!
The inside was light and fluffy with a crunchy honey comb layer sprinkled all over the top. 

The Sugar Cookie was also pretty good. When I stole a bite from my friend I had to go back and buy myself some more. It's soft in the middle with the perfect blend of sugar bound to make anyone's day better.
author: April K.

description:
My "sweet-tooth" wife ordered in advance,and wants me to pick-up a cake from "The Sweet Stop" in Japantown for a b-day party the following evening. I guess it is wise for me to pick it up, I wonder why?

This clean bakery,which is located inside the popular Japanese grocery store name Mira, has a small and exquisite display case full of fresh and decorative pastries,cakes and other assorted desserts. Despite of having the bakery inside Mira's, they are two separate companies.(The profile pic wasn't how I entered the store. Customers will be freaked-out).

The cake I'm suppose to pickup for my wife was the Strawbery-Cake. This elegant cake contain chopped nuts on the side of the thick & creamy-frosted layered cake and topped with a shit-load of fresh-strawberries w/ glazed preserves.This picture-perfect cake,which costs $25.00, is a symbol of beauty. They also have various specialty cakes,which maybe in my outlook consideration. Although the cake costs $25.00 dollars, I would prefer it over any Chinatown bakeries.

I told my wife to save a slice for me to have, in which I have doubt and have a auspicious feeling it might not happen. At least, I found another fine-bakery to buy a cake. I might buy some pastries and maybe a whole cake and store it in my DeWalt tool-box for maximum solitary-confinement
author: Matt G.

description: My GF decided to get a whole coffee crunch cake and gave us half. She said I had to try this cake because it's one of her favorite cakes to get in the city. It was moist and light. Not to sweet. I'm definitely a fan. From all the reviews on yelp I'm guessing the bakery runs out of the cake quick. So get there early or place an order.
author: Jo S.

description:
Taste: 5 stars *****
Service: 0 stars

They are so rude! Especially the old man the works there...
I was really trying to be patient and nice.
The first time I thought, maybe he's having a bad day.
The coffee crunch cake was SOOOOOOO good, like slap yo mama good, I decided to just forgive the rudeness and try it again.
I wanted to order 2 cakes for a lunch so I called the day before.
The old man answers the phone and is rude again and says he can't have any cake until 1pm...
They open at 9:30, but don't have cake until 1? I DON"T GET IT!
He says I have to call before... well, I'm giving them more than a 24 hour notice....
He says "too bad"... wow...
He obviously thinks very highly of himself and his cake to not care about customer service.
I'm not sure if I want to go back because of how rude he is.
I'll have to try Schubert's Coffee Crunch Cake.
author: M J.

description:
I must love my family, I sat through 2 hours of traffic from Palo Alto to SF to pick up this cake for them, then another hour and a half of traffic to Richmond and El Sobrante to drop off Coffee crunch cake and guava cake...they so owe me and had to hear about it from me too!  8 inch round is $26 and the slices are $3.  I am still milking it and getting free home cooked meals and leftovers!

Note: if you want the cake in a long loaf form instead of an 8 inch round, they will need 3-4 days notice.  This is better to fit in an ice chest for travel and to keep it iced/cool.
author: Deb N.

description:
I have not been to this place in along time (ordered cakes here when I was younger), but went to grab a slice of cake this past weekend.  

I walked in and wanted the last slice of the coffee crunch cake and a strawberry one to go.  My friend never been there and he wanted the same thing, but that was the last coffee crunch.  I felt guilty, so I let him have the slices while I got the whole coffee crunch cake.  I was going to see friends tomorrow for a super bowl party, so decided to bring the cake there.

Had the cake the next day and we all agreed if was light and yummy.  It was not too sweet and the crunchiness of the coffee bits gave it a great texture and a kick of sweetness.

I forgot how yummy their cakes were here...will be back again when I am back in the city.
author: James L.

description:
Six stars, if that would be possible. It's a bakery counter (nowhere to sit, just order, run home, make tea, and DEVOUR what you just bought) inside a grocery store, but their creations are so excellent. When I find myself On that corner (of Buchanan and Sutter) I am always torn: BenkyoDo for Wagashi or Yasukochi's for cake? 

Their Coffee Crunch *IS* something to write home about, and their Guava/Passionfruit cake is the ONLY one you can find in town- it's this electric pink color on top and they usually sell out, so if you're determined to get one, go early- esp on the weekends! (Gigantic) Slices are a reasonable $3-4, and they also do custom orders. I think King's Hawaiian in Torrance used to do a similar cake, but this one is so much fresher and the sponge is more 'airy'. 

An added feature is their 'family gallery' of photos that you can admire while making your choices. It's been family run for many years, and it's located inside the SuperMira market. 

I think they are closed once a week but I can't remember which day...
author: M'ia K.

description:
Tried the guava cake and even though it failed my expectations this little hidden gem still deserves 5 stars.

My brother ordered it for a birthday and I still tried to sway him away from ordering it. Again, I like to save it for my treks back to Hawai'i. He went against my wishes and as I predicted it failed. It tasted NOTHING like guava and seemed like the pink topping was more of a Jell-o base. The ones in Hawai'i seem more like a non dairy based pudding if you can understand what I mean. Pwahahaha.

We shared a small slice of the Lemon crunch and it gets thumbs up from me. However they fashion those "crunch" things, please keep doing it!
author: Dina V.

description: Yasukochi's coffee crunch cake has long been a favorite treat, but I had never tried anything else at the Sweet Stop until this week.  The chocolate rolls with the strawberry cream and real strawberry chunks are fabulous and the white cake rolls with the cool lemon cream is great too.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: While shopping in J'town, I parked the car on Buchanan and walked by.  While window shopping, took a glance at their counter of cakes and munchies.  An older man came out and I asked him for his recommendation.  He told me the coffee crunch is their best seller, but he did not have a whole cake available.  I brought a guava cake home and, he packed it, I pointed at the single slices of the coffee crunch cake and bought one.  Now, I know why it is the best seller...  I'm glad that they sell it by the slice so I can try more of their treats next time.
author: Mike C.

description:
I have tried it 3 times and still don't like the cakes. Time after time the frosting/cream was frozen in the middle and there were times where I am sure I was eating a chunk of butter. 

 I don't understand what is the big deal about their coffee crunch. The most recent time I had order a whole cake, the center was completely frozen and had a refrigerator-taste to it. I expected something moist and light, not some frozen hunk of lard. This was after at least 30 minutes being out at room temperature and still rock solid in center.

 I wanted to be a fan of this place but the cakes have left me disappointed too many times. When I want a good coffee crunch cake I rather head out to Red Ribbon. This says a lot...it's not like their service is any less friendly.
author: just d.

description: Bought a coffee crunch cake for my sister's birthday since she specifically requested it...even sent me the Yelp page link.  I was all hyped up and expecting this cake to be out-of-the-world delicious.  Unfortunately, it's just not my cup of tea...too sweet and I really didn't like the crunch pieces sticking to my teeth.  In my opinion, this is equivalent to coffee flavored Captain Crunch cereal + lots of cream + yellow cake.  Guess I'm in the minority this time!
author: Renee L.

description: $29.50 for a whole coffee crunch cake. Loved the cake more than the topping though. Topping was too sweet.
author: Sophia B.

description: Amazing coffee crunch cake. Friendly service. Need I say more? TIP: Call to reserve your slice first thing in the morning! It's worth it!
author: Diana U.

description:
The pics posted on Yelp do not give the cakes made here justice.  Absolutely delicious, soft, moist cakes.  Their guava cake has become an addiction of mine and they make the BEST strawberry roll cakes.

No tickling of the taste buds here...down right soft and satisfying and leaves me floating very happily on cloud 9.  Also, remember to bring cash (or your checkbook) because they don't take credit/debit cards.  Avoid coming here at the end of the work day too.  You might as well forget about it, there will be no guava cakes left because they'll be all SOLD OUT!
author: Emy B.

description: I've never been here, but we ordered a coffee crunch cake for my niece's birthday last weekend. First of all, the toffee bits that covered the cake just blew me away. It was completely covered! After the cake was cut, everyone was standing around talking about how freaking delicious it was. People kept asking where the cake was purchased, so you know, it was a hit. The cake was good, not too sweet, which is perfect for my family since no one likes super sweet stuff. I'll be sure to go back and try the other goodies.
author: Audrey T.

description: The lady working here is super sweet! The chocolate coffee crunch cake is delightful! I can't wait to try the guava cake as well! Wish they accepted credit cards instead of cash only though.
author: Mertani G.

description:
I hate writing less than positive reviews for places I really wanted to like, especially for one with as much personality as Yasukochi's Sweet Stop. 

Came across Yasukochi's while scouring yelp for a good asian-style birthday cake.  Dropped by and ended up buying a guava cake, a chocolate chiffon bundt,  and a slice of lemon crunch.

Definitely an old school type of bakery, with old fashioned American style cakes, though with a slight asian twist (guava).  The guava jelly on top of the cake was deliciously fruity, but the cake itself (plain yellow), was very heavy and very sweet.  

The chocolate chiffon bundt- reminiscent of an Entenmann's cake.  ie.  Boxed.  

Lemon Crunch- so much better.   I believe the lemon crunch and coffee crunch are sponge cake, which was a huge improvement from the yellow cake.

In conclusion-  cakes are pretty good (still, avoid the bundt).  I'd really like to try the coffee crunch that everyone raves about.
author: Joanne G.

description:
COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE! ohhh gaahhhhh! 

I've read many reviews regarding this cake and people were not exaggerating! This cake was freakin' delicious!! The cake was huge and covered with toffee bits! The cake was light and fluffy, and the cream wasn't heavy at all. You can definitely taste the coffee in this cake. 

Note: The bakery is in a convenience store. I had a hard time locating it. =) Call the bakery in advance to reserve or order the cake. It sells out quick!
author: Jean Y.

description:
the coffee crunch cake is good but not the best thing i've ever eaten.
it was nothing special.
i feel like i can eat that kind of cake at any korean bakery.
it was pretty cheap though. under 4$ for a slice.
author: Heejin L.

description:
I love you.
I really love you.

The bakery has the best crunch cake and it does not matter if it is coffee, lemon, or chocolate because they are all so very yummy!  I had the coffee crunch cake for my birthday and it made turning a year older not as painful.
author: Cung N.

description:
We've tried their cakes over the years and the coffee crunch is one of my favs.  We had a slice of their raspberry cake at a recent memorial for the spouse of a former colleague and I've forgotten how wonderful the whip cream is and the moistness of their cakes.  All light and fluffy. 

Used to order their cakes with pictures on them.  You give them a photograph and they'd decorate the cake with that photo.  Just so great for kids' birthday parties.
author: Ry T.

description:
I have been coming here literally since i was born.  My birthday cakes from age 1 - 12...from the sweet stop.  My review is biased but true!  

Yes, the coffee crunch cake is the bomb. If you love coffee and in SF who doesn't, its a wonder not to be missed. The secret is next day coffee crunch cake, when the crunch has time to melt a little...just heaven.

I am a whipped cream cake kind of girl...you can't beat their strawberry and whipped cream cake.  Such a simple, delightful wonder.  They also have nice assortment of hawaiian inspired treats like guava cake, and the delicious green tea jelly roll.  

One of my favorite treats here, is the everything? cookie....its not pretty but so good.  Go see Moses and Hatsy, you won't regret it! They are part of Japantown's heritage.  

Great place for baby shower, birthday or wedding!
author: deirdre d.

description:
Coffee Crunch Cake you are so amazing.

Only if I could hug you without getting all over me.

Then I too would be a tasty treat.
author: Judy L.

description: Love this place, the guava cake is delicious! It's so fruity and has that great strong guava taste that I like. The green tea rolls are divine, but the lemon rolls are what take the cake. The lemon rolls are so creamy and good! A must try.
author: Kevin L.

description:
i come here for my coffee crunch cake fix, but of the 7+ times i've came here:

a) they're either closed/ on vacation
b) sold out of coffee crunch cake
c) i'm out of cash (this 1 is on me)

what's the message here?
call to make sure they're open and still have the crunch cake and always carry bills
author: Jen C.

description:
Coffee crunch cake was delicious!!!  9 inch cake was $40 and could easily feed 15 people (we had 10).  Yaaah for leftover cake!  :)

Also, people have noted how rude the customer service was at this place.  I just want to say I had a great experience from the time I was in the store to order, to the phone call to change the pick up time of the cake.  Very friendly all around.
author: Tammy S.

description:
The cakes here are unbelievably tasty and delicious! Besides Schubert's which make a more modern style cake, this place makes huge classic style super silky soft cream, thick soft cakey type cakes. 

My favorite two and only two I've tried are the coffee crunch cake and strawberry cream roll. 

The coffee crunch cake is so soft and fluffy with the creamy coffee flavor in the center. Coated with bits of crackled toffee crunchies on the top give it an extra texture that make it perfect. 

The strawberry cake roll is just as good too! The soft chocolate cake just melts in your mouth and the strawberry cream is so sweet and light with fresh strawberries buried within it. The cake and cream compliment each other just perfectly. 

Can't wait to try the green tea roll, saw it last time and it looked so delicious, but couldn't not get the coffee crunch cake and the strawberry roll :p
author: Patrick L.

description:
I have been coming to this wonderful family owned bakery for over 15 years now for their amazing coffee crunch cake.  This cake is absolutely delicious!!  

My most recent visit to Sweet Stop was Thanksgiving Eve 2013 to pick up our family's traditional Thanksgiving dessert - the 9 inch coffee crunch.  Yes, the cake was ordered a week before.  (Hint:  Always order in advance if you want to be assured of a cake.). Our large extended family gathering of 35+ people means there are always multiple desserts.  This cake is by far the hands down favorite dessert.

The service at this bakery is always delivered with a smile.  I am usually helped by the nicest lady.  I believe she is the owner.  The younger family members were helping out during the Thanksgiving rush...and the young girls were so sweet and friendly.

Great cake.  Outstanding service.
author: Knit K.

description:
We've tried their lemon roll and their green cake roll.
The green cake roll was soo good.  Not overly sweet.... perfect with my green tea.
The lemon was tangy and good too but I felt a little greasy after I ate the lemon cream roll, maybe more heavy cream than the green roll?
They did not have any coffee crunch roll by the slice and I just didn't feel like buying the whole cake, maybe next time.
The lady in the counter was very sweet.
author: Emy B.

description:
For the bf's birthday, I wanted to find the cake that suits the old Asian man's tongue - can't be too sweet.  And with my limited parking skill and my desire to find the not-too-sweet cake, I chose Yasukochi's Sweet Stop.  

I kinda remembered the last time I had pastries there, they weren't too sweet and they were delicious.  So I went to yelp and confirmed that this is indeed a popular bakery, I headed to Yasukochi's Sweet Stop early in the morning while the bf was still wandering in dreamland.

I called to order in advance and they had the cake ready in an hour for pick-up.  I picked up the Strawberry cake, which SHOULD, in theory, suits the old man's tongue.  And it did!

The layer and layer and LAYER of fresh whip cream was OH-SO-CREAMY with the perfect amount of sweetness along with quite possibly hand-picked with LOVE super size uber fresh strawberry.  Everything layered with super fluuuffffyyy spongyyyy cake.   

And the response from the bf:  This is the best cake I had in a long while.
author: Gigi T.

description: I've heard that everything they bake at the Sweet Shop is wonderful. But every time I go there, I order the same thing: Coffee Crunch Cake. It is so light and fluffy. Perfectly delicious. Every time I bring it to a party or family event, people swoon!
author: Debbie W.

description:
Coffee crunch cake!!!!!!  Mouthfuls of clouds topped with wonderful, wonderful honeycomb.  LOOOOOVE!!!!

I was led here originally by the Yelp gods, and I am so happy for it.  The woman behind the counter was SO sweet and helpful.  They were out of the cake the first day I went, so she had me leave my information and what time I could come back the following day, and she reserved a couple slices for me.  She was seriously one of the nicest people I've ever encountered.

I also love that I can stock up on Japanese goodies here, but that's pretty standard for Japantown.  ;)
author: Tamara N.

description: I ordered a coffee crunch cake for the first time for a birthday and everyone loved it. The cake was soft and moist on the inside while the exterior provided a sweet textural crunch. Very fresh + light. Will definitely come back.
author: Julie L.

description: Lovely and prompt customer service and the coffee crunch cake is amazing! So delicious!! Love the textures and it's great with some tea to balance the sweetness :)
author: Jess L.

description:
Ordered the last coffee crunch cake for a friend's birthday party.  It was fantastic!

The cake was fluffy and the toffee was a really nice contrast.  The lady selling was the sweetest.  She held the last cake for an hour as we wadded through Black and White Ball traffic.
author: Andrew K.

description:
What did Usher sing in his song? OH OH OH OH OH MY GOD! 

Their chocolate crunch cake is OMG FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  

It had a nice crunch and its not too sweet,. The cake mix was fluffy and light as air! 

I can't wait to try their Coffee Crunch Cake next time.

Definitely 5 stars
author: Scott L.

description:
Bought a slice of lemon roll here for the Kid.  The lemon isn't like those made in the Chinese bakeries.  It's more of a lemon Jello custard.  I think the roll had a tad too much frosting for my taste and not enough cake cuz it was very moist.  The Kid didn't think much of it either because he left me half the roll to finish.

It's ok but for $2.99 a slice, it's a bit pricey.
author: Wendy H.

description: Stumbled on to this joint while shopping for some Japanese snacks at the grocery market. The wife spotted the little bakery tucked in the front right side of the store. She noticed that they've been open for years and were famous for their Coffee Crunch Cake. Unlucky for us they were sold out early afternoon so we couldn't try the so called coffee crack cake. Months later on I preordered one over the phone, took it home, sliced a FAT piece and it was on! Super moist cake and the coffee crunch that was spread all over the outer part was very light and crunchy. I was expecting it to be very hard and super sweet like a brittle of some sort. Super good and made in house by an elderly Japanese couple over many years you just can't go wrong. I would advise you to go early and buy a slice/cake or call and reserve something as they do sell out quickly.
author: T L.

description: It was super hard to find this place since it was hidden in a small Japanese corner store.  Picked up a few slices of their rolled cakes (lemon, vanilla, chocolate, and green tea flavors) -- they were soft and pillowy and delicious.  Will have to come back next time and try one of their larger cakes!
author: Imee C.

description: The Sweet Stop Coffee Crunch Cake is now a Christmas tradition at my family's get together, and always a welcome dessert for any family celebration. For those who are to young to know this, the Coffee Crunch Cake brings much memories of days long past of an old San Francisco when we purchased this cake from Blum's.
author: Pendragon D.

description:
The ULTIMATE GEM STAR FIND and my FAVORITE CAKE SHOP in SF!

This charming little cake shop is literally a HIDDEN GEM!  The Sweet Stop is tucked inside the corner of the Super Mira Market.  I would never have found it without the recommendations from my native foodie friends.

The COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE is SINFULLY GOOD!  The cake is moist on the inside filled with delicious cream and the coffee crunch on the outside is like nothing I've ever eaten.  Anyone who loves cake will love this!  They sold out of the crunch cake the last time I was there and the nice lady recommended the green tea cream rolls and that was delicious too.

Tip: Get there early or order in advance because the Coffee Crunch Cake gets sold out quickly.
author: Lis A.

description:
Finally got a chance to come here!! 

Everytime I go to Japantown, I could never find this place until today, when I realized that it's inside the Japanese Supermarket. I was pretty excited when I finally found this place!

I got the Coffee Crunch Cake and the Strawberry Roll. The coffee crunch cake was pretty amazing! The cake was very light and fluffy and the coffee crunch added nicely to the smooth creamy texture. The strawberry cream was semi-frozen, so it tasted like ice cream. The cake was equally as good. The lady who helped me out was super nice. 

I have to say, it's a hidden treasure in Japantown. The only reason I took off a star was because I wish there were more selections. I was expecting there to be different kind of cakes. However, there were only coffee/chocolate crunch cake and the rolls.
author: Joyce B.

description: Not that she needs anymore awesome reviews, but I don't like cake... ever! The Coffee Crunch Cake is my only exception. And I'm not sure whether the "sweet" in the business name is referring to the bakery sweets or Yasukochi because she's always a sweetheart.
author: Deanna P.

description: This place is all about nothing but rudeness.   Why even bother to sell anything there..better yet they should learn better customer service.  I rather buy cake at Sheng Kee bakery.  The so called "famous crunch cake" is overrated and overpriced!!!
author: Perapol D.

description: Popped in today hoping for a slice of coffee crunch cake.  Denied.  With no birthdays to celebrate, there was no way I could justify getting a whole cake.  Though I was tempted to just to satisfy the craving.  Luckily they had my backup in stock. Slices of the green tea roll. Yum. Just the right amount of matcha flavor and light, airy green tea cream.  Delicious.
author: J. P.

description:
coffee crunch cake: 4 stars.
service: 0 stars.

i called in at around 11am on a weekday to have a few slices of coffee crunch cake put on hold for me to pick up before they sell out, lo and behold, it was going to be the worst phone experience of my life.

i always did wonder why some people gave this place 1-2 stars, because i think the coffee crunch cake is good. after experiencing the service myself, i now know of the grumpy old man they are talking about. i mean... why are you in business if you're going to treat customers this way and make it such an obstacle for your customers to buy a slice of cake? do you even care for the business? is it fair that you get to talk to people like you're on some crazy pedestal just because you sell some good cake? it's not right, especially nowadays when customer service should be #1.




parts of the phone call because i don't want to bore you guys:

- me: hi do you guys still have slices of coffee crunch cake left?
- grumpy old man: yess.... [as if they sell an abundance of it, the reason i ask is because they sell out everytime i want to get it. i mean, why make it so hard on your customers?]
- me: can i put 4 slices on hold old please?
- grumpy old man: yess... [long pause] what's the name? [saying it as if i knew to give you my name automatically]
...
. midway: gets my name wrong, my phone number wrong, gives me a poop load of attitude.
...
- grumpy old man: what time you want to pick up?
- me: around 1. can you please pack them separately for me?
- grumpy old man: ha... ha... we don't do that. [you are charging a premium for your cakes, not only are you not willing to help me wrap them separately, i get laughed at like i'm asking you for something outrageous?!??!!?! is it that ridiculous that i want to separate the cakes? i want to give the cakes away. how the heck am i gonna do that if it's all in the same box?!?!?!?] 
- me: ????!?!?!?!?!
- grumpy old man: i can put them in paper bags for you.
- me: okay. whatever, that's fine. 

in the end... they were just boxed up in 1 box. did you lose the memo or something sir? 
 
basically... i'm pretty upset with this place. it left me feeling like sh*t. i probably don't see myself coming back here unless if i am really desperate for some cake. but until then... good luck to those who encounter this grumpy old man...
author: Tina S.

description:
UGH...I saw on Yelp this placed is closed on Sundays...but they're also closed Mondays too! Too bad it had to require showing up on a Monday for me to realize this. I should have read the times/dates on Yelp more carefully.

But the cake here is so good that I've vowed to come back around Thankgiving to try and get another one.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
This place is too cute. It's inside Mira Market to the right, a humble and clean bakery display. No splashy signs, no glitz and glamor. The owner is so sweet and patient. She recommended some cakes for me and wrapped and ribboned it all nicely in a box.

The toffee cake was delicious and perfect for those who like plain, vanilla cake. The lemon cake had just the right amount of lemon that perfumed every bite. I liked how both had a nice crunch from the candy toppings (which they also sell by the bag). The chocolate roll was very light and airy with real slices of strawberry in the cream which we appreciated.

Simply put, Yasukochi's will satisfy the pickiest of Asian moms and give you a break from the overly rich and sickenly sweet desserts of America.
author: Claire C.

description:
I expect a DEA raid here soon.

I had the coffee crunch cake on Saturday.  It was brought as a gift to me and hidden from my party guests (yeah, im a selfish like that).  This is the best cake ever.  I grew up eating cake for breakfast 4-7 days per week so I know cake.

For the few guests I deemed worthy, they sampled the cake and asked me 'what is that stuff on top'.  My only answer......"Those are rocks of crack cocaine.  I just ruined your life.  You will be hooked.  This is the kind of cake that can cause the downfall of an empire.  Enjoy and don't tell the other guests."

But like crackheads, they strolled into the rest of their party with the cake and within seconds the horde pushed through and consumed my fix.  mofos.

I need to print up a sign "Will work for Coffee Crunch Cake"
author: H C.

description:
You know when you get a gift from a person you can tell how much they care about you. Like for instance a gift card means "I don't know anything about you so here ya go", body wash "you smell...stinky", and well crunch cake from Yasukochi "I'm deeply in love with you and you are the most awesomest person in the world".
I guess I'm the most awesomest person in the world then! Last Saturday my boyfriend decides to surprise me with a little gift ( we've been to Yasukochi on several occasions but each were failed due to they were sold out of crunch cake) . I see this pink little box and I'm a little excited because I thought it was gai me bao but to my amazement it was the crunch cake. 

MY GOD THEY"RE DELICIOUS! The top crunch layer is a perfect compliment to the sweet soft moist cake, not one layer of the cake is overbearing to its counterpart. The entire cake was delicious and I ate all of it. 

This place is amazing I recommend it  to all the foodies out there!
author: Cristelle J.

description: Like all the other reviews, this is for the Coffee Crunch cake. Two of my faves together in a cake? Winner! Cake was moist and not overly sweet. The toffee on top is what makes it just that little bit sweeter.
author: Kitty K.

description:
Do not underestimate this small little bakery in a japanese market!! They a separate business that has been around for decades. I am family friends with Mo (nickname is Moses) and Hatsy since they attended the same church as my family way back in the days. If you're lucky enough you might just smell the goodies baking while you're pondering on what to buy from the display window :) Of course everyone knows about the coffee crunch cake and the lemon crunch cake, now lo and behold the Chocolate crunch cake! i haven't tried it yet but i'm sure it's as scrumptious as all the baked goodies :) I'm sure everyone knows how good the coffee crunch cake is and if you want to make your own they sell the coffee crunch in little bags for a few dollars.

If you think some of the stuff look the same week after week don't be fooled. Every Sunday Mo donates the danishes, breads, rolls, and cakes to local churches, organizations, the workers in the market (yes, i experienced this before and it was great while i worked there :D ) or family friends.

Just be sure you have cash on hand since plastics aren't welcome. Order ahead of time to be sure you're getting the cakes/pies/danishes fresh. If you don't want the entire cake or roll they also make it in single/double serving slices :)
author: Marie G.

description: Delectable coffee crunch cake!  As Joyce B. and others have said, the cake itself is fluffy and the airy cream contrasts perfectly with the crunchiness of the coffee topping.  I thoroughly enjoyed it and will hopefully be back at some point to sample their other cakes.
author: Eric F.

description:
Hum, I'm kinda stumped here...I guess I'm the odd one out here: the Lemon Crunch Cake was ok.  The crunch was not cool at all...bits of sugar I believe? At first I thought it might have been lemon heads...now that would've been neat, but turned out nope b/c they weren't sour.  There wasn't enough of a lemon taste, in fact it was just a hint of lemon.  I usually like lightly flavored cakes but this one was not doing it for me.  Texture of the cake, how there wasn't more cake than filling, and just the look of the cake wasn't very appealing.  One plus about the shop: they sell bday candles for only $1!! (you know you get shanked for $5 at other places)

Kinda sad, I bought a 8 inch for my bday and was totally excited...plus picking it up was a pain, there's no parking anywhere!! And cash only so I had to stop by the atm first.  More trouble than it was worth...Oh well, now I know.
author: Blia L.

description: Got here at around 5pm and they were out of slices of cake.  The lady said they sell out of slices by 11:30am.  Got a mocha slice and thought it was below average.  The cake part was chocolate, light, airy, and fluffy.  It was the cream filling that made it not so great.   There was just too much cream...about 90% cream and 10% cake.  I eat cake for the cake, not the cream so this one was disappointing for me.  I also got a whole Chocolate Crunch Cake.  The cake was the same as the mocha roll.  The filling was a whipped cream type that was not sweet, which was a pleasant change from all the overly sweetened American desserts.  The crunchy toffee added a nice texture and sweetness to the cake.  It was a good cake, but not something I would go out of my was for again.  The lady working the counter and her little grandson were helpful and cute.
author: LuvFood S.

description: The coffee crunch cake here is divine, been having one per year on my birthday for the last three years.  A must-try for SF.  You can call ahead to reserve a slice, so don't miss out.
author: Lisa S.

description:
The guava birthday cake was ok, but it didn't taste like guava and it was on the sweet side. The chocolate and strawberry cream roll was very tasty and I would for sure get it again. Sadly they were sold out of coffee crunch at 1 pm! 

I went through the customer service roulette with them. Either it was very good or very bad. The first person I called was spacey, but nice. Somehow she told me the 8 inch cake served the same amount of people as a 9 inch cake, huh? Anyways, I called back in to order, but the guy told me that they do not make the 8 inch guava cake for $24. He was very rude and impatient. When I went in, it was a sweet old lady that got the cake for me.

Next time I am going early to get me some coffee crunch.
author: Erica B.

description:
I'm not a fan of coffee cake (the one with the crumbly cinnamon topping) or mocha cake so when my sister's friend said she'd bring coffee cake from Jtown (instead of red velvet cupcakes) for her baby shower that I helped organize, I was thinking "oh...ok :/ ". 

I did not know that this coffee cake was unlike the ones that I don't care for! This cake was so good. In fact, it had a faint taste of coffee and the best part of it all was the crumbly, crunchy topping on the outside. It has the airy-ness and crunch of a meringue or the honeycomb inside a Violet Crumble bar and it tasted like caramel or toffee. Turns out the cake was a  huge hit at the shower and it went fast...I didn't have a chance to save a slice for later!
author: kristin e.

description:
Their famous coffee crunch cake was delicious. Managed to grab the last one before someone else did (who came right after us!) - the cream is very light and sweet, complimenting the cake texture very well. Maybe a bit more cream between the layers would make the cake feel less dry. 

Normally I'd give perfect stars for the cake alone, but I've had something similar and better in Hong Kong, where the cake was amazingly light and the balance between cream and cake was just right. 

Their sugar cookies were amazing. Much better than plain sugar cookies from anywhere - Mrs. Fields, home bakeries, etc. There is a hint of lemon in it; the cookies were soft and not overly sweet.
author: Christal Y.

description:
I wish I wasn't so full of all kind of other eats on my trip to No Cal - I could have probably consumed an entire coffee crunch cake!  

How could I have forgotten this amazing cake that I first tasted over 11 years ago, in honor of my birthday???  How could I have forgotten to go back and pick up a piece or two?!  My Uncle reminded me (only on this recent trip - after at least three visits to the Bay Area in the last couple of years) about this wonderful amazing bakery!  Aiya!

Just read all the five stars reviews from all other yelpers!  It's light, sweet, but not too overwhelmingly sweet and of course it's that toffee candy that kicks it right out of this world!  The strawberry and lemon rolls are also very, very nice.
author: Nicole K.

description:
I hit the jackpot today when I came here - easy street parking, and lots of goodies in the display case since it was only 11 am! If only all weekdays could be vacation.

I was a bit overwhelmed at all the choices so I zero'ed in on what seems to be the hottest ones - the coffee crunch cake, the guava cake, and the green tea roll. All three slices for a total of $9 and with precise wrapping to boot.

Guava cake - airy and moist with lots of frosting that was subtly sweet and a beautiful thin jelly layer on top that was delicious when paired with the guava creme between the spongey cake layers

Coffee crunch cake - this is not like any coffee crunch you have had anywhere - fluffy cake that melts into a crunchy top that has some heft and is a wonderful contrast

Green tea roll - delicate green tea flavor and my least favorite since it was drier and too subtle

If only I lived closer! But this would definitely be a cake place to go to for birthdays!
author: Katherine P.

description: The BEST coffee crunch cake EVER!!!  My family has been coming here for years to get this cake for birthday parties, etc.  Cannot rave about it enough. YUM!
author: Christy A.

description:
Last week my brother while at work asked me to pick up something for him, so I went without hesitation. He has patiently done so much for me while I was on combat ships and then again while I lived in Spain so I don't mind a bit. He had wanted a coffee crunch cake from a small shop at Japantown and though it's the eternal NO-parking situation as usual, I did finally find a spot and went to the location. Unmarked with numbers, I had to ask within...  the bakery is hidden inside the Super Mira Japanese Foods Store, where one must enter through the entrance then turn immediately right and straight to the corner...  where one is treated to a heavenly sight of over seven cakes (varies accordingly to what remains and/or time of day). I was advised the "good stuff" usually disappears soon after opening, and I believe it!! Stopped there today at about 11:20AM, and already there were four empty cake spots!!! The kind mature japanese woman treated me very kindly and was very courteous. I asked for two slices of the SF-famous Coffee Crunch Cake which was still in cake form. She cut two generous slices, patiently wrapped each in tissue, then enclosed them within a small box, tying the box closed with a thin pink ribbon. The sugary coffee-flavored "crunch" added a welcome change to soft-top cakes, and was delicious as was the whole slice itself - I don't normally eat or even like desserts so if you see me buy one let alone eat it, it must be DARN good!!! Well-worth the tedious patience in finding a parking spot - better to go with someone who can go and jump out to get it while you wait like the bank bandit!!! They also take "hold" orders; I recommend calling in advance and if they have the cake/pastry you want, ask them to HOLD it for you otherwise it'll be GONE by time you get there! 

I wanted to add a photo of the cake but it was so yuMMy that not only did I eat the cake but also the picture!! hahahahahaaa  NO credit cards; CASH only!!

NOTE: Their Coffee Crunch Cake is pictured on their business card!!  ;-)
author: Tony L.

description:
My favorite birthday cake as a child was Sweet Stop's "Strawberry Pake." A custard layered cake with mounds of fresh strawberries covering the entire face of the cake, with sliced almonds on the sides. It's the only cake I cared enough for to ask my mom to order 3 months before my actual birthday. I love strawberries. I love custard. Nothing else is better. 

My mom would tell me every year on her birthday what cake she would like for her next celebration, and every other year or so it is the "Hawaiian Delight" from Sweet Stop. Layered cake with sliced bananas and crushed pineapples with raspberry cream. They can also substitute with strawberry cream if raspberry is too sweet. It's absolutely "delightful".

Last month, during a celebration of my cousins' birthdays, I finally had the opportunity to try the famous "Coffee Crunch" cake; it's mentioned in numerous mags and articles that you'll find proudly displayed on the counter. Five layers of sponge cake and whip cream covered entirely with crunchy, chewy, sweet coffee goodness. It's magical. 

We got the same cake for my niece's one-month birthday. Everyone loved it, and it marked a new Sweet Stop occasion for us.

As you can see, my family are hugh Sweet Stop fanatics! We can't and probably won't ever get enough of their yummy sweetness. I only hope that the sweet elderly couple that has owned the place for forever, continue on enchanting cake-lovers for generations and generations to come. Just work that magic!
author: Deanna T.

description: got a piece of coffee crunch.  im so getting the whole cake for my b-day!
author: Jee C.

description: Simple cakes can be found here.  The coffee crunch cake wasn't amazing; I might have expected too much.  It is a solid four stars, though.  I would come back for the cake, but I'm not sure for what occasion.  The cakes don't look decorative enough for a birthday cake and I don't know if I would just buy and eat this cake on a whim.
author: Erika C.

description:
I have a tendency to invite myself over for dinner. I'm lucky that my friends don't lock their gates, turn off their lights, and pretend that they are not home. I get that a lot at work. :-/ In most cases, my friends are there with delicious food waiting with open arms. So as not to appear as a complete mooch [just a partial one], I like to bring either dessert or drinks. Booze 'em up, so they don't remember that I crashed their party, or smother them in sweet desserts!

Yasukochi's was the perfect sweet stop to visit before the latest dinner I crashed in on [Thanks, Angelo!]. It's tucked away in one corner of the Super Mira Market. I picked up three slices of the cream-filled cake rolls [not sure of their names] - lemon, chocolate, chocolate/strawberry flavors. They were absolutely wonderful! By keeping the cake rolls in the fridge prior to eating, the cream was cooled down. Tasted almost like ice cream cake! Not too sweet. Delicious. My favorite flavor was the chocolate/strawberry. Five stars for that alone!

However, my first experience with Yasukochi must also be documented. A slice of the famous Coffee Crunch Cake was delivered to my office one afternoon when I was craving a dessert pick-me-up mid-day. The cake was a little on the sweet side, but the coffee crunchy goodness and the cute delivery guy were unforgettable.
author: Tinna H.

description: Picked up a coffee crunch and a choco crunch for my bestie's bday and both were surefire hits! The crunch part reminds me of finely crushed butterfinger filling.
author: Madelyn Y.

description:
This place sells out of coffee and lemon crunch cake by 1pm usually on weekends. It's that good. Sweet Stop is a hidden gem inside a super market off in the corner. It's only a block from the main "mall" area of Japantown.

I found that i prefer lemon crunch over coffee crunch, because it tastes a little more refreshing. I think i should go back and give the coffee crunch another try ;P

I've tried a few of their rolls, and they're okay. Careful though, their cakes and rolls will melt if you don't get them to a fridge within about two hours.
author: Jennifer Q.

description:
Not much to say other than everything is yummy!
Top 5 items...
1. Coffee Crunch Cake
2. Guava Cake
3. Cinnamon and custard coffee cake
4. Strawberry cake roll
5. Custard Eclairs
author: L O.

description:
My first introduction to the Sweet Shop was as a gift. I watched my friend's kitties while her and her husband were away on vacation. As a treat, she left me and my bf a couple of slices of Sweet Shop's chocolate cake with fresh strawberry cream filling. Yum. I was hooked to say the least.

It's a rolled cake. The cake is light, airy, and not overwhelming with sweetness. Just the right amount to make you want to come back again and again.

So far, I've tried the chocolate with whip cream filling, lemon with lemon creme filling, chocolate with strawberry creme filling, and the Toffee Crunch Cake.

My favorite is the Toffee Crunch Cake....heaven! Anything I write will not explain the delicious piece of heaven that is in every bite. You just have to get yourself down to the Sweet Stop and pay a mere $2.95 for a slice. Oh yeah, $2.95 is what they charge for each slice of cake that I mentioned above.

The lady behind the counter is the owner and she is as sweet as sugar. It's an all around great place to spend your cash.
author: Liz K.

description:
