Their Coffee Crunch Cake is so good that my sister and I made it a point to get there practically near opening today. There were so many days where we popped in at noon and everything we wanted was sold out. We were determined alright, even if I was about to fall asleep in front of the cakes.

As we we were paying, the sweet woman behind the counter told us that we need to have our yummy treats refrigerated fairly soon. My sister and I exchanged looks and told her that we still planned on doing lots of shopping. She told us not to worry and that she can hold onto our desserts and that we could come back for it when we were done. My sister gave her a five dollar bill as an extra tip for being sweet, and after lots of playful fighting, the woman took it.

When we were done shopping and got home, we opened the bag only to find an envelope -- the woman returned the $5. How cute!

Homey, wonderful, and helpful service paired with amazingly light, fluffy, sweet cakes makes for a wonderful stop that everyone needs to try.
author: Vinh N.

description:
Coffee Crunch.

Cash only. Go before they close for the day or, GASP, run out of cake!
author: Ryan V.

description:
My mom told me of this coffee crunch cake from some place on Sutter, that my dad loved years ago.  I immediately thought of yelp.  My friend Elieen had just reviewed Yasukochi, and I thought ... coffee crunch ... Sutter.  This has to be the place!  And it is.  My mom suggested to get this cake for my sister's upcoming birthday, so maybe I will do that.

I bought slices of the Lemon and Coffee Crunch.  Actually, the last two each for the day, at around 5:00.  So if you wanted some tonight, and the tray was empty, blame me.  ** note my evil grin **

Anyway, these cakes are not overly sweet, and are very good.  Sponge cake, with whipped cream, and either lemon or coffee crunches.  Four slices cost me about $11.  You really have to look for this place, as it's inside of a supermarket, and they have early hours.  Other cakes are available, as are pies, cookies, and other good stuff.

Red Ribbon Bakery has a similar cake, but this one blows it out of the water.  If you like that one, you will LOVE this one.

So, go, buy a slice or two of each, but be sure to bring either cash or check ... they do not accept credit cards!
author: Michael M.

description:
COMPLETELY BLOWN AWAY.

This is my first time ever, coming to the store and ordering from them, and I can not say anything except "HOLY #*&@". The outside decor does not look like anything special, because it is jointed with a Japanese convenience store (the actual Yasukochi is inside the store, to your right). I was a little bit disappointed though, because when I had arrived, the person in front of me took the last slice of Coffee Crunch Cake. =\ ah, tears..but that's okay! The elderly man that helped me was very nice and offered me several alternatives, which I took into immediate consideration. Hell, what was there even to consider? I pretty much took both of the suggestions he offered to me.

The Chocolate Crunch Cake and Guava Cake are both AMAZING. I can not compare with the Coffee Crunch, because I never had it before, but the Chocolate Crunch was reeeeaaaally good. Both cakes were very soft and "silky smooth", with flavor crystals that bursts with "another Yasukochi addict made" with every bite. Definite suggestion to everyone who loves sweets.
author: Kei T.

description:
:D tehee! 

The coffee crunch cake is a great cake to receive and give!! Despite its size at first glance, it's quite easy to pack away... and it's sweet in the not-too-sweet way and is just straight up delicious!! 

nice pic #8 Susy C!

The dude who helped me gets a pain.in.the.A++ for attitude, but the cake is so good, it really outdoes human drama. don't forget your ca$h or check!
author: Nanemone T.

description: incredible cakes here. freshly homemade by a nice Japanese couple. guava cake and coffee crunch are can't misses. but better order ahead or you'll be disappointed. not too sweet and so fluffy! you can park in their garage door space on Buchanan street if you can't find a space in the neighborhood.
author: Jeff W.

description: Must... eat... coffee... crunch...cake... before it's too late and I have to eliminate carbs.   Theeeeee best invention since Apple Pie from Costco.
author: Amro R.

description:
I came here on early afternoon on April 17th 2010---a cherry blossom festival day! 

I ordered the last slice of coffee crunch cake!!   
The nice lady behind the counter said that I was "very lucky."  
Knowing it was the last piece only made it taste that much better :D 

All around yummy experience.  Hope she has coffee crunch cake for me later today haha. 

I've been getting this cake for myself on my birthday ever since!
author: Margaret S.

description:
Cake rolls are sooo yummy!  Moist, spongy cake rolled up with smooth cream fillings that are not too sweet, so perfectly light and flavorful to each creative combinations.  Every flavor tastes fresh, nothing artificial.  My fav flavors are: chocolate cake with strawberry (fresh fruit bits!) cream, orange cake with fresh mandarin orange bits and cream.  These individual slices are thick, great deal for $3/slice!

The guava cake and green tea cakes are good too.  You can't go wrong with any of the selections!  Cash only.
author: Ellen L.

description:
It's strangely located inside a Japanese grocery store.  From the outside, I would not have noticed it at all.  Once inside, the cakes screamed to be consumed.

The display had slices of delicious looking confections.  If it were not so close to the holidays, I would have indulged until my kidneys gave out.  I am going to have to go back and try all the delicious slices.  I saw the coffee crunch cake, a green tea roll, a chocolate roll, droooooooooool.  

In a rare display of self control, I waited until my friend got to her new apartment before I purchased the slices.  Which was 3 hours later.  Because I would have eaten it all all all all all all all........
author: Christina C.

description:
This place is amaaaaaaaaazing.  Mouth watering goodness!  The coffee-crunch cake and lemon crunch cake is just delicious.  The cake itself was light, fluffy and so airy.  The topping on it giving it the perfect crunch which compliments the cake.  

I have had cake rolls from many places in china town, Shen Kee etc...but the rolls here kick their @sses like no other.  The reason is the rolls are soft and fluffy but the cream for the strawberry is actual strawberries.  You can see bits and pieces of the fruits as you bite into it.  None of that lil morsels of fake strawberry flavoring and red dye going on.  Nothing but the real stuff.  

I highly suggest you come early in the morning to get your cakes because by the time 3 rolls around you might not get the slices and end up purchasing the whole cake just for the yum yum tasty goodness.  But who cares, with a bigger cake you have more to eat and to share!  

The owners of the shops are so sweet.  At times, it makes me want to go up to hug them.
author: Vinh P.

description:
i read so much about yasukochi's crunch cakes that i had to try all three they had out that day.  i could not wait to get home and i was weaving in and out of traffic like a mother trucker trying to get back home.

i opened the carefully packaged box (i admire that about japanese culture, they always take care to properly package and wrap things up for you), and carefully took out the still cool slices.

within seconds on my first bite, i was crying "mama" like paula deen in a bathtub full of butter.  to quote Kei T., i was completely blown away!  in tears, i tell you.  in TEARS!  

for a girl that grew up on goldilocks, i'll just have to break up with her.  omg, i think i found the most absolute best cake i've ever had in my entire life!
author: Christine P.

description:
I've been meaning to try their coffee crunch cake.  I was hoping to buy a slice of this popular cake, but the nice old lady at the counter informed me that they were all sold out. She noted that I needed to come in the morning because they sell out quickly.  Hot damn, wake up early for a slice of cake?! I'm not exactly an early bird...I like to sleep in to catch up on my beauty sleep.  So I bought the whole cake, which was the last one.  

And oh my. This cake was tasty!!!  Don't expect your fancy gourmet cake.  It was old fashion goodness in each bite.  The yellow cake was soft covered in coffee flavor, the cream was light, and coffee crunch was gooey and crunchy.  Yum  ^_^
author: hello k.

description:
Oh yeah..Coffee crunch cake is very sweet and very good. The lady who waited on me was also very sweet and wrapped my one piece of cake up in a box and tied it with a pretty ribbon. 

The bakery is located within a grocery store so look for the address, go into the grocery and turn right when you are inside.
author: Bleep S.

description:
Ever notice how the only heavily-yelped places that can maintain a 5-star average are bakeries, coffee shops, or ice cream parlors?  Just goes to show you that the simple (and cheap) pleasures in life are the best.  Like sipping a cup of coffee in the morning with a slice of coffee cake.  So perfect that the day can only go downhill from there.

Now Sweet Stop just might have the most famous coffee cake in San Francisco, so I had to check it out.  But at the risk of blaspheming, I will say it's not my favorite--I still like Schubert's the best.  Why? 2 reasons: first, the "crunch" in this coffee cake is made of bits of caramel, and I'm not big on caramel (if only it were made out of nuts instead).  And second, the cake itself, while perfect, has more of a traditional birthday/wedding cake texture (it even has layers of whipped cream), whereas I like coffee cake to be a little more bready or pastry-esque.  However, I spied a lot of other delicious cakes here too, like the lemon or guava ones, so I will definitely be back to try some of those.

Also, bonus points for the friendly service and cute store-within-a-store location.
author: Wes M.

description:
I believe almost every birthday cake we've had at a family party had a cake from Yasukochi's.  They have the absolute BEST cakes in the bay area.  They are so light and fluffy... the whipped cream is really light!  They're coffee cake is to die for!  
And those little rolls of white or chocolate cake and strawberry or lemon whipped cream are my FAVORITE.   

I hear the white peach tarts/pies in the summer are great!  

No matter what you order from Yasukochi, you can't go wrong!  I would strongly recommend getting your sweet-loving-butt into Super Mira and over the the Yasukochi counter!
author: K M.

description:
After reading all the reviews, my wife and I wanted to try their cakes out. 

The reviews are spot on. We took home slices of the coffee crunch cake, lemon cake, and chocolate crunch cake. The cake was so moist and all the flavors equally melting in your mouth.

The only draw back is that the distance for me, but if I lived in SF then this would be my bakery to go to!
author: Carlos S.

description:
This place has very good quality cakes and desserts. 

Friendly service and willing to make custom Cakes.....they make a wonderful Blueberry cake.

Yum Yum,eat 'em up!
author: Ritz R.

description: One word: amazing. The coffee cruch cake is to die for. My entire family loved it. I will definitely be back!
author: Alexandra O.

description:
As the star rating suggests. This is as good as it gets. I have tasted the cakes from here mutiple times and every time I am left wanting more. The shop is run by a couple very nice and pleasant elderly women. I generally call ahead for my cake, making sure they don't sell out. And everytime, I see the same little old lady, wrapping my cake and bringing it out from the kitchen. It almost feels like getting food from my grandma. 

My favorite cake of them all is the coffee crunch cake. It's one of the best tasting cake I've ever had. A whole cake is alittle much even for 6 people. I would recommend buying it by the slice unless you have a large party. The cake is a perfect harmony between creamy, soft cake and cruchy coffee bits. Every bite tastes like fluffy clouds floating in the sky. The balance between cream and cake is absolutely fabulous. The best part is, the sweetness level of the cake is just right. When you are done eating, you don't feel like you need a gallon of water to wash away the dry sweet after taste in your mouth. 

If you are in the area, I would recommend giving this place a try. However, if you have a specific cake or if you want an entire cake, I would recommend calling a day or two ahead. They run out very quickly.
author: Charlie W.

description: This shop was pretty hard to find since it was inside a Market. I came in the market and saw this tiny bakery all the way to my right. Not what I would imagine from the pictures I saw on yelp. I approached this cute old Japanese lady and asked for one of the infamous coffee cakes. $2.95 was the price, not bad...not bad at all. After leaving the bakery I quickly drove to my boyfriend's house so we can enjoy the cake together. Got to his house and he was still sleeping -_- so I thought to myself, "YES more cake for me!" But no I didn't, being the sweet and thoughtful girlfriend I was, I had to share this delicious piece of cake with him. *sigh I better get brownie points for that! *holds fist*
author: Tracy A.

description:
I decided to check this place out on my trip to San Francisco a couple weeks ago based on the review I had read about the place.  I had gotten into the whole Asian Bakery thing thanks to a birthday cake I had from San Jose.

I get there around 1pm on a Tuesday, determined to try the coffee crunch cake that I heard so much about only to find out ALL the slices are gone.  The only thing they had was a full sized cake.  Well this was my last day in California and my only day in SF so I went with the full sized cake.  I figured I was going to a party a friend's house and could bring that as a desert.

I get to the party and the cake sits there cause no one wanted to be first (it looks so pretty all caramel colored) so since I brought it I figured I'd be the first.  I sliced off thin piece, tried it, and was instantly transported to food heaven, desert division.  It was perfect, not too sweet, not too heavy, not too spongy.  The cake was a toffee like flavor that was very light and the frosting wasn't over powering.  Then you get the surprise burst of flavor from the crunch things as they melt away after one bite.  The crunch things had the texture of a burned marshmallow but tasted like toffee/caramel. The frosting was light and most likely whipped cream based. 

I am a sweet tooth and usually I can't stop eating sweets.  But for this cake, I savored every single bit and took my time.  I knew if I took the cake home, I'd eat the whole thing so, I became the Cake Pimp.

I went around the whole party and talked up the cake and told people they had to try it. 15 minutes later, the cake was all gone.  I became known as the girl who brought the cake and made instant friends :-) I find it amusing that *I* who does not live in SF introduced roughly 20 locals to this great locally own bakery that's down the street from them. 

It's located at the corner of Sutter & Buchanan right across from Japantown plaza (pedestrian only area?).  It's inside Super Mira Supermarket which you will probably only notice the Mira part when coming from the street.  I'm not sure how much street parking there is as my friend dropped me off and drove around the block to pick me up as there was no parking available at that time.

I'm not sure about the hours but since everyone says they close early (early is so relative people!) I went as soon as I got into SF.  Given that there were no individual slices left and a few full sized cakes, I can image that they close as soon as the last cake is sold.  I would try to get there in the morning to try and increase your chances.

Here I am nearly a month and a half later and I'm still craving this cake. I've told all my friends who are visiting out there to check this place out as a not to be missed San Francisco bakery.
author: Natasha O.

description: After multiple failed attempts, we were finally able to get our mitts on their infamous coffee crunch cake. It required a simple phone call to reserve one whole 8" cake ($28) about 3 hours before we picked it up. We bought it for our NYE get-together with friends and everyone loved it. The exterior was sweeter than anticipated but still so yummy!
author: Tina T.

description: The coffee crunch cake brought me back to my childhood days shopping downtown with my Mom.  Every bit as good as when we used to stop at Blum's!  5 stars for bringing back a happy childhood memory.
author: Robert G.

description:
coffee crunch cake = YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM

enough said. 

thanks tiffany l. for saving me my first piece of coffee crunch cake. the cake was worth the wait! :)
author: Carol Y.

description: Excellent cakes!! The guava cake (best outside of Hawaii), coffee crunch cake (beats Eastern Bakery)  and lemon crunch cake (had to give it a try after I experienced the coffee crunch) are outstanding. You would think they are overly sweet just thinking about it, but upon consumption you will beg to differ. We usually order 2 days ahead....I highly recommend it. I'm not a dessert lover but their cakes are irresistible. Shop around the store before picking up your order and enjoy the plentiful stock of japanese groceries. The staff is always sweet and friendly and more then eager to help you out.
author: Stephanie D.

description: This is my favorite place to get coffee crunch cake!  Ive also tried the chocolate crunch, chocolate strawberry roll, green tea roll and mocha cake which are all very good.  Found that the coffee crunch and chocolate crunch cake is best served a few hours after you take it out from the freezer.  Bought it Thursday and served it on Friday so at the store they said keep it in the freezer so the crunchies dont melt and keep better.  The consistency of the icing/frosting/cream is almost like ice cream.
author: she q.

description:
I'm probably going to regret telling all of you about one of my favorite bakeries, and I guess it would be bad juju to tell you all, then kill you. So here are my favorite things here. They make a really good Coffee Crunch Cake that is a little more refined than Eastern Bakery in Chinatown, but about 3 times the price. Any of the cake rolls are so good I bet you won't make it home before inhaling it. Choose from White or Chocolate cake with strawberry cream filling, Chocolate with mocha cream filling, or White cake with Lemon cream filling. The Cinnamon pastries are buttery and rich. Go early, they run out quickly. This gem is inside the Super Mira market on the corner.
Cash only.
author: Arlene C.

description:
Boo, both cakes that I wanted a piece of weren't available (Coffee crunch cake and Strawberry cake) so I settled for the Chocolate crunch cake and a piece of the guava cake. The crunch cake was ok. I would have probably liked it more if it were coffee. The top jelly like layer of the guava cake was too sweet for me but the other part of it was yummy. My bf got the chocolate strawberry roll which he enjoyed because the filling was ice cream like. 
The lady working there was really nice. She told us about the pieces we chose and offered suggestions. Btw, this place is locate inside Super Mina.
author: Lee N.

description: Stopped by here the other day after my spa day at Kabuki Springs. Of course they were out of their Coffe Crunch Cake. Not much cakes left, but I did buy sllices of their Green Tea and Strawberry cakes. Yum!!! Next time I'll have to get here early to get a slice of their Coffee Crunch cake and maybe a slice of their Mocha cake, and new Chocolate Crunch cake!! Hmmm...what else??? =D
author: Neni E.

description:
I had to try the coffee crunch cake because of other Yelp reviews, and after having gone in on the weekend and finding it closed, I decided to try again on a random weekday afternoon.  The cake slices are huge, and the cake is nice and light and it's counterbalanced with good-sized sweet crunchy bits on the outside.  The consistency and sponginess is much like what you'll find in an Asian cake, but the taste is a lot sweeter so it actually tastes like dessert (whereas other cakes, like the Sheng Kee ones, can sometimes be not sugary enough and make you feel like you are actually eating a flavored sponge).  

The woman behind the counter was also so sweet and cute, I wanted to go behind the counter and hug her!

Oh and finding it is kind of weird, so make sure you go into the Mira supermarket, and the Yasukochi counter will be to your right.
author: Karen L.

description:
I want to dump my friend Pham. She's a bad influence to me. We met up for a casual lunch on Saturday and she asked me to go with her to get a cake for her brother's birthday. Little did I know that she had a plot for me to experience the best damn cake I've ever had. 

She wanted me to try the coffee crunch but unfortunately it was sold out by 1:30pm on a Saturday afternoon. So she told me to try her favorite chocolate roll with strawberry filling, as well as a slice of lemon crunch. Now I'm not a big fan of chocolate OR lemon, but I know that after 15 years of friendship, she wasn't going to let me throw away $6 if it wasn't good.

I went home, opened the box, and 2 slices of cake later, I called her to proclaim our friendship over. "How could you do this to me?!?!" The cake is sinful! They can't make cake so fluffy, not overly sweet and the filling so creamy and delicious.Now, I can't stop thinking about who's birthday is coming up next so I can find an excuse to order a cake from Yasukochi. 

Hi Pham - I'm just kidding about our friendship being over. You know I've got much love for you. So which cake would you like for your birthday? Coffee crunch or chocolate with strawberry filling? =D
author: Nancie T.

description: The best around! You've gotta try Chocolate and Coffee Crunch. It will melt all unhappiness away, at least for the moment. Go for it!
author: Winifred T.

description: This place is a delicacy.  It is worth a visit.  The mouth watering coffee crunch cake is a must have. Even if you do not particularly like coffee cake you have to try it. Very Yummy!
author: barbara v.

description:
Nothing better than a slice of coffee crunch cake.  I have gone into this place around noon on a Saturday and they were already sold out!

UPDATE (2/19/08): Got here a little after 1pm on a TUESDAY, and they had already sold out of coffee crunch cake slices. I had to settle for lemon crunch cake (a.k.a. the consolation prize).
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description:
Yasukochi's holds a special place in my heart. From my first birthday cake all the way until high school I had a birthday cake from here. I still remember my Hello Kitty cake from when I was 6. So for my 25th birthday I decided to come back and I was surprised that the lady behind the counter Hatsie still remembered me!  I swear I have tried everything in their display which is all so scrumptious except for the haupia cake that I didn't even know existed. So that is next. 

My favorites are the coffee crunch cake, strawberry roll, and the orange sponge cake.
author: Jennie N.

description: Been coming here since I was a kid.  If you ever had a chance to eat the original Blum's coffee crunch cake by that long gone SF institution, you won't be disappointed!  Their strawberry cream roll is also a favorite of mine, so are their chiffon cakes which come in different flavors depending on the season, etc. What sets them apart from other Asian bakeries is that they use real whip cream and real fruit -- no fillers.  There's integrity in their sweet confections.  Call before you go if you want a certain item.
author: Bodhi D.

description:
The only thing sweeter than the excellent coffee crunch cake is the nice Japanese grandma who served it to me.

Have yet to try the other items, so I'll reserve that 5th star until I do.
author: Mercutio k.

description: I was on vacation in San Fran and my friend raved about their coffee crunch cake. I was really reluctant to try it bc I don't care too much about coffee cakes. The moment I had it, I couldnt stop eating it!! It was SO goood. I miss it and wish I could find it somewhere in Dallas.
author: Tasha P.

description:
After seeing many people raving about their coffee crunch cake, I couldn't wait any longer to try it! I had an appointment to get my hair done at Notorious hair salon so I thought  I'd pick a few slices up for the girls to try too. 

The lady at the shop (didn't catch her name, I was too busy drooling over the case) was kind enough to deal with my indecisive wavering and increasing order size, and complicated cake separation without any hint of impatience.

I got two coffee crunch and one lemon crunch for the Notorious ladies and one coffee crunch and one Hawaiian Delight (guava) cake slice for JR and I to try.  The ladies loved the crunch cakes and I couldn't WAIT to get home to try ours! JR, I hope you appreciate the fact that even though you don't possess a sweet tooth like mine, I waited for you to dig in!

After an ok dinner and a terribly burnt and runny creme brulee, I was hoping the cakes would redeem my palate.  Guess what? They did. 

The Coffee Crunch Cake was delicious. Light, moist cake, lightly sweetened whipped cream filling and a yummy coffee brittle-like topping was generously sprinkled and pressed into the whipped cream frosting. It was a really good balance of crunchy, sweet and soft, and the coffee crunch wasn't overpowering at all. 

The Guava cake slice was good as well, although in a different league. it  had what tasted like a bright swath of seedless strawberry jelly on the top which gave it a more pronounced fruit flavor, but still it was quite yummy! The true test was JR having more than a bite- he usually only has one or two bites of sweets and he's finished- he actually helped me finish both slices!

Only downside to my whole experience was the quest for parking, which was absurdly lacking for a noon-ish Saturday afternoon. Can't blame the bakery for that one though!   Would I buy either cake again? Yes, but only if I'm feeling really sorry for myself or if I felt like indulging one of my friends! One can't eat stuff like this consistently unless you don't plan to live past 40!
author: Mortiche W.

description:
***Update 12/22/06***
So I finally made it back and tried the guava. Sorry, all I can say is that it's not King's...

*******

Yet another place I had to visit thanks to Mia S.! 

Unfortunately they didn't have guava, so I can't compare it to King's. I got the lemon crunch instead. It's really fluffy and good. Not too sweet, but the candy crunch on top can be a bit much if you're not into sweet stuff. Personally, I have a sweet tooth so I couldn't get enough! 

I'll be back for a guava cake soon, and I'll update then.
author: The Sock S.

description:
Finally got to try their famous Coffee Crunch and it was just as awesome as I had heard & imagined!  The cake itself is the same as the Lemon Crunch, but with a coffee buttercream, then loaded with lots of toffee bits.  

The couple who run the cake counter are very sweet people.  One of those mom & pop businesses that you really feel good about supporting!
author: Judy K.

description:
I have been shopping for cakes at Yasukochi's when the owners had photos of their kids as toddlers on the back wall.  Now, those same kids are married with children. 

The coffee-crunch cake is tops.  I don't recall the source, but either the baker worked at Blum's on Union Sqr. or received permission after Blum's closed to use the coffee crunch receipe.  (There was another notable coffee-crunch cake baker in Chinatown (Eastern Bakery) if I recall.  Coffee-crunch cakes must be consumed on the day it is made - the shelf-life of the crunch is probably about 10 hours refrigerated.

The crown jewel at Yasukochi's is the strawberry cake.  Large, ripe whole strawberrys imbedded with a red glaze and surrounded by whip cream.  Order it as a cake or a sheet - the strawberries must be handpicked by the baker, they are all uniformly at the peak of sweetness.
author: Joe R.

description: Delicious cakes.  I've had their crunch cakes and some of their rolls, as well as the guava cake.  The crunch cake is pure indulgence with a mixture of textures, from the crunchy pieces on top to the soft inner cake.  I tend to like the guava cake and the rolls better though, because they aren't as sweet but are still so good.  The owners are always so friendly and nice too.
author: Karen W.

description:
I love this place.  Our family has been ordering cakes from Sweet Stop for every special occassion, especially birthdays.  The staff is super sweet, especially the oba-chan there : )  My favorite is the white cake with pineapple filling and the chocolate chantilly cake.  OMG...I ordered these cakes for my husband's bday party and everyone just LOVED it.  Their cakes are very light and fluffy.  I've never tried their guava cake, looks pretty though.  And they are famous for their coffee crunch cake.  It's on the sweet side because of the crunchy toffee, but the sponge cake and frosting is not too sweet so it balances out well.  But please try the white cake w/ pineapple filling.  It's delish~

I hope they'll never go out of business so I can get my kid's bday cakes from here one day just like my mom did for me : )
author: eileen k.

description: Mixed feelings about this place... 5-stars for the crunch cakes... 0-stars for the small flies buzzing the crunch cakes, coffee cakes, etc.  If i were rating Yasukochi's solely on the taste of the food-- never having seen where they came from-- it would be an unqualified 5-stars... but since i've now seen the 0-star, unhygienic environment in which they are stored and displayed, i guess it averages out to 3-stars at most. I almost wish i had never gone, and just continued to ask my cousin to pick up the crunch cake... ignorance is bliss.
author: D L.

description: Whoever said you can't buy happiness has obviously not been here!! My very sweet coworker gave me a huge slice of their coffee crunch cake; I took it home and split half of it with my boyfriend. OMFGEEBUS is all I can say.... usually coffee cakes are more bitter than sweet but this had the right combination. It's smooth, rich, creamy, and delicious. I was also finally able to try their guava cake (last time I went it was all sold out); luckily for me there were two left when I got there. I love guava so it's genius to make it into a cake!!! Not too sweet and very moist. I suggest going in the morning if you want to grab a slice...
author: selina n.

description:
I usually don't like cake since the consistency and sweetness tends to be overwhelming. After reading the rave reviews, I decided to check out the Sweet Shop out of curiosity. The nice old Japanese lady told me that there was one slice of coffee crumb cake left.

Right now I have managed to shove two pieces into my mouth and it is heavenly. I really enjoy coffee and the coffee crumbs have a crunchiness similar to a heath bar crunch while the cake is soft and light with very little cream. Overall, I definitely recommend it for those days when you want a little pick me up. It's perfect with a nice cup of tea or coffee. 

Yummy, this cake is definitely one you want to savor and slowly eat while sighing from pure happiness. Now I want to go back and eat my way through the Sweet Shop!
author: Sophie C.

description:
As I've been suffering from PVD (Post Vacation Depression) following my recent trip to Oahu, my friends and bf ordered a haupia cake from Yasukochi's for my birthday to cheer me up.  How SWEET it is to love and be loved! 

Thanks to Yelp, they found Yasukochi's and pre-ordered the cake and surprised me!   One bite and I was cured (well, slightly cured) of my PVD.  While it's not quite as luscious as the haupia cake from Napoleon's that I had in Oahu, it was very, very good!  The haupia filling was exactly what I was craving!  It's the next best thing without having to fly over the Pacific Ocean!  
They were even nice enough to put "Happy Birthday" in Hawaiian on the cake for me -- "Ha Oli La Hanau".  My friends didn't know how to say it, so Yasukochi's looked it up for them. (my Hawaiian-in-the-know roomie confirmed it was correct!)
BTW, we ordered a 1/4 sheet and it was way too much for 20 of us!  The cake stands 4-layers high....4-layers of haupia cake for me!
Thank you, Yasukochi's and Yelp for a sweet end to my birthday!  To my friends and bf:  "Aloha wau ia 'oe!"
author: Joanne S.

description:
Desserts!! My ultimate favorite thing, right after a good meal, for a celebration or just because. 
the cakes here are delicious! light, fluffy and just sweet enough!

i have tried this one that is only available by special order. a good friend of mine, knows that when i have a stress-ful day at work... or feeling the stress with life - a nice fat slice of cake will bring me back to my smile-y self. =D
it is a coconut cake, just awesome - not like any cake i have ever had!
author: kiko v.

description: There is a reason I'm a regular here, their cake is the most amazing thing ever. I love cake! in fact I love cake more than that fat kid loves cake! And the Coffee Crunch cake is one of the best cakes I've ever had. Not only that, the service is fantastic. I love this place.
author: Beatriz A.

description:
I have been coming to Yasukochi's Sweet Stop for a long time. I haven't tried a lot of the cakes, but i've had the Koffee Krunch Cake and the Guava Cake. I can't remember the type of cookie off the top of my head, but they also offer cookies that are good too. (senbei or rice cracker cookie ....found on a past review)

The koffee krunch is fantastic for any birthday celebration or if you want to bring a dessert somewhere like to a friends for dinner.
The cake itself isn't knock your shoes off, but everything else is. Each layer of moist cake is complemented by little bite size koffee krunch chunks and creme. the chunks aren't overpoweringly coffee like, but taste similiar to jamoca/coffee ice cream.

I will be going back again. i like to suppor the mom and pop businesses that are way better than any cake you will find at costco or local supermarket.

the owners are very friendly and will know you by name. Don't be fooled if you can't find it. It's in the Super Mira market to the right when you first enter. You can't miss it once you look past the registers.
author: edie t.

description: The Sweet Stop has ok stuff - the cookies (chocolate chip & oatmeal) are pretty good. The service however, is just terrible.  We live right across the street.  My husband and I are in the store almost every day (saki! and sushi! and any number of things) and yet when I try to buy pastries at the Sweet Stop I always get a load of attitude.  I'm Caucasian - but I hand over my money with both hands.  I say thank you.  What gives?  Last time I was there I rang the bell twice and watched two people in the back making pastries.  They just ignored me.  I give up.  I'm baking my own damn cookies right this second! :)
author: Katrina S.

description:
The cakes here are fantastic. Fresh and tasty with a lovely whipped cream frosting. No other frosting will do. Because I just don't get buttercream, too heavy.

The coffee crunch is hands down the top seller here. They even sell slices of it but it goes really fast! Sometimes when we stop by at about 1:30pm, they're out of the slices. They also have lemon crunch too. An interesting alternative to the coffee crunch. My family has been getting cakes here for decades.
author: cyndi L.

description: coffee crunch was indeed good, though fairly sweet.  the green tea roll was a nice counterpoint to the coffee - just a hint of bitterness
author: Di Yin L.

description: Five stars for the coffee crunch cake alone! My 90-year-old mother always reminisces about the Blums version and she loved it. She even told her other relatives about it, so must have really impressed her! It was really good (though some pieces slightly frozen in the middle?) Still delicious even the next day - when thawed completely? Normally frozen cakes are a bad thing, but this still tasted great. Not visually fancy (like Schubert's) but great old-fashioned taste! Also tried the guava (too sweet) and green tea, but the crunch is the star!
author: Gale H.

description:
This is the place I go to every time I am at a lost for a birthday! Whenever I don't know what kind of cake or what to get someone for their birthday, I always come here! This place is very hard to find, it is on Sutter Street in Japan town. They share a space with a Japanese grocery store. 
I always order the Coffee Crunch Cake. For their cakes, you can either get them by slices or the whole cake. If you want to order the whole cake, you are better off calling in advance either the night before or in the morning. If you want to just try a slice, you should go early before noon. Every time I drop by in the afternoon, they are sold out of their coffee crunch cake. However, they do offer a whole bunch of other variety cakes. Their lemon cake is pretty decent and their chocolate cake is good too. But the chocolate cake is a bit too sweet for me. They also have a guava cake that everyone talks about but I haven't tried it yet. 
The people who work there are the sweetest people ever! They always have a smile on their face! They might not be very fluent in English but they are awesome! This is a must try if you are ever in Japan town! It makes my day even on the worst days ever!
author: Miffy Y.

description:
I ordered a chocolate cake here. My bad, it was a month ago so I don't exactly remember the name. All my friends commented on how delicious it was and asked me where I got it. I made them make it look like the cake from Portal (the game) hahaha, but stupid me forgot to bring a single white candle. Just like the description in the game though, it was delicious and moist. By the way its cash only, my cake was $37 and it was enough to serve almost 20 people. Very niice!

Definitely get the cake here! And I really need to try the coffee crunch cake.
author: C. Z.

description:
If you're having a sweet tooth, Yasukochi's Sweet Shop  is the perfect place to satisfy your craving. First, I would like to apologize to my dentist for eating the coffee crunch and lemon crunch cakes from Yasukochi's. These cakes are topped with candy pieces. If you do not have a toothbrush handy after devouring these cakes, your teeth will be in big trouble!!  

My friend discovered Yasukochi's after searching for Coffee Crunch cake on yelp. Intrigued by her need to go to J-town during her lunch break....just for cake...I had to tag along. We arrived a little too late and watched the last slice of Coffee Crunch Cake being sold to the man ahead of us. And this was at 1pm!! All SOLD OUT! We decided to try the lemon version, but it was just a little too sweet. 

The boyfriend and I came back the following day since we were in the area and was able to score a slice of Coffee Crunch Cake and a slice of Chocolate Cake with Crushed Strawberries. Now this was more my style. Coffee Crunch Cake was good, but not to die for. Way tooooo SWEET for me. However, the chocolate cake with crushed strawberries ---- now that was off the hook. Taste like ice cream cake. MmmMmm...*drools* 

So if you're J-town, this is a must-visit! 

Recommendations:
Coffee Crunch Cake 
Chocolate Cake w/ Crushed Strawberries 
Guava Cake
author: Lisa T.

description: Finally had the coffee crunch cake.  It definitely lives up to the hype.  And, as promised so long ago, earns them that fifth star!
author: Eileen H.

description:
The best mom n pop cake shop around! I got the chocolate swirl cake with crushed strawberries embedded in the middle. It was so delicious I wanted to try more. I ended up getting a whole round guava passion fruit sponge cake. This is the place to go on a weekday.

Since I love this place so much, I know where to get birthday cakes for friends now! ^.^
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I bought 3 cakes for my daughter's 30th birthday - one for each decade.
Strawberry shortcake for the young days
Coffe crunch for those tough middle years
and an elegant white chiffon cake for the mother to be.

well, each and every cake was a wonder to behold and to eat.
My personal favorite was the strawberry shortcake - the best one i ever had in my life!
Madeline's downtown mousse cakes are my holiday season traditionals, but i will definitely add this place to my list!
author: al l.

description: This place is a hidden gem!  Yasukochi has the most amazing coffee crunch cake!! Get there early to order a whole cake since they tend to run out by the end of the day. They often sell it by slices too. I've tried some of their other cakes which are good but their coffee crunch cake is what brings me back every time.
author: Hannah C.

description:
The Coffee Crunch Cake is TO DIE FOR. Chewy bits of caramel on the outside, soft and moist cake with light layers of coffee creme on the inside....*drools....**

The lady is super nice. She did a really nice writing on my bf's birthday cake and she took her time to make sure everything's right and wrapped it nice so it would be secure. Don't judge the place for its appearance. What might look shady on the outside is actually super delicious and sweet on the inside.
author: Annie C.

description: Once upon a time I had the most amazing coffee crunch cake at a baby shower and didn't know where the cake was from. I was told by the hostess that it was from a bakery inside a grocery store in Japan town that she had been frequenting for over 20 years. Fast forward to two years later when I found myself needing a cake for the bachelorette of a huge cake/sweets aficionado. I started a thread asking fellow yelpers to help me find this infamous cake and ta-da! I love yelp! I love Yasukochi's! I called, I ordered it, I paid (checks and cash only folks), the ladies who helped me with it all at the bakery were the sweetest, nicest ladies in teh world. The cake was a great success!
author: Dee I.

description: Great old fashioned Blum's coffee crunch cake source!
author: Debra M.

description: Everyone raves about their coffee crunch cake, respectfully so because it is seriously delicious. BUT, as they always run out of coffee crunch slices by the time I arrive, I went for the chocolate crunch cake. AND it is the fluffiest highlight of my day. Not to mention, the lady owner/worker/baker is the sweetest person ever (yes, it makes a difference). She told me to call in to reserve a slice of coffee crunch cake next time, so I will definitely be doing that. 5 stars, hands down. I think I'll go tomorrow...for the second time this week
author: Soph H.

description:
I cannot believe i have not yelped yasukochi's!! 

All i can say is the coffee crunch cake is to die for! By far the best cake i have ever eaten.  So moist, and crunchy.. the coffee crunch is YUMMY....  Not much else to say bout that!!

They also make some pretty screamin arare cookies!!!
author: Shelley N.

description:
Strawberry Roll Cake!!! - you can taste a strawberry cream in the roll from very fresh strawberry , NOT ARTIFICIAL ONE like Chinese Bakery Shenkey's.  

Green Tea Roll Cake!!! - sweetness and bitterness from the tea are perfectly balanced out in sponge cake. Thumbs UP!!

It is Grand mother recipe and  home style looking. 
Nothing looks so fancy, but the taste is so sophisticated.
author: N M.

description:
My favorite little bakery.  I am already missing the Sweet Stop.

First day in JTown, I waited outside patiently until they opened the doors to Super Mira so I could sample all the goodies. 

The chocolate cake with the strawberry whipped cream is my favorite. Nice and light, not too sweet, Just right.  Wife loves the toffee crunch cake. 

The elderly Japanese woman behind the counter is so nice and pleasant. On the third consecutive day she smiled and laughed as she put two cake rolls and a toffee cake in the cute pink box without waiting for my order. She knew she had me hooked.
author: Jim C.

description: It was a sunny day in the neighborhood! I walked into Yasukochi's Sweet Stop, rang the bell, and a sweet old lady helped me get a roll of coffee crunch, mocha, and coffee with strawberry filling. Each roll was $3 and boxed neatly altogether. Well Japantown is really out of the way for me, but the sweet stop was worth the trip! The cakes are sweet (especially with the strawberry filling), soft, and unforgettable!!
author: Bets Y.

description:
If I were starving and emaciated on a deserted island with no hopes of being saved... I'd be okay if I could just eat Yasukochi's cakes for the rest of my life.  
This place might be a little hard to find.  Its one the corner of Sutter and Buchanan and inside the MIA grocery store.  Cake slices are $3 and regular cake that serves 8-10 people run around $25.  They have a lot of other goodies too, but remember your cash because that's what you will need.
author: Kirstie R.

description: This is my wife's favorite place for Strawberry Cake hands down!  this family run business has been adding to my girth since high school!  If  you have a very special occasion or you just want to forget about calories and bite into a fantastic tasty morsal and forget about your troubles, this is it!  Yes, it is slighly more money to throw down but worth every penny because it goes into the owners grandchildren's college fund and helps keep "obachan" happy!
author: Curtis L.

description:
We came, we saw, we had the coffee crunch cake.  And it was damn good.

Update:  We tried the lemon crunch cake and it's just as tasty.  Also, the coffee crunch cake is a winner at any dinner party or potluck.  You'll be a hero.
author: Ben K.

description: I came back here again recently for sponge cakes. Again, always delicious, soft, and tasty. I tried their green tea this time and ate it rather quickly. I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to try a wonderful and freshly made sponge cake well worth $3. The Japanese lady inside is SO ADORABLE. She reminds me of the Japanese old ladies/grandmothers in my childhood animations. Excellent customer service from this old lady.
author: Tina C.

description: Coffee crunch cake ROCKS.  1000x better than Eastern Bakery's teeth cracking version of coffee cake.  Guava cake is outstanding as well.
author: I have something to say... A.

description:
Can't beat the coffee crunch and the chantilly (choc. cake with vanilla whip cream) cakes. The chocolate cake roll with the whip cream filling is also pure perfection. 

One star deducted for the grumpy old man, who happens to be the baker/owner, and for discontinuing my personal favorite:  the yellow cake roll with mocha cream filling.

p.s. I just removed another star. Got the grumpy guy on the phone who says he doesn't take orders for whole cake rolls anymore. Pleadings simply go into deaf ears. I guess he gets so much business that he doesn't have to care. Two thumbs down on him!!!
author: Lil D.

description: my brother had been craving the coffee crunch cake for two weeks, so i made a pit stop at yasukochi's on a gorgeous tuesday afternoon. the elderly lady who helped me out was extremely polite and gracious, star for customer service. the slice of cake was $3, and it was moderately sized for the price, so no great deal there. the cake itself was just ok for me. unlike most asian cakes, this one was not overly dry or scratchy, so star there. the coffee taste was very subtle, but still present. it just was not overpowering, which it should not have been, so star there, but overall, the cake was just too sweet. my mouth felt like it had been blasted with caramel and sugar upon having a small bite. i would not come back for the cake, but the service was friendly and the prices here for baked goods are pretty reasonable. everything is also quite fresh too.
author: Danny C.

description: The only thing I get here is the coffee crunch cake, superb. I've told many friends about this cake since I found out about it on yelp and now whenever it is someone's brithday they all order this cake and we never get tired of it!
author: Colin H.

description: I found out about this bakery on yelp and have bought many a guava cake and mocha roll for birthday parties here.  My girlfriends especially love that guava cake because it is bright pink, fluffy, and not too sweet.  The service here is very friendly.
author: Connie N.

description:
Yummy old school cakes!!!  I have to put it on my calendar to pick up a whole cake here the next time a special occasion requiring one arises.  I keep on forgetting!  When I do come by the market this bake shop is housed in, I always walk over to check out what's in the display case.  On my most recent visit, I got 2 slices to go: a Chocolate Crunch and a Vanilla Cake roll with Strawberry Cream.  Like I said, YUMMY!  I love their crunch cakes.  Great for those with a sweet tooth.  You can even buy the crunch topping on its own, to top whatever you like.  Just a warning for the non-sweet tooths out there, this cake may not be for you.  The cake itself isn't overly sweet, but the topping may be over the top for you guys.  Just scrape it off and hand it over to someone who does love sugar.  Try one of the cake rolls instead.  The Chocolate Crunch was really good.  I'm not usually a big fan of chocolate cakes, either.  This was not dried out, thank goodness.  It was just right.  The crunch topping made me feel like a kid again.  Crunch, Crunch, Crunch....MMMMMM....  I've tried Lemon Crunch and the Coffee Crunch.  They're all great.  They have a guava cake, too, no crunch on it though.  I'll have to try it again to update my review.

I'm eating the Vanilla Roll with the Strawberry Cream right now, but sharing, because I have to.  It's strawberry season, so there's some fresh ones in the filling, too.  This dessert is not too sweet, but once again, just right.  Very satisfying, without making me feel too guilty for eating dessert. They also have a green tea one, and a few others.  

I first heard about Yasukochi's Sweet Stop in an article I read, explaining the famed crunch cakes and how they are carrying on the tradition from some now long gone bakery.  So, I had to seek them out and I am so glad I did.  I haven't tried everything they offer, yet.  They also have cookies and pastries, but for me, the main draw are the cakes.  I just need to remember they're not open on Sunday or Monday, so that I can time my visits to the grocery store for when they are open.  I think they may be cash only, so make sure you have some of that if you stop by.  Believe me, from my own experience, it is pretty depressing if you stop by, have your heart set on a slice, and don't have the cash with you for it.  Well, maybe it's for my waistline's own good...
author: CE Y.

description: I picked up their Chocolate Crunch Cake for my Xmas dinner after reading all the rave reviews on here and it was incredible. My gf's grandmother declared it was the best cake she's ever had in her life. It seriously was that good.
author: Stephen B.

description: The lemon crunch cake at Sweet Stop is going to change everything you think and feel about baked goods. Get over your hipster pocky obsession for one minute and spend a little more money on a slice of the lemon crunch cake, if you're lucky enough to be there when the bakery is actually open. Good, good stuff.
author: Maria D.

description: Waaaaay over-hyped. Had the coffee crunch cake cuz everyone was raving about it. It was OK; like any other roll cake but with crunch on top. It's more sweet than coffee.
author: Vinh T.

description: ahhhhhhhhhhhh. i heart this coffee crunch cake so much. its almost the perfect dessert, guys. it's definitely for those with a sweet tooth tho!
author: Clara H.

description: They make the best cakes, with awesome flavors. I have tried the blue berry and strawberry cake. I LOVE THEM, i really want to try all the other yummy looking pies and cakes. :D This is really a hidden gem if you don't shop at Super Mina then you will have no idea its in there. This goes for me too, My gf actually used to work there and she told me they have really good desserts and I was okay I will try them out. I did and I want more, I try to pick up a cake as often as I can XD. lol I will be back for more that is for sure.. :D
author: Jonathan W.

description: Um, the crunch cake is by far the best cake that has entered my mouth. It sells out usually before 4pm and the little grandma that makes it all is so precious and nice. Now the only question is do you like the coffee crunch cake or the lemon crunch cake better?
author: Sydel S.

description: Amazing coffee crunch cake and chocolate crunch cake. When i'm in the SF area, i try to make a stop here in this little shop. They are closed on Sundays and on weekends slices of their infamous cakes go quick. If you are in the area, give it a try - you won't regret it. It'll be the best thing your taste buds has tried! Also, wallet friendly!
author: Diana J.

description: Hawaiian Mochi, Hawaiian Mochi, wherefore art thou Hawaiian Mochi?  Deny thy yummyfulness and refuse thy caloric contents.  Aah, the painful choices put before the modern-day not skinny person.  To stick to the calorie restrictions of the day, or indulge in the joys of eating a Hawaiian Mochi.  To those not in the know about Hawaiian Mochi, it's very, very similar to Filipino bibingka, which would be a national Filipino dessert, if there was such a thing.  I'm sure it will never be an item worthy of being "diet friendly" but I guess really yummyful and diet friendly are mutually exclusive terms.  That's okay, gym memberships were created for the purpose of burning calories.  Hello treadmill, we will spend quite a bit of time together, since I don't quite have the willpower to resist your mochi-bibingka goodness.  A bibingka by another name, Hawaiian Mochi, you are soo worth it.
author: brenda b.

description: It definitely makes Super Mira market that much more popular with this little shop in there. I love the Coffee Crunch Cake. Go early to get a slice before they run out, and they will.
author: Juliane N.

description: Yasukochi's Sweet Stop is a little gem tucked away in Japantown's Super Mira market on Sutter Street between Buchanan and Laguna.  It is run by Thomas "Moses" Yasukochi and his wife Hatsy.  They make an assortment of treats, including guava cake and their famous coffee crunch cake.  They now have a chocolate crunch cake, chocolate cake and whipped cream covered with chocolate crunch.  Here's a cool fact:  Moses was one of the original members of the San Francisco Taiko Dojo which is the oldest and largest professional taiko group in the Western world led by Grand Master Seiichi Tanaka.  Yasukochi's Sweet Stop, 1790 Sutter Street.  415.931.8165.  Monday - Friday 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., Saturday 9:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Closed Sundays.
author: Dina B.

description: It ain't no Tartine, but I was surprised.  Most people would not imagine that a Japanese shop would make a good cake, but they do.  We got the coffee crunch cake.  Although a tad on the sweet side, it was still soft and moist, a day later after it had been sitting overnight in the freezer.    I would say the rating for this small-hole-in-the-wall-side-mom-and-pop-shop-bakery speaks for itself.  Its a must try for anyone, one of a kind bakery.
author: Clifford C.

description: This Japanese bakery is inside of Super Mira Market...on the right side as you enter the market. Coffee Crunch Cake is what they are famous for. $3 a piece. It's huge and should be shared by 2 people. It has a good combo of crunchiness and stickiness from the candy toppings on the cake. After a few bites, it gets too sweet for my taste but still delicious! Best to compliment with a cup of coffee or milk. They also have Chocolate Crunch Cake and Lemon Crunch Cake. I'll have to try these next time. By the way, the lady owner is super friendly and nice...always a plus!
author: Jeanie K.

description:
We strolled into Super Mira Supermarket just to see what they offered but suprisingly there was a bakery inside. Bf was very anxious to try a slice of their cake and I hesitated. As Toro E pointed out, the counter and the cakes don't look appealing at all and certainly not screaming attention although the color of the strawberry cream is in a horrifying shocking pink which screamed attention! I asked bf if he was sure he wanted something from there, he insisted, ok, there is no stopping him. Lord and behold when we brought the slice home, it tasted so good, I didn't want to share the heavenly goodness! Not with bf and not with anyone! My gawd.....it was so soft and spongy, not overly sweet and just fresh with bits of strawberry! 
We went for a returned visit and bought the coffee crunch cake and chocolate vanilla slice and they were all divine! I started noticing all their newspaper cutting and ads plastered on the walls nearby, that they had all these ads and great writeups! 

Lesson learned: Never be weary of unappealing bakeries! :) Never know until you taste some.
author: Yan M.

description:
This really IS the best coffe cake ever.  I ordered a coffee cake for our Christmas Eve dinner and it was a big hit!  Get there early to get your own slice or place an order for the whole cake, you won't be disappointed.  The cake rolls are also excellent, my favorite is the chocolate with strawberry filling.  

(Make sure you bring cash, I think the bakery only accepts cash.)
author: L C.

description: More like a 4.5, but I'll round up. The coffee crunch cake and chocolate strawberry roll takes the cake. The quality is much like what you might expect in Tokyo, fresh, soft pillowy and not too sweet. Cream in the roll is like having strawberry ice cream. Though good, the chocolate crunch cake was a tad too sweet and the passionfruit cake didn't have much passionfruit taste. I have seen both owners, old man and old woman service customers, and I think their personalities balance out, and both hardworking.  Don't miss out on this treat. Oh and go early, they run out of coffee crunch slices for the day as early as 11am.
author: Peachie Y.

description:
The crunch cakes here are delicious.  Coffee, lemon, chocolate...they're ALL good.

If they ever make a bacon crunch cake, I'll take the day off work and make a beeline to SF to pick up a slice!
author: T L.

description: Yes I have no shame. I rather be late to work than miss out some cake. And what damn good cake it was. The delicious aromas hit me as soon as I hit the door and I knew I was at the right place.  The cake was filled with all sorts of goodies. Danishes , cakes and cookies,oh my ! I chose a slice of cake that was layered with whip cream and topped with crunchy bits. Also a slice of apple tart. I couldn't wait to get to get to work to tear the sucker open. Oh yeah! From a scale of 1 to ten, the crunchy cake was 10+++++ . The apple cake unfortunately had frozen bits of fruit , but I sensed its potential.
author: Sophia C.

description: OK... I went to this place because of all the yelp reviews. This is no joke, everyone is right That koffee krunch cake is awesome! We walked by the glass counter debating on if we would be able to eat a whole cake or not.... there was only three of us. Now do you think that three people can finish one whole cake? Now do you think we cared? Nah! We bought a whole cake..... I think our mouths were watering the whole car ride home. It was the last koffee krunch cake of the day and we didn't want to give it up! I highly recommend this bakery. The cake was delicious.... very dense. The frosting is to die for and the koffee krunch bits.... WOW! It looks like such a sweet cake, but it really isn't. It really does hit the spot. I do want to come here again to try the other cakes.... definitely worth a few extra pounds.
author: carebear l.

description: COFFEEE CRUNCH IS SOOOOO GOOOOOD! i'm getting the cake for my birthday ^___^ i also had the strawberry and guava cake and EVERYTHING IS SO GOOD! $2.95 a slice, $24.50 for the whole coffee crunch cake. YUM! The bakery is actually really small and inside of a supermarket. The lady who works there is SO nice, and she always smiles :) I love people who smile!
author: M J.

description: The chocolate roll cake with plain whipped cream is ridiculously delicious.  In a pinch, the lemon cake will do, but I am seriously haunted by that whipped cream.
author: erika s.

description: Anybody who says anyone who works here is "grumpy" or "rude" is plainly an idiot. You will never see happier people anywhere on Earth, and the products they make reflect that in their perfect simplicity. Don't take it out on the owners just because they ran out of food before you and your fat kids found a place to park your Hybrid Hummer.
author: Nicholas J.

description:
as long as i can remember, my family has been getting cakes from here.  my photos from the early 80s indicate it was a sweet stop cake, for those memories that i was too young to remember.

it's always been the custard cake with strawberries.  and back in the day, when strawberries weren't in season, it would be tangerines.  but now with our global economy, strawberries are always available . . . the custard cake with strawberries is the standout winner.

as also mentioned the guava cake is also quite good, but the coffee cake is a true out of the box superstar.  im not sure they have the custard/strawberry combo available normally or if its just a special order item only.  

needless to say, i will be getting all of my cakes here for as long as they are in business.  the couple that owns this shop is very cute, and very very friendly.  if you're a local to SF, they probably know you, or know someone who knows you.  they're extremely friendly and always bring a smile to my face.  this is the definition of what a local cake shop should be.
author: Jason J.

description: I love the lady who runs this store!  She totally reminds me of my grandma...super sweet, very gracious and constantly trying to stuff me with delicious food.  I tried the guava cake and the lemon crunch cake.  The guava was my favorite with its hot-pink guava jelly on top on fluffy cake.  I liked the lemon crunch as well, but the crunch got to be a bit too sweet for me.  Definitely a cute place to stop and buy some sweets to enjoy out in the peace plaza on a sunny day.  (P.S. Bring your own fork!)
author: Krystle S.

description:
"If your expectations are great enough, you will always be disappointed."
There are only a few things in life that your expectations are truly met. I'd say, true love, your first born, and maybe your first grandchild. And now, this coffee crunch cake from Yasukochi's Sweet Stop.
The first time I had this cake was in 2001, when I was a freshman in college. One of my buddies in my dorm who grew up in San Francisco brought in a cake for his Birthday. He said he has always had this cake for his birthday and that it came from a hole in a wall place.
I had a slice and I was in love. I was never a cake person, though I've always had a sweet tooth. The cake, it was everything that a good cake should be. Sponge cake itself was moist, soft but not too soft. The whipped cream was fresh, milky, creamy and most importantly not sweetened. That was the most surprising thing to me, the unsweetened whipped cream made the cake so amazing. And the coffee crunch. Oh the coffee crunch. Crispy, crunchy, chewy. Coffee and toffee. When mixed with the whipped cream, it was a dream combination.
I eventually lost contact with that friend and I never got the name of the place, only that the cake was covered in yellow coffee crunch and had un-sweetened cream. The cake itself came in a pink bakery box and sold in a "hole-in-the-wall" place somewhere in San Francisco. Great.
And so my great search began. I went from old China Town (Eastern Bakery - coffee crunch was too small and dark brown. No coffee crunch in the layers of the cake) to new China Town (Schubert's - Coffee crunch cake was basically a regular cake with coffee crunch in the layers. The cakes they bake came in white boxes with a see-through top.Great cake, but not THE cake) Japan Town to Little Italy. Nothing. Over the years, my mind grew tired of searching and kind of assumed Schubert's was the one. But truth be told, in the back of my mind, I knew it couldn't be the one. There was just too many inconsistencies, too many loose ends. But what could I do? In a city FILLED to the gills with "hole-in-the-wall" bakeries and not to mention San Francisco was home to Blum's THE originator of the Coffee Crunch cake. The search would probably consume the rest of my life.
Fast forward to 2008:
My girl friend, somehow, some way found a small place called Yasukochi's Sweet Stop Bakery in Japan Town. She asked me could this be the one. This place was small, in fact it didn't even have a store. It's INSIDE a small grocery market on the corner of Sutter and Buchanan (Super Mira's) It's a stand maybe 6' wide at the corner of this small discreet store. In my original search, I literally walked by this store without looking in.
Well, long story short. This is THE cake. Just the way I remembered. Pink box, hole in the wall, covered in yellow coffee crunch, and that oh-so-good unsweetened, fresh whipped cream.
It's funny that finding this cake reminded me of a lot of related/unrelated things that happened in the past 7 years. All the people I've told my crazy cake finding expedition story to. All the people I've asked about "the coffee crunch cake covered in coffee crunch that came in a pink box from a hole in the wall bakery". All the people I've given Schubert's business cards to.(Sorry to all those people, THIS is the place.) At the end of this crazy story, sitting in front of me is a pink bakery box, and in it, is an 8" round cake. This simple cake probably only took a couple of hours to make, but it took me 7 years to find.
Yes folks, if your expectations are great enough, you'll eventually find the one that you've been searching for.
author: Foodatarianism L.

description: Awesome coffee crunch!!  have tried several times and each time it tastes same great!!  Don't try lemon one, it was soso compared to coffee flavor.
author: Matt W.

description: Me want Coffee Crunch Cake! *nom nom nom nom*  I've never actually been to Sweet Stop myself but my sister has brought home their Coffee Crunch Cake a few times and I was in heaven each time.  The cake is so moist and light, the caramel on the outside is so crunchy and chewy, and the coffee creme is just perfect.  I'm drooling looking at the pictures right now.  Gimme, gimme, gimme!!
author: Katelynn L.

description:
for the first time in my life i was sad i don't like coffee flavored desserts! that coffee crunch cake looked deviously good! luckily i didn't have to gamble with the coffee crunch because they have so many other cakes to tempt me!

i ended up getting the chocolate cake with the strawberry whip cream center. yeah...it was good. it was really good. the chocolate cake was light and spongy and the strawberry whip cream was light and full if real strawberry goodness. it was pure bliss.

next time i'm going back to try the guava cake, and if i'm brave enough face my coffee-dessert issue.
author: rachel c.

description: So, everyone knows about the amazing crunch cakes. And it's true, it's super amazing. The chocolate crunch cake is my personal favorite, but the coffee crunch cake is a very close second. What you don't hear about is the really really good onigiri that they have in the back! And that sells out really quickly, so if you get to Yasukochi's too late, it'll be gone. Plus, it doesn't hurt my wallet, and that's always a pro :)
author: Deena H.

description: I special ordered their coffee crunch cake with mocha instead of white cake inside -- the best of both worlds!
author: Peng A.

description:
got my mummy an assortment for her bday....

lemon crunch..a ok but too candy sweet. Coffee crunch still reign supreme.
mocha roll...absolutely fabulous. 
strawberry rol with real strawberriesl....the regular had a powder suger crust, skip it and get the chocolate strawberry roll instead.
puff pastries with strawberry...skip, mostly whip cream.
author: Lynn T.

description: This place has always been a favorite of mine since I can remember! The eclairs are to die for if you can get there in time to buy them. Their strawberry chocolate jelly rolls are not to be missed either. Japantown is always a treat to go back to because of Sweet Stop!
author: Christina N.

description: The Coffee Crunch Cake is the best here -- this is the same Blum's cake that was sold when it on Market Street for those who rememmber it.  You can't just have one piece of thie delicious cake-- always a favorite birthday cake for the family gatherings.  We always fighting over the coffe crunch crumbs.
author: Zoe P.

description: coffee crunch cake with swt lil old ladies running the place. order early because it always sells out.
author: Karen H.

description:
have been shopping @ super mira's for over 10 years & never really checked out the sweet stop........

came here to get  an 8-inch of "THE COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE" for my mom's birthday after reading all those yelp reviews.  i was disappointed to find that it was REALLY TOOOOO SWEET (the coffee crunch toffee covering the cake) (oh &  i have a serious sweet tooth)...........the cake itself was moist & light & the whip cream was creamy & light.........  great concept........... would be a really good cake if they could take the sweetness down a couple of notches.........or not bring home half of the left over cake to eat all by myself .........or should have tried with some strong coffee or green tea to balance out the sweetness.......  i  definitely will come back to get a slice, but not a whole cake.........
author: Cindi N.

description: Really delicious coffee crunch cake takes it all!  Lemon crunch wins second place and guava is third.  The owners are sweet like their cakes, and they have such good customer service over the phone too!
author: Diane A.

description:
I used to have Blum's coffee crunch cake on my birthday--had not had it since Blum's closed so was excited to try the one from this bakery after so many decades of deprived birthdays.  I ordered it in advance and spent several hours driving there and back, hassled with traffic, parking, etc.   Got the cake home and it was delicious, as good as Blum's.  The service at the bakery was very polite and efficient and the price ($26 for 8" cake) was right.  
BUT I give it only 3 stars because while the cake had the heavenly crunchy coffee delicious stuff on the top, they had forgotten to put any on the sides!  Awwwww! I was disappointed!  
I will go back for more, however.
author: Cuteshoes F.

description: I've gone here three times now, twice they were closed and not on day that's listed as their official day off. I realize it's a small business, but at the very least they could leave a message on an answering machine stating their operating hours if they're gonna open and close as they please not according to their listed hours so that when their customers call they'll get the message instead of assuming their busy. I've had their cake before, for a friends birthday, it was delicious. I was very excited to purchase a cake for my cousin and my mom's birthday. I called to try and place the order, no answer. I assumed they were busy since it's a small bakery. At some point, I drive over there, twice, different days, same week. I am no longer excited. I am annoyed as hell and not going back. I've wasted enough of my gas and my time.
author: Gaile C.

description:
i am addicted to you, lemon cream roll.

unfortunately, you are bad for my hips and my thighs.

pity.
author: eve l.

description:
i used to work at this bakery back in high school. so lets get some things straight:
1.  hatsy and mo are the sweetest and hardest working people i know.
2.  EVERYTHING IS DELICIOUS
3.  you should try everything.  seriously.
every time i get back to the city, the pake, a slice of chiffon, the sprinkle cookies, and of course, THE COFFEE CRUNCH CAKE are a must.  goodbye diet, hello Yumtown, USA.

watching mo make all the cakes from scratch and hatsy decorating and hand-piping all the orders gave me a HUGE appreciation for what GREAT cakes taste like.  and what i'm willing to pay to get that kind of quality.
author: Karina U.

description: One day, I'll have the willpower to resist the Coffee Crunch Cake....maybe...
author: Aila L.

description: Randomly found out about this place.  After reading the reviews here, I knew I had to come.  Finally got a chance to right as they were closing shop, so couldn't get their famous coffee crunch cake.  So, I settled for their white roll with strawberry filling.  Before I go on, I must state that I am not a huge cake fan, especially of those roll cakes.  But, OMG, this one was SO GOOD!  The strawberry filling was so fresh and rich yet surprisingly light at the same time.  It totally reminded me of the Haagen-Daaz strawberry ice cream.  The man behind the counter told us that we should've reserved the coffee crunch cake if we wanted to try it.  I am totally gonna do it one of these days.  Only gripe--Can't u stay open longer or make more of your famous cakes for us people who can only come after work?
author: sarisha h.

description: Hands down, my favorite bakery in all of San Francisco.  I grew up eating coffee crunch cake, and family occasions just WOULD NOT be the same without it.  Hatsy and Mo (the owners) are so friendly and helpful that they make you feel like you're ordering from your Grandma or really nice Auntie.  Everything is freshly made every day.  My personal favorite is the chocolate cake with strawberry filling, and the Strawberry Pake-yellow cake with vanilla custard filling, topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.  Definitely the underdog to the mighty coffee crunch cake that everyone loves.
author: asia c.

description: Just wanted to chime in that the coffee crunch cake is amazing. My favorite dessert by far. If you have an event or party, call the day ahead and have them make it in cake form.  $32 for the cake version and worth every cent.
author: Leonard S.

description: Oh crazy coffee crunch cake.  So hard to describe, it has a kind of Asian-white cake interior and the outside is a sweet oh-so-sweet shell.  I have no idea what the shell is made of, looks like peanut brittle but it's not.  Their chocolate cookies weren't bad either!  The whole cake cost a little under $25 and serves about 15 people.
author: Mark D.

description: Definitely worth buying the Coffee Crunch!!  I get it for family bdays and everyone just wonders in aww about how good they feel about the taste and texture of this awesome cake.  Try it and you'll see what I mean.  I have relatives still asking about this cake to this day and when I will bring some!  mmmm mmmm  GOOD!!
author: Rommel M.

description: Stopped by this place after lunch to get some cake to go after reading the rave reviews on yelp. Price was very good at $8.00 something for three different slices: I got one of the coffee crunch, one lemon crunch, and one coffee roll. Service was good also, a kind woman took our order with a smile. The sponge was pretty good (although not excellent), but I felt the crunch part and the cream was a little too sweet for my taste. Still, an excellent value and good place to get some sweets if you are close by.
author: Orie M.

description:
I went to the sweet shop for the coffee crunch cake.  it was featured on eye on the bay on channel 5.  they reviewed it as THE place to go for coffee crunch cake in the entire bay area.  My girlfriend loves coffee crunch cake.  she usually gets it at schuberts usually, but she wanted to try this one because it was new and shes never heard of it before.  So on one of my days off from work, I take her there, but it was getting late.  It was almost 6 by the time we got to the shop, we found a good parking spot (though i had to make an illegal U turn to get a spot right in front), we rush to try to find the place (we didnt know it was inside the market), as soon as we get in, the person prior got the last piece of the day.  my girlfriend was pretty sad and disappointed so she got some other types of cake.  though it didnt really satisfy her taste buds for coffee crunch cake, she said it was pretty good.
a few weeks pass since that incident.  She kept telling me she wanted the coffee crunch cake almost daily.  So one day I drop her off at work, then i went to japantown to buy this cake.  By the time she had gotten out of work, I had 2 pieces of the cake ready for her.  she was pretty excited about it.  She really liked the cake, but said it would only be occasional that she would eat it.  I thought it was a little sweet, but i hardly eat any sweets in general, so it might have just been me.  But I would definately get another one because i enjoyed it a lot.  I rarely eat cake, but i can eat this one to my satisfaction.  The service is good too. the ladies are nice and surprisingly good with english.
author: Tony L.

description:
yes, the coffee crunch is super delish.  but hulagirl must throw out big love for the guava passionfruit (guava lilikoi for those from my 'hood) cake from yasukochi.  liliha bakery in honolulu used to make a cake like this and it was my birthday cake every year during small kid time so maybe i'm just wistful for the good ol' days.

i think not.

the guava passionfruit cake is divine: light and tangy but still buttery and delicious.  the frosting is perfection and the flavors are fresh.  i'm sure you can't go wrong with any of the cakes here but this one always rocks my casbah.
author: nic f.

description: I give these wonderful people 4 stars because their cakes are to die for! Taste great, and very fresh. My family, generation after generation have been getting our cakes here eversince I was knee-high...custom orders are great..give them a few days for that. Cash and personal checks only. They have tasty pastries as well.
author: Smooth R.

description: I want me some Lemon Crunch and Coffee Crunch cake... Why must I work everyday and why am I too lazy to wake up early on the weekends! =(... yum yuumm cake. Sweet lady at the counter, the man's a lil grumpy, but I forgive him.
author: Mina T.

description:
I was invited to a friends house and decided I should bring something fattening.  I did a generic search for pastry and cake and found Yasukochi's Sweet Stop.  I had seen a short segment on tv about this place last year and thought I'd give them a try (it was this or several goodies from Tartine).  

After reading a few of the reviews I thought it was best I arrive early so I didn't miss out on the infamous Coffee Crunch Cake.   We were very lucky and found a space less than a block away.  It also helped that it was Friday around 11am.
