Wandering in, we found the bakery just as someone had mentioned; turn right as you enter the market.  We bought 1 whole cake for the party and 5 slices to try with my folks.  For them, we picked the strawberry in yellow and chocolate sponge roll, the guava, the lemon crunch and coffee crunch. 

When we dropped it off to them, I had to sample a bite of everything but the coffee crunch.  The strawberry in both yellow and chocolate was YUMMY; very moist sponge cake with strawberry cream that wasn't super sweet.  The lemon crunch was ok.  It wasn't overly sweet and it was moist.  I was HORRIBLY disappointed with my guava slice though.  It tasted like it was left sitting in the fridge for 3 days - the cream and the spongy layer was so hard that I spat it out.  

After dinner, three of us tried the coffee crunch cake.  We all agreed it was good but too sweet and a few of the crunch pieces tasted stale while others were very crunchy.  No one had seconds and no one wanted to take the cake home.  

Overall, I was disappointed.   If I go back, I'm going to stick with the strawberry sponge rolls.
author: Angie C.

description: coffee crunch cake is hella good. only buy the whole cake for an occasion or big groups. i bought the whole cake for just my  boyfriend and i... we finished half on the first day. next day it just wasn't that great anymore. so please eat it fresh and super COLD! next time i will buy slices of all variety
author: A L.

description: The coffee crunch cake is to die for! I've brought it to many parties, and it is always a hit!! Absolutely delicious! Not over poweringly sweet at all! You must try it! Make sure you call in earlier to reserve, cuz they sell out quickly!
author: Connie H.

description: this review is just for the series of crunch cakes. lemon crunch cake and chocolate crunch cake. i haven't tried the infamous coffee crunch cake because they ran out. but damn these cakes might be the best cakes i've ever tried! they are light and not too sweet. and the candy outside is crazy awesome.
author: Regina C.

description: we came here because my friend ordered a coffee crunch cake for my other friend's birthday.  yes, the cake was just for 3 of us. we got back to the office and sliced up the cake. i m not a fan of coffee but i am glad i gave this cake a try! IT'S SOOOO GOOD! i can't believe it!!! writing this review just makes me want more!!!... and which is why i need to end the review now... cuz it's just that good... please, go get a slice or a cake... you WON'T regret it...
author: Kapo T.

description: This place has the best cakes.  The coffee crunch cake, lemon crunch cake and the chocolate with fresh strawberries and whip cream.  They  are are the bomb.  The best thing is that the cakes aren't too sweet but just right.  Everytime I come here, I can't make up my mind.  So, what I do is get a slice of each cake they have and endulge!
author: Susan W.

description:
Stopped by Japantown really late in the afternoon hoping that a slice of coffee crunch cake was left for me to try, I was disappointed to find no pieces left (I should have known). The sweet little lady told me the coffee crunch toppings were available but no more slices. I bought the guava slice instead which was spectacular, but I HAD to try the coffee cake. Going through who I was going to share with, I opted and bought the entire coffee cake, which definitely was the best idea I had all day. The cake was fantastically covered with coffee crunch bits and light whipped cream and moist cake. Every bite was joy. I do admit the cake was bit on the sweeter side, but what do you expect from yummy gooey goodness! 

They had different cakes available that I will definitely go back to try.
author: Lily L.

description:
Coffee Crunch Cake! Coffee Crunch Cake! 

After reading the other reviews, I realize that for decades, i've never tried that many things at Sweet Stop. i always fall for the CCC. Must try other ones.

The Yasukochi's are SOOOOO nice. (And I mean genuinely nice, not fake nice.)  If only more people in the world were like them.
author: C K.

description: I grew up in San Francisco and now live in the Sacramento Valley. We come to San Francisco often for family events, etc. This past weekend, I threw a surprise party for my husband's 40th birthday at a local San Francisco Restaurant and bar and wanted to order a cake from San Francisco as well. My husband loves anything haupia so I googled haupia cake in San Francisco and Yasukochi's Sweet Stop was the only one that made haupia cake. I decided to give it try without a tasting it. I got lucky! All I can say is that the haupia cake is absolutely ONOlicious!!!! That was the best cake ever!!! This is the city's best kept secret.
author: Myra E.

description:
I had heard lots of good things about this Sweet Shop, so I went ahead and ordered my best friend a "Pake" strawberry birthday cake.  She is half Japanese so I thought she would really enjoy it.   I asked that I be able to pick it up at 9:30AM the following week.  However, the day before I picked up the cake, I called them to change the pickup time to 1PM.  Then I had to call them back that same day to change it back to 9:30AM because my friend wouldn't be around in the afternoon to receive her cake.  

I called the sweet shop to let them know that I had to change the order back to a morning pickup.  The woman who answered said that the cake pickup time could not be changed back to the morning.  I asked her nicely how they had planned to finish the cake by 9:30AM for my original order, and instead of answering me, she handed the phone to the owner.  He was very short with me and said that I could not have the cake because he was getting an order of strawberries delivered tomorrow morning.  I asked him what other options there were for a birthday cake, and he told me, with a very rude tone, that he didn't know and that I'd just have to find out when I arrived there the next day.  We went back and forth with him refusing to give me any options to choose from for a cake.  And when I asked how I was supposed to order a cake without knowing what type of cakes were available, he said "oh well".  He then said that  I couldn't have a cake by 9:30AM.  I told him I never specified 9:30AM, just that I was hoping to get one in the morning.  Then he conceded that maybe he could have one done by 10:30AM.  So I said that would be fine, but then he said, "no, 11AM".  So I said ok, and he essentially hung up on me.

Needless to say, I called back and cancelled the order.  I don't care how good their cake is.  They have a real attitude problem, and there was no need to be so rude to a customer.  It really turned me off and I have no inclination to give people like that any business.
author: Jupiter S.

description: of course the coffee crunch cake is awesome ... but the last time i went, i tried the strawberry custard cake (the one with all the fresh strawberries on top) and it was a huge hit. i will definitely be getting that one again.
author: cynthia q.

description: Yasukochi's lives up to the hype. Their cakes are fluffy sweet creamy heaven. When I went to the address, I was a bit confused because it is actually a grocery/convenience store. After wandering around the isles for a minute, I made my way to the east side which has the bakery shop and was able to claim some delicious crunch cakes. Thanks Yelp!
author: M. W.

description: i was dieting so i bought a whole guava cake which was aiiite. the old lady and her grandson were very sweet! i really regret not getting the whole toffee crunch cake even though, my heart was telling me to. i had a pleasurable experience here so i shall be seeing you soon crunch cake!
author: coco b.

description: coffee crunch cake.. so good. it's really really really sweet but the crunch makes it all okay. i've still gotta try the guava cake - it's one of the only places to get it. (unless you're in SJ in which case.. aki's bakery!) they're really friendly here too!
author: Mel L.

description: the coffee crunch cake was such a hit at our friend's bbq.  despite desserts from schuberts and tartine, the coffee cake was the first to go.  it blew the other desserts out of the water!!  everyone raved about it!!  i cant wait to go back for more.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Ok...to be honest, the shop does not look so wonderful and their cakes, either. I was having a second thought for a second, but I decided to give it a try and got a Guava cake for a party. It surprised me with its taste. The cake and the cream are the tastes of the homemade, but the cake has the professional level of integrity as a whole. The famous Coffee Crunch Cake was sold out, so it must be very good, too. Also the lady in the shop was very friendly and nice. Try their cake and you won't regret it.
author: Charlie S.

description: Thank you Yelpers for helping me find my way to this place!  I am in search of my 2010 wedding cake and think I may have found it here!  I picked up a strawberry roll, a lemon roll, a slice of their famous coffee crunch cake, and a slice of guava cake.  The strawberry and lemon rolls were just ok.  The cake was too dry for us.  The strawberry filling was good.  Pretty pink color... The lemon filling was too sweet and too tangy at the same time... Now the coffee crunch and guava cakes are totally on another level.  The cakes and fillings were fluffy, light, and not too sweet.  The coffee bits topping are not hard candy hard but rather has this airy lightness that's not overpoweringly sweet.  Everyone of us loved both cakes.  My sister is calling the shop tomorrow to order the coffee crunch cake for her daughter's birthday this weekend!  Cash only and pay attention when looking for this little gem or else you may pass it up like I did the first time (as it's located inside a grocery store).
author: Amy T.

description: tried the guava cake and it wasnt that great. my friends chocolate cake with strawberry cream was awesome though.
author: cindy L.
